name: Around the World Fluxx
description:
Fluxx is a card game in which the cards themselves determine the current rules of the game. By playing cards, you change numerous aspects of the game: how to draw cards, how to play cards, and even how to win.

At the start of the game, each player holds three cards and on a turn a player draws one card, then plays one card. By playing cards, you can put new rules into play that change numerous aspects of the game: how many cards to draw or play, how many cards you can hold in hand or keep on the table in front of you, and (most importantly) how to win the game.

Around the World Fluxx uses the basic gameplay of Fluxx, but now you're on visiting famous landmarks around the globe. Discover man-made wonders across all seven continents, from Stonehenge to the Taj Mahal, including the Galápagos Islands, Panama Canal, Angkor Wat, and the Statue of Liberty.

Around the World Fluxx offers a bonus mini-timeline game and can be combined with Across America Fluxx for double the bucket list fun!

name: D-Day Operation Overlord
description:
Recreate the greatest military landing in history, " The Allies versus Germany's Atlantic Wall" in World War Two.

Use your battle and equipment cards to out smart your opponent, win battles to win the vital beaches, make the best of events and your contact cards to seal the fate of Europe in 1944.

Who will be victorious?

This is a two player game and takes place over the 5 key beaches on D-Day. Each beach players will fight 7 battles in an attempt to win the current beach card.

For each battle, players will place one battle card and if desired one equipment card face down. Once both players are happy they are revealed and players work out their final score.

Event cards can also influence your cards and will be taken into account when working out your scores. Each battle one, two or three event cards can be revealed.

Players will also have contact cards consisting of luck, fear, initiative and bravery which can also help you.

The player with the highest score wins that battle and whoever wins the most battles wins the current beach card. The first player to win 3 beach cards wins the game.

Try and work out what your opponent is going to do, what card order did they use last beach, use your contact cards to stack the odds in your favour.

-description from designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Memory, World War II

name: MLB Full Count Baseball
description: You're the manager playing against your division rivals, selecting pitches, organizing batting lineups, and developing a winning strategy. Each at bat begins with a 3-2 count and one pitch decides the outcome of the play. Full Count Baseball features exciting scenarios, including stolen bases, double plays and pickoffs. The game features four logoed game pieces for all MLB teams. The game board resembles a real ball park with fans in the stands and dugouts. A dry-erase scoreboard and marker are also included. Instructions are simple and easy to learn for players of all ages.

name: Pandoria: Extra Realms Tableaus
description:
Two Bonus-Tableaus/Extra Realms Tableaus were given out at SPIEL '18 at the Irongames booth 2-B103 when buying the base game.

These two extra boards that were given out with the base game at Essen have only a "B"-side. (the back side have the rules for the board).

You are supposed to shuffle them with the other "B"-side boards and deal one each randomly to each player.

Nymphs
Nymphs are the spirits of the mountains, trees, meadows and lakes, but are not always bound to them.
You start with 7 crystals, 4 gold and 2 wood.
Special ability: if the scored region consists of at least 4 spaces and you are involved in the scoring, you will receive +3 of the scored resource or +1 glory point.

Hanbok
A Hanbok is a Korean tiger in a traditional Korean dress.
You start with 3 crystals, 3 gold and 6 wood.
Special ability: if you close a region in which there were opponent's figures, instead of returning them to their reserves, place them in your own reserve as "captives". Each of these figures is worth one point for you at the end of the game.
Instead of placing or taking back a figure on their turn, an opponent can retrieve any number of captured figures back into his reserve. For each figure, the Hanbok receives a resource of her choice from that player.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Farming, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Magic: The Gathering – Global Series: Jiang Yanggu & Mu Yanling
description:
These Global Series decks, featuring all-new cards and characters, represent the work of Chinese writers, artists, and designers, created for Chinese players but now available in the United States.

The box contains two ready-to-play decks of Magic: The Gathering.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: República Bananera
description:
Republica Bananera is a party game created using black Spanish humour.

In this party game the President of the Republica Bananera will pick a red card with a blank space and other players will then choose and play a punchline card to fill in the blank. If their card is chosen they become the new Presidents of the Republica Bananera. If you are chosen 7 times you will be able to raise as a dictator and win the game

name: Der kleine Ritter Trenk
description:
Trenk from Tausendschlag, son of a serf, wants to become a knight. So he walks to the town, accompanied by his little pig, and has some adventures.

In the game, the player rolls a die, and moves either Trenk or his piglet (or rises the flag). If he lands on some dragon baby teeth, he can solve a task to gain them. There are 3 kinds of tasks:

- He tries to memorize the details of the current four robbers. A small change is made, and he must recognize which robber was changed
- He has to hit something with the pea sling
- A card with a medieval detail is revealed. The player has to find that exact thing within the big detailed image in a short time (the card with the image contains a lot of background information, too)

A player wins when he has collected 7 baby dragon teeth. The game ends premature if the flag reaches the top of the flagpole.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Medieval, Memory
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 12 Parsecs
description:
Will you take off from your planet before the supernova?

In 12 Parsecs, players simultaneously use rolled dice to build their ships, train cadets, and gather fuel.

On your turn, three dice are rolled. Two are used to form two numbers, which fill in spaces on ships to build them, although the numbers must ultimately fit in ascending order. The unused die is then used to build academies or fuel stations to produce more supplies to get the ships running. Smaller ships are finished faster, but need more supplies, while larger ships are worth many more points but need a lot of turns to get going. Once one player builds three of their five ships, the game ends, and players score based on their completed ships, incomplete ships, and surplus supplies.

As a roll-and-write, players will use the same dice as part of their turn, but each player will take different paths to victory.

This game was the winner of the 2020 Design Machine contest under the theme 'social distancing'.
categories: Dice, Number, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Éjszaka az Állatkertben
description: You rub your eyes and look around. It's cold and dark. Where are you? You quickly realize that you have appeared in the zoo at night! Walking in the crisp snow, you recognize the entrance with its polar bears, the lake and the big rock, but the animals are nowhere to be seen. Instead, you meet a variety of different creatures. One of them turns to you to ask for your help. You must carry out a mission for which you are given a map showing a part of the zoo in detail. Based on this, and going via certain points in the zoo, you need to reach the final stage of your mission. The task seems easy, but the strange creatures that pop up and the blizzard howling around you make it difficult to navigate. Fortunately, if you listen carefully and manage to memorise all the stops on your journey, you can succeed in your mission. Meanwhile, the others are also wandering around the zoo. Which of you will achieve your goal first?

name: Nemesis: Retaliation – Xyrians Expansion
description:
The Xyrians are independent faction that brings a whole new dimension to your gameplay, blending unpredictability with strategic depth.

They operate independently, creating dynamic scenarios that can shift the tide of your mission. What is more, you will be able to use this new race together with all the other races from Retaliation!

Xyrians are the third additional party to the whole situation happening in Retaliation. Sometimes, they might be your unpredicted ally, sometimes your worst enemy. This mysterious, technologically advanced race has its own goals that will create a lot of exciting situations.

Xyrians are creatures that resemble octopuses, and they have an advanced blending technology that lets them hide in plain view. This is why, during the game with Xyrian, you will be adding their Tokens - but you can never be sure whether this is only an old trace or an actual Xyrian until you step into this room and investigate. Or some random Primeblood may do that for you.

With this race a series of unique serious wounds are introduced! They will not only deal "standard" damage but also perform unique attacks. Imagine being caught in a Xyrian net, losing precious time as you struggle to free yourself, being poisoned with an unknown substance that makes you weaker for a few rounds, or gaining a special marker that will cause all Xyrians to slowly but consequently hunt your Marine. These events definitely add new challenges and some extra narrative depth to your Retaliation missions.

Also, you must be aware that successfully defeating a Xyrian is a rare and challenging feat. But those who manage it are rewarded with exceptionally rare artifacts (i.e., Weapons, Armor, or some precious Items), adding a tantalizing incentive to engage with this new threat. You know the saying – high risk, high reward.

With the Xyrians in play, exploring the depths of the unknown facility becomes even more intriguing. Each step into the unknown carries new possibilities and dangers. Not that it was easy and predictable before, but with this new breed, it's like the merrier, the more challenging!

They introduce some strategic manipulation to the game! There are possible conflicts between the Xyrians and other alien races, which can be used to your advantage. So, it is likely (not very much, but still possible) that the Xyrians will eliminate as many Primebloods as possible. Their goals will be different with every game. They might aim to infiltrate the Nest, target the most wounded player, or try to hunt down the Queen. Generally, each encounter with the Xyrians feels fresh and challenging and will bring some twists to your game!

—description from the Gamefound campaign
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Dune: The Art of Kanly
description:
In this game of bluffing and deception, players try to gain influence over the different factions of the Dune universe.
These factions (The Bene Gesserit, Fremen, Bene Tleilax, Ix, Sardaukar, Mentats, Suk doctors, Landsraad and Spacing Guild) are represented by face down cards, of which each player is dealt 2 at the start of the game and which give access to special actions.

Dune: The Art of Kanly is played out in a sequence of turns in which players use these special actions by claiming to have the necessary face down faction cards (This claim needn't be truthful and players can "bluff" ownership of any card they wish to use). The claims may in return be challenged by other players and some actions may also be countered. Players whose bluffs are revealed or players who falsely accuse another player of bluffing pay a penalty.

The game is won by either being the last player to have any face down cards or to be the first player to own 13 Spice.

In a special turn of events players may also negotiate for a shared victory using an "allied victory" ability available to all players.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Political, Print & Play

name: Bariesus
description:
Players take the role of Bariesus, powerful mages capable of manipulating the four elements. Players must conquer territories through combat, driven by cards. The mages can summon armies of air, earth, water, and fire, as well as different spells, and the combat is ultimately defined by the played cards.
Conquered territories give taxes, and the money is needed to hire mercenaries.
The game is over when a player conquers a given number of territories or, if nobody has won in 20 turns, the God Kasdail destroys the universe.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Take That

name: Fray
description:
Set in the vibrant fantasy world of Adia, Fray is a fast-paced 1 vs. 1 card game where players fight for control over a battlefield. The game is quick to learn, a blend of strategy and hand management, and it all fits in one little box.

Each copy of Fray comes with:

30 playable cards—featuring the Dwarvish, Duanine, and Bjorn suits.
8 instructional cards—a set for each player.
1 placement card—to establish the 3x3 grid battlefield before the game begins.

When playing, unit placement is one of the most important aspects in a game of Fray. Consider not just which unit card you'll play, but also where on the battlefield you’ll place it! You have a limited number of units and if you’re not careful, your opponent may be able to turn your units against you. Luckily, you can do the same to them!

Rounds take on average just 5-10 minutes once you've learned the rules, and the game is easy to both set up and pack away.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Zone of Control

name: 3 Kings: set di espansioni
description: A set of three additional elements for the card-game 3 Kings that will increase the challenge for the supremacy within the Kingdom of Ghimel. La Plancia dei Caduti (The Dashboard of the Fallen), which is basically an improved scoring board to calculate the points/penalties during the fallen count; il Registro delle Missioni (The Mission Register), which adds further scoring options within each turn; la Tavola del Gran Consiglio (The Grand Council Table), which adds an extra-phase for 5+ players.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Fantasy, Medieval, Negotiation, Political
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order, Voting

name: Heavy Steam: Pilot Expansion
description: Freshly recruited and spoiling for a fight, expand your tactical options with twenty four custom pilot cards!
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Superfight: Fortress Mode
description:
New gameplay mode for Superfight: Argue to defend the most ridiculous fortress you can imagine from invaders.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: PatagoMar
description:
In PatagoMar, players collect sets of fish in order to advance around a victory point track.
In your turn, you can ask another player for a certain type of fish in their hand (which you must also have at least one card of). If the asked player has this kind of fish, they have to give you all cards of that kind. Keep asking players until they say no; then draw a card from the pile - if it matches your request, you can still continue asking.

At the end of your round, you can decide to discard sets of the same fish to receive the points printed on the respective cards. Move your pawn forward accordingly - the first player to complete a lap, wins the game.

name: YIKES!
description:
Werewolf for 2 players? That's impossible right?
Not if you play YIKES! The deduction card game for 2 players.

YIKES! Captures the feeling of Saturday morning cartoons and replacing running around in circles, with putting your deduction skills to the test. Awaken your inner "meddling kid" and unmask your opponent.

Draw a Secret Identity Card. The card shows what type of ghoul you are and the Clue that can unmask you.
Players select Clue Cards from a row in the middle of the table.
You are allowed to pick up any Clue except the Clue shown on your Secret Identity Card. Every Clue helps you with unmasking your opponent, but also reveals a part of your secret identity. You gain 1 Candy Bar if you escape (collect 8 different Clue Cards). 1 Candy Bar if your opponent made a mistake. And 2 Candy Bars if you unmasked your opponent successfully (by giving him the right Clue Card).
Collect 5 Candy Bars and win the game.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Memory, Zombies

name: Spell Smashers: Helm of Sponsorship
description:
A promo card for Spell Smashers from several different Kickstarter campaigns including Game Boy Geek 2019 (Season 7), Tantrum House 2019 (Season 6), and the Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast 2019 Tabletop Media Bonanza Kickstarter campaign (2019 Promo Pack). A generic art version is available, but each campaign offers alternate art versions of the card as well.

Suffer no wounds when you defeat a monster. (not for solo gaming)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Word Game

name: Roll to the Top!: Duel
description:
In this 2-player variant of Roll to the Top!, the players start at opposite sides.
Instead of playing turns simultaneous, one player fills in first (the player who didn't roll the dice) and the other second.
Goal of the game is to fill the most spaces.

The sheet has 2 sides:

BATTLEFIELD: Move crisscross through the landscape to your opponent.
NAVAL BATTLE: Attack your opponent straight forward.


—description from the publisher

name: Finger weg von Mona Lisa
description:
Players are thieves or detectives. The thieves go around the Louvre trying to steal the Mona Lisa;
the detectives try to nab them. There is a cloth game board with a grid of corridors, rooms and a small matching, laminated board. The thieves write their position each move in secret on the laminated board with crayon and must reveal if a detective might have seen them (similar to Scotland Yard and Clue: The Great Museum Caper. Detectives can install cameras and thieves can disable alarms. A top quality production in a long wooden box.

name: Hurricane
description:
Hurricane is a very simple but delightful game to play. Each player (this is best played with four) has a number of houses on islands near the corners of the board. Starting in the center are two hurricanes (large pieces). On your turn, you roll for direction and distance and move one or the other hurricane as indicated (you have considerable leeway in the precise path being followed). If a hurricane hits a house, it is destroyed. Last player to have houses left wins.

You have to balance your moves between attacking other players and protecting your own pieces. Great fun.

name: Riesenflugzeugabteilungen
description:
Expansion module to Luftschiff introduces the great multi-engined bombers of the Italian, Russian, and German air forces during WWI and the Russian Civil War. Title means "Giant Aircraft Section". Ownership of Luftschiff (Airships at War 1914-1941 is required to use this expansion.

The first printing in 1993 contains only 4 aircraft: Caproni CA 4, Sikorskii LL'ya Mourometz G.3, Zeppelin Staaken R.5 and the Junkers R.1. The first edition can be identified by the picture of the Caproni CA 4 on the front cover. The 2nd edition of the expansion is the 12th Anniversary Edition. The 2nd edition is dated 2005 on the front cover and contains images of two aircraft. Four additional aircraft are included: B-25B Mitchell (Doolittle Raid), Fokker D.71, Hansa-Brandenburg CC, DFW C.5. The second edition has a greatly expanded scenario sheet as well.

Expands:

Luftschiff
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Magical Arena
description:
Magical Arena

Enter the Arena if you dare. The Magical Arena is a place where the Mortal and Athenal worlds collide and the creatures of both worlds co-exist within the same dimension.

As a Novice magic user, enter the Arena and battle it out on a hexed board using spells and mystical creatures to create clever card combinations and tactical maneuvers to outwit your opponents.

Cast incantations to materialize creatures from our collectible 54mm (28mm American) figure range into the Mortal world and use spells to turn your enemies powers against them, progressing from Novice, through to Apprentice and finally to Wizard, crushing all who dare to oppose you !

Magical Arena is the first in a series of expandable and fully compatible board games from Jeseret Games. Discover Era, the world of the Jeseret, in this first, fast moving, action packed game of magic and mastery.

name: Plumb Crazy
description: A very interesting race game where you try and connect a sink, bath tub, old-time washing machine, or fire hydrant to the water tower supply before all the rest. You get pieces to connect your piece up. First one to do so wins!
publishers: Action Games and Toys Ltd, Marx Toys

name: 5-in-a-row
description:
The deck of forty-five cards consists of seven cards of SIX suits and three wild cards. Each suit consists of three 1’s, three 2’s and one 3.

Each player is dealt five cards. On a turn a player draws or plays cards. The game is won when the discard piles read 1, 2, 3, 2, 1 all in the same color.

name: Pas de Calais
description:
This is the first game of the Westwar series. Other games using a similar system are Tide of Fortune, To the Far Shore and the Italian Campaign series (Sicily, Salerno, Anzio and Med War).

"In 1944 the Germans expected Patton to lead the cross-channel attack at Calais. They were right..." Pas de Calais features features the hypothetical Allied invasion of France at Calais in 1944, as well as the planned Allied operations "Sledgehammer" and "Roundup" of 1943, against the historical German defenses. Pas de Calais also allows for a wide variety of scenarios which players may design to their own liking.

Scale is 1-2 days/turn (variable because of the Impulse system), 3 km/hex. Units are regiments/brigades.

The game has 2 19"x27" maps, 300 counters.

The heart of the system is the Operations phase where players alternate activating formations (divisions) which execute Orders (Assault, Advance, Maneuver etc.).

Players bid for Initiative and there are possibilities for the Reaction player to foil the initiative player's moves by having units react and do spoiling attacks.

Losses can be applied to the HQ of a formation, not only directly to units.

Low counter density, high maneuver. Medium-high complexity.

name: MacArthur's War
description:
From the Microgame Design Group website:

"MacArthur's War is a simulation of the Korean War, simulating the historical campaign as well as allowing for what could have happened if MacArthur had been given the go-ahead to launch his attacks against Communist China. Players assume the roles of Douglas MacArthur, commander in chief of the United Nations forces, or the Chinese general staff. Confronted with the Korean crisis, players can manage the conflict at a limited level or escalate it into a Asian or Global showdown between the superpowers.

"The 17"x22"map (with 3/4" hexes) spans from Pusan to Harbin. The 180 9/16" counters (die-cut and back-printed) show divisional level forces of the KPA and ROK,the UN and PLA, the US and the USSR."

name: Vimieiro
description:
This is a game in the Napoleonic Battles Series covering the battle of Vimeiro on August 21st, 1808.

Fist published as a DTP game in 2004. It was later now published as a boxed game together with another NBS-game: Talavera & Vimeiro.

Napoleon Brigade Series (NBS)
- scale = 180-200 m/hex (197-219 yrd/hex);
- time = 30 min/GT (60 min/Night-GT);
- strength = 150 inf (100 cav)/SP

name: Trini
description:
The aim of the game is to get rid of your dice first. The dice have different symbols. Place the dice on the board - 3 sides can always be seen.
on each turn a player may
- place a new die
- turn a die 90 degrees
- push it on another space.
Players have to close a hole on all three sides with the same symbol on the die.
Components and board are wooden.

name: Gambio
description: Gambio is a fast paced game of gambling. Players take turns laying suited cards, with all other players trying to play cards of similar suits. Players who were able to follow suit then roll dice to see who claims the laid cards. The trick is that when laying your cards you can also lay special cards called Super Odds or Jackpot cards. Jackpot cards increase the value of the pot and Super Odds cards allow you to roll extra dice once all cards have been played. Each suit is worth a varied amount of points and once the deck has been exhausted, the player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Linguishtik
description:
Linguishtik is a creative language game using dice with letters to form words. Letters are added sequentially to a pool until one player challenges the others to form a word using just one more letter and use it in a sentence. Players earn points by correctly forming words.

The advanced game allows for "demands" to be placed on the words, such as "The word must be a noun," "the word must be plural," or "the word must begin with a vowel."

name: Siege of Leningrad:  Logistics Module I
description: Siege of Leningrad was published as a mini-sim in Issue 9 of Panzerschreck Magazine in 2002/2003. It is an abstract solitaire game where the player controls the Russian defenders of Leningrad and attempts to survive 300 game turns (30 months). The game is consists of 8 pages of rules, a 4.25 x 5.5 "map sheet", an even smaller "scoring track" which records the status of Leningrad and 29 counters. As with all Panzerschreck mini-sims, the maps and counters need to be copied, mounted on card stock and cut out before use.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Wargame, World War II

name: Quizikon
description: The players answer picture riddles.

name: Die verrückte Kette
description:
Translation of the box back:

Do you prefer to play with two or with more? Or occasionally alone?

Do you prefer an entirely tactical or strategic game? Or do you like a bit of luck or quickness?

Die verrückte Kette offers fascinating variants for the most diverse requirements.

The game principle is simple and easily learned. A plastic chain is continuously changed according to the color combinations on the card. But in a single move, a "displacement", the situation can change suddenly. It's enough to drive you mad! And a string of lucky circumstances can set off a real chain reaction.

Delightful material, simple rules, multifaceted variants...
... that's Die verrückte Kette, a chain that will captivate you.


Description:

This is set of six different games for varying numbers of players. Aside from one game (which is essentially a solitaire puzzle) they are all based on the principle of changing the arrangement of the plastic chain links to produce sections that match card patterns. There are two different ways of moving the plastic pieces - one link can be unhooked at one end and dragged to a new position, or a section of the chain can be unlinked and reversed - one of which is used in any particular game. There are also two different ways of setting up the links at the start of the game. In theory other games could be played by mixing and matching these rules and other game aspects (how stringent the pattern matching is, for example).

name: Grand Fleets
description:
From the publisher:

Grand Fleets is a comprehensive miniatures game of dreadnought-era naval warfare. In addition to rules for everything from ships to aeroplanes, Zeppelins to submarines, the rulebook includes:

Data cards for over 120 ships, plus guidelines for converting any ship of the period to game values;

Eight scenarios encompassing conflicts from the Sino-Japanese War of 1894 through the opening salvoes of World War Two, including several variants;

Fifteen pages of weapon data, covering all major gun and torpedo models in use through 1939, over 200 aeroplanes, and more than 20 airships; and
Optional rules for flotillas, night-fighting, smokescreens, and more!
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Just William Game
description:
The first part of the game consists of constructing William's house and garden fence as per the diagram on the rules. Players are then given jobs to do around the built house & surrounds.

There are two packs of cards - job cards and excuse cards.

The object of the game is to get rid of all of your jobs, climb over the garden fence and land on the "William" spot.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sahibba
description:
It is the first Malaysian version of Scrabble in Bahasa Melayu, invented in 1976. In 1978, a bi-lingual version was introduced which can be played in BM or English individually or both languages at the same time.

It is in fact the world's first invention of a bi-lingual crossword boardgame. Today, SAHIBBA is a household name and the most popular Scrabble in Malaysia.

name: Race to the Vistula
description: An intermediate complexity simulation of the Soviet offensive against the German Army Group North-Ukraine from July 1944 to August 1944. Published in Panzerschreck #14. Typical Attack-Defense-Movement counters, differentiating armor/infantry/mech - Soviet Armies-Corps and German Corps-Divisions - special units (Air - Flak - Artillery divisions - German Armored Train) - Supply rules - A different Sequence of play (Soviet Movement - Joint Air - Soviet Combat - then a die roll to determine if German movement or combat occurs - German reinforcement - then the other German phase, combat or movement)

name: Snap Judgment
description:
Based on the 1967-69 game show and made for two teams of two players, although the rules give variations for three and six players.

One member of each team is given a separate list of five words. Each player given a list writes down a response for each word on the list. A player earns the team $10 for guessing the response on the first round. If a second round of guessing is needed, the players get to know how many words are in the correct response and the response's first letter. A correct answer is now worth $20.

The team that has more money after ten words plays a bonus round where one player has to guess five of the partner's responses to the bonus word.

Similarities to Password aren't surprising: not only did both games came from the same production company (Goodson-Todman), but for its last three months Snap Judgment changed its rules and set to Password.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Royal Kismet
description:
Description quoted from the rulebook:
"The object of the game is to achieve the highest total score including bonuses. This is accomplished by rolling dice combinations which match the categories on the score sheet and by the skillful choice of scoring options."

Imagine playing Yahtzee with poker dice, and you've got the basic premise of Royal Kismet. There are three suits available - red, black, and green - with values from 6 to Ace in each suit. Players attempt to create a poker hand (or other scoring set) after rolling the dice three times.

What makes Royal Kismet truly unique are the dice included. Each die has a unique distribution of numbers and suits - making it much tougher to calculate the odds of rolling that last Ace you need. (Blank sides and a Joker can also affect the roll.)

name: South Park Trivia Game
description:
How much do you know about South Park?
This is your chance to show the world, or at least your friends, how much you know about the insane inhabitants of the quiet mountain town of South Park. What does Cartman buy with the $1 Million Dollars he inherits from his dead Grandmother? (An amusement park). What phrase is written on Officer Barbrady’s Police Car? (To Patronize and Annoy).


All your favorite characters are here, from Chef and Butters to Timmy and Towlie. For 2 or More Players, Ages 18 and Up.

name: Stellar Strike
description:
Stellar Strike is a strategic science fiction game of conflict between two equally-matched space empires. Players move their battleships, battle cruisers, and cruisers into combat, clearing the way for their transports to deploy regular and assault divisions against enemy and independent worlds. The standard rules provide for unit construction, movement, and space and ground combat. Optional rules cover technology advances, planetary development, unit repair, and additional movement and combat options.

Components include:
• 13-page rulebook
• 16 map tiles (total map size of 44" x 46")
• 386 counters
• 204 markers
• Player Display

One or more six-sided dice (preferably around 4-6) are required for play.

Link to game http://www.pigames.net/store/product_info.php?cPath=49&;products_id=549

name: Wer hat's?
description:
Wer's hat? (Who Has It?) is a game in which speech and memory are trained. Two objects make up a rhyming pair, so that the player has to listen carefully if, for example, "Track" or "Rack" was said. But the rhyming pairs aren't what are sought: the two matching items are instead.

Chaos in the children's room! Louisa and her friends had just finished sorting her possessions, but suddenly her little brother showed up and threw everything into disorder again. So they have to start over again with the collecting and sorting.... Who has the matching item?

name: La llotja
description:
After a very long night of fishing the boats replete with fish return to the port. In the Strap begins the auction of all the apprehensions, every player is interested in obtaining the highest price, and of all those more species better, spending the less amount of money.

A game of fishing auctions for from 3 to 6 players. It consists of 40 cards, 5 for each of the species and 90 coins.

name: 100 Years War
description:
A public domain adaptation of Havoc: The Hundred Years War using a regular deck of cards.

Aside from differences in number (players are dealt 5 cards, only 2 cards are placed as "recruits", etc.) and cosmetic differences (2s are used in place of "Dogs", Jokers as pairs of Dogs, etc.) the significant differences is the use of the face up recruit cards and a randomly drawn card to determine the point value of each battle at the moment it is called. This changes the game considerably as it eliminates the role of strategy about future battles, which is an important element of Havoc.

name: Inquisition
description:
Accuse, interrogate, and detain all those suspicious- for you are an Inquisitor, and it is your quest to be the most righteous defender of the faith! Expose as much wickedness as you can, but never lose sight of your rivals- for they too seek to be the most righteous. Torturous fun for the whole family!

Everyone hides either a Witch, Blasphemer, or Heretic. On your turn, either take a prediction card that says how many of a particular type there are hidden, or accuse someone of hiding a Witch, Blasphemer, or Heretic. If you are right, you score whatever they were hiding. If you're wrong, you lose your prediction, and everyone else scores. Inquisition has been compared to "Liar's Dice" but in a simpler card game form.

Available from Robot Martini at http://www.robotmartini.com/games
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Medieval, Religious

name: Leatherneck
description:
First in a series of expansion packs by Critical Hit, this pack was actually designed by SS-Bar Enterprises and was distributed by Critical Hit.

This features 13 Pacific scenarios between the Japanese and the US Marines covering the period between August 21, 1942 and May 13 1945. The fighting covers Guadalcanal, the Solomon Islands, Aparmama Atoll, Tarawa Atoll, Saipan, Marianas, Guam and Okinawa.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Eye Witness, What Do You Remember?
description: Up to four players study a cartoon for one minute then answer ten true/false questions about the details of the picture. The person who answers the most questions correctly is the winner.

name: The Baron Munchausen Game
description:
The Baron Munchausen Game Dice tell the story! Your luck is read at a glance. If you spell the word B-A-R-O-N you win If you spell only part of the word you lose one check for every missing letter.

Game is played with 5 dice, each marked with the letters from BARON plus a blank side which is "wild" and counts for any letter.

Player wins\collects chips by throwing specific combinations.

name: Serial Killer Trivia Game
description: The Serial Killer Trivia Game features Ted Bundy, the Green River Killer Gary Ridgway and Spokane's serial killer Robert Yates. The game places the players in the middle of some of the most notorious cases of our time with a roll of a dice.
categories: Dice, Horror, Humor, Mature / Adult, Murder/Mystery, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Star Trash
description:
In year 2112 a party of heroes start to go where no green little man is never gone. This heroes are the crew of the Star Trash, the worst element of the planet. During the travel they will fight aliens, diseases and damages but they will also meet friendly aliens that will help to repair the ship and to mutate.

Star Trash is a semi-collaborative game and a semi-competitive game (that means that one player will win or all the players will loose) and it is a parody of many different science-fiction novels.

Official Website
http://www.rappospiel.eu/
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: San Juan Hill
description:
"Spanish American War 1898. Card Game for 2 players. One player gets the American deck. The other player gets the Spanish deck."

Each player uses a unique deck of 32 cards. There are seven types of cards in each deck: Infantry Units, Artillery, Leaders, Morale, Equipment, Terrain, and Special. Each card is rated with a force value from 0 to 5. The cards represent elements of the historical campaign.

The game lasts for eight hands. Each hand the players are trying to play cards having a higher total force value. The object is to be the player who wins the most hands. "If both win 4 hands, the game is a draw, and history unfolds as in the books. If The Americans win 5+ hands, then they take the hill with fewer casualties. If the Spanish win 5+ hands, the Americans suffer a military disaster & retreat."

name: GiocaGoal
description:
GiocaGoal was a game manufactured by Atlantic, a firm very well known in Italy during the first half of the 70's for their wide range of 1:72 and 1:32 scale soldiers, tanks, dioramas.

Occasionally they did something out of the military range.

GiocaGoal was a simple simulation of a football game, much smaller and cheaper than Subbuteo. It was sold in boxes that contained just half of the pitch, balls, a complete team, coach, bench, referee and a goal.

The plastic figures were made by a round and hollow flat base into which the actual figure (different poses according to their role) had to be pressed in. Colours represented teams of the Italian Serie A of the time, so you could buy your favourite team. To play you needed at least two boxes in order to form the complete playing area. The figures were flicked more or less as in Subbuteo. The most used ball was a semi-spheric one, because the round one was too difficult to control properly.

Don't remember if there was a set of rules in the box or if we just made our own

A few months later, at the end of 1973, Atlantic published the Super GiocaGoal. Same players, but a larger pitch.

name: Space Monster
description:
"There’s something alien in Deep Space Outpost 233-B, and it’s hungry. Will you figure out how to neutralize it before it eats you?"

Space Monster is a cooperative exploration / suspense / combat game for one to five players. Your goal is to figure out the space monster’s weaknesses and stop it before it eats everyone on the space station – including you! This brings up an important point: The game is actually only mostly cooperative. if things get really dire, you can make a run for the sole one-person escape pod. If you escape and the monster eats everyone else, you win!

During play, you search the outpost for weapons and items to help you neutralize the monster. You may also have to go to specific rooms to perform tasks, like restarting the failing generator, pumping up the life support system, or overriding the safety systems on the airlock. Each player gets one action per turn and an allotment of movement points. The monster also gets at least one action and move every turn.

Space Monster uses a modular, card-based board, special powers for each player, a deck of special powers for the monster, and an unusual deck-based hit point system for the monster. When the monster takes damage, it loses cards from its health deck. When all damage is dealt, the instructions on the card on top the the discarded health cards tells you how the monster reacts. If you draw the special Dying Gasp card, you know the monster is almost dead.

Space Monster is a fairly complex game. As such, it is appropriate for ages 14 and up. A 4-player game takes about 60+ minutes to play, although your first game may take significantly longer.

The rules, cards, and tokens you need to play are all available as a 240 KB PDF at http://www.invisible-city.com/file_download/139/
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Exploration, Horror, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Monkey Mayhem
description:
From the publisher's site:
It's night time at the zoo. All the visitors have come and gone, and the zookeepers have headed home. Amongst the packing crates scattered around their enclosure, the monkeys gather for their regular competition!

Each Sunday night, the monkeys race to push the crates together to build a tall tower. Choose your monkey and by matching food tokens to the colors on the packing crates, climb to the top first. Watch out for the other monkeys who may try and scare you away or block your moves. Make the most of each monkey’s special abilities to help you climb higher. The first one to clamber high enough to leap into a nearby tree, spends a night on the town!

The others stay behind to cover the escapee's tracks and await the monkey's return, planning to be the fastest one next time they compete. Plan your moves carefully and you’ll be the one creating mayhem!

name: Gergovie
description:
This game is a simulation of the assault on Gergovia, Caesar's failed attempt to wipe out the threat of a large Gallic uprising by isolating and defeating a gathering of several Gallic contingents, under Vercingetorix.

66 counters
One hex = 180 meters
10 pages rules book (+scenarios and historical background)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Bull Run 1861
description:
This games covers the first Battle of Bull Run (aka the first battle of Manassas for the Confederates) on 21 July 1861.
The map is area divided and each counter represents a brigade. One turn is 1 hour time.

name: Grand Hex
description: This game is played on a Hex board. The goal is to either create one group of your pieces connecting both of your sides and one of the opponent's side, or to create two groups of pieces, each of which connect both of your opponent's sides and one of your sides.

name: Heckle & Jeckle's Ski Trail Game
description: Simply roll and move game based on the cartoon characters of the same name. Try to get down the mountain safely. First one to the bottom wins.

name: Quatre Bras: Oportunidad perdida?
description:
Quatre Bras - Oportunidad perdida? (Spanish: "Quatre Bras - Lost oportunity ?") is a Spanish Wargame on the battle of Quatre Bras (16 June 1815).

This is an hex-and-counter game that uses the Sombra del Águila (Shadow of the Eagle) system rules.

The board hexes are numered as to facilitate the initial positioning of counters and victory points.
The counters represent units, leaders, formations and events, and are printed so that could be glued and cut.

The board and counter sheets are available with the spanish magazine Wargames; Soldados y Estratégias nº 46.

Game System:
- scale = 250m hex;
- time = 20 min/GT;
- strength = battaillons (inf), regiments (cav), batteries (art).

name: Triarchy
description:
Since ancient times along the Nile, the Eye, Scarab and Snake vie for positional advantage. Yet, they are not completely in control of their movements. Through clever maneuvering of your own tokens and those of your opponents, be the first to reach your home base in the sands of Egypt. But beware, sandstorms can literally change your world.

Each player has 8 tokens and one home base. Players roll 4 tokens and move 4 tokens, including their own and those of their opponents in order to get their tokens home first. But even the best laid plans can be upended when a player rolls a “sandstorm”.

This is an abstract game of simple rules and greater depth than one might expect at first glance. Elements of many classic designs are echoed here, the result is a fresh synthesis of luck, maneuver and skill. It’s one of the very few abstract games that works equally well with two or three players.

name: Neighbours
description:
Neighbours is played on a 8x8 square board.Each player starts with 8 stones on each of the back ranks.
At each turn,each player must move one of his own stones.A stone slides(orthogonally or diagonally) as many cells as there are directly adjacent stones(of either color). It may move to an empty cell or capture an enemy stone.
The first player unable to move loses. Threefold repetition of board position or a high enough number of moves without a capture forces a draw.

name: Don Q. und die Vermessung von La Mancha
description:
Don Q. and Sancho Pansa are surveying La Mancha. Each player places hidden markers on his/her side of the board. Some of these are positive, some are negative. Then the players take turns placing tokens on the board. Each time a token is placed, the opposing player has to reveal one marker. Only tokens facing three or more positive markers are counted towards the final score at the end of the game.
When a player believes that more than half of the final points have been scored, he/she can decide to play Don Q. From that moment on, all points count for Sancho Pansa. When all markers have been revealed, the player with most points is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Anarchy
description:
from the publisher's website

Anarchy may be described as a fast and furious parody of trick-taking games, the point being that you all play at once instead of going through the laborious and time-consuming process of taking turns - which of course is undemocratic, conferring an unearned privilege on whoever goes first, and being therefore suitable only for the decadent entertainment of a hierarchic-élitist society.

Each player chooses a card and then they are all flipped at the same time. The player with the highest card of each suit wins the other cards of that suit that were also played during that hand. If there is only one of a suit, it is compared to the other individual cards and the player with the highest card collects them all.

At the start of the turn, you must decide what you are playing for. You can try and simply collect the most cards or go for a specific color, suit or the least amount of cards. The more specific you option the more points you get at the end of the round, which occurs once all cards have been played.

The game is played to a specific amount of points and once a player reaches that number, they are declared the winner.

The current rules for the game include the variants Anarchist Bomb, which has more bids and the role of the Anarchist, and Organized Chaos which has a fixed 10-round structure in which each player must make each bid once.

name: HeroCard: Dueling Demo Deck
description:
This is a Demo Deck produced by TableStar Games, LLC.

It is a playable Dueling Deck that offering a sampling from each of the major HeroCard titles. Easy to understand Dueling rules are included on the backside of 3 the Attribute Cards and on both sides of the Reference card.

The Demo Deck contains the following 3 unique cards and 27 reprints from other sets:


Unique Body Attribute Card (strength 8)with instructions on reverse
Unique Mind Attribute Card (strength 8) with instructions on reverse
Unique Attribute X card (strength 4) with instructions on reverse
Standard double-sided reference card
26 Action Cards reprinted from 24 different decks, games and expansions.


A Herocard Duel is the main conflict resolution mechanic of any Herocard game.

The players have 3 cards in place as reference, Body, Mind and Attribute X. Each card lists the amount of that attribute that is allowed to be played during a given turn. Each character within the various Herocard games contains a unique combination of attributes.

The attacking player lays a basic attack up to the ammount allowed by the corresponding attribute (most basic attacks use points in Body). The defending player may then play a basic defense card.

The attacking player may continue taking turns adding modifiers to that attack which the defending player may opt to modify his block to defend against.

If the total amount of the attack is greater than the total amount of the block, then the attack goes through. If the block is greater it is not successful.

The attacker's turn is now over and he may not recover any spent points until the beginning of his next turn.

The following turn begins with the next player clearing no more than 3 cards (always chosen from the top of the played stacks) and regaining those attribute points to spend. If the defender played more than 3 cards, he will have to leave one of the cards uncleared and will not regain the full points in whatever attribute the card was left in.

In a Herocard game such as Orcwars or Rise of the Shogun, a player may move his pieces on the board which dictate who is eligible to be attacked. The purpose of the demo deck however is to familiarize the player with the deck dueling mechanics and has no board game associated with it. Player two is free to attack the other player or save points to counter the next attack. Either way, the duel is over at the first strike.

Action cards from the demo deck can be used in conjunction with any other action cards to create customized decks to expand any of the HeroCard titles. Each of the four characters from Tablestar's current Herocard games comes with a unique set of action cards thematically oriented to that game. The demo deck makes customized characters easy without disrupting currently existing decks.

name: Sixty-One/Sixty-Five
description:
‘61-‘65 is a fast play, Company-level American Civil War game based on the popular Song of Blades mechanics. Playable with 40-100 miniatures per side in less than two hours, ‘61-‘65 puts you in command of a Union or Confederate Company, with a Captain and several Lieutenants, Sergeants and Corporals. Send your skirmishers ahead, keep a tight formation and – wait to see the white of your enemy’s eyes before firing your volley!

Three scenarios included, one for each main period of the War (1861-62, 1863, 1864-65);

Simple rules that require decision making and encourage keeping a chain of command;

Playable in any scale, with single based models;

Profiles for Officers, NCOs, skirmishers and enlisted men for each major period;

Easy measuring system, no bookkeeping, minimal amount of markers;

Rules for multiplayer battles and for playing the game as a Song of Drums and Shakos variant with as few as 6 to 15 figures (SDS required);

Optional rules for Cavalry and Artillery;

Quick rules for setting up a table in pickup games;

Sgt. O’Reilly hints on play, formations, combat, and much more….

‘61-‘65 is our American Civil War ruleset, written by Sergio Laliscia. It plays at company level, meaning that a player controls a company (98 men in the game) and one figure is one man. The models move and fight as units of 4-8 men each. Smaller games can be played (with about 50 figures per player) and of course with enough players, large tables, and plenty of time, you can play much larger actions!

Figures as independently based but we suggest using magnetic trays for rank and file to speed up movement. Skirmishers are independent figures. Command figures are on a separate stand containing a leader figure, a drummer and a flag-bearer.
Other leaders are single-based. Skirmishers are represented by two single figures in front of a rank and file unit.

Confusion/disorder in units is represented by turning the disordered figures with their back to the enemy. As corporals rally them back in line, they can recover and be turned back to face the enemy. Casualties are represented by removing figures. Units with less than 4 figures run back to the player’s baseline and can be rallied later.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Nonesuch
description:
This is a trick-taking game for the Decktet. The game was first published in the Decktet Book.

The player who leads a trick with a two-suited card picks one of the card's two suits, and other players must follow that suit. However, the second suit on a card might still be trump - so it's possible to follow non-trump suit and trump in at the same time.

Bidding is in broad categories, with the possible bids being none of the tricks, some of the tricks, or most of the tricks.

name: Rout Pak 1
description:
Rout Pak 1 is a re-release of previously released Rout Report scenarios by Critical Hit, Inc. It includes eight scenarios:

RP #1 Morning in Mouen - German infantry with tank support must dislodge British infantry outside Caen during the Battle for Normandy (1944).

RP #2 The Glory Road - Japanese tanks and motorized infantry must force their way across a bridge defended by elements of the 11th Indian Division during the Malayan Campaign (1941).

RP #3 Fire and Rain - Scottish Fusiliers clash with Hitler Youth during the Battle for Normandy (1944) as the Scottish attempt to dig the Germans out of the bocage with the support of a flame throwing Crocodile.

RP #4 Piats and Panthers - British infantry armed with anti-tank guns and piats have to hold off six German Panther tanks during the early days of the Battle for Normandy (1944).

RP #5 Another Balaclava - British lend lease armor attempts to neutralize dug in German guns during the Second Battle of El Alamein (1942).

RP #6 Slam Dance - A swirling urban melee ensues as British paratroopers enroute to the Arnhem bridge, must deal with a hastily assembled German blocking force during Operation Market Garden (1944)

RP #7 No Quarter - Canadian infantry attempt to clear the bocage of Hitler Youth during the early days of the Battle for Normandy (1944).

RP #8 Victoria Cross - A Japanese roadblock has cut the retreat path of an Australian infantry company that is protecting an artillery battery. These mixed elements must clear the roadblock to continue the retreat towards Singapore during the Malayan Campaign (1942).

name: Tabula
description:
In Roman antiquity this game was known as Alea, meaning 'gambling', but came to be called Tabula, 'board' or 'table', since it was played on a board.

Tabula was an ancestor to Backgammon, and has a similar board and style of play to Backgammon.

Tabula was a gambling game of which the Roman Emperor Claudius was most fond. Around the year 50, Claudius wrote a history of the game of Tabula which, unfortunately, has not survived. His imperial carriage was equipped with an alveus, a Tabula playing board, so that he could play while traveling.

Tabula was also the game which was primarily responsible for the gambling mania which swept Rome prior to its being declared illegal under the Republic. The fine for gambling at any other time except the Saturnalia was four times the stakes, although this law was only weakly and sporadically enforced.

The equipment for Tabula is the same as in Backgammon except that each player has three dice instead of two.

All of the pieces start off the board in Tabula. Both players enter their fifteen pieces into the same starting table and move them around the board in the same direction.

The object of the game is to move all of your pieces to the finishing table and then bear them off. The first player to bear off all his pieces wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Anima Tactics: Light Faction Starter
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Bound together by their ideology and the calling in their soul, Sister Evangeline and Kronen Roxxon work tirelessly to fight the awakening darkness.

Sister Evangeline:

From the moment of her birth, Evangeline was blessed and dammed with special abilities which made her different from other people. Now, under the severe supervision of the church, she has developed her mystical powers to serve the 13 bishop.

Mystic - Light Church - Level 50

Holy Armor (Magic, Effect) - One target friendly unit gains Lv2 Shield.

Blessing (Magic, Effect ) - All friendly units inside Evangeline's Control Zone gain +1 to Attack and Defense. Upkeep: o

Vision (Magic, Effect) - Detect any hidden unit inside Evangeline's Control Zone.

Healing (Magic, Effect) - Heal 5 Life Points of a friendly unit inside Evangeline's Control Zone.

Kronen Roxxon:

As one of the high knights of the empire, Kronen is an impressive warrior with outstanding combat skills. Wearing heavy full plate armor and a gigantic sword that only he can wield, he is an indomitable force.

Warrior - Light Empire - Level 40

Scarlet Heartbeat (Ki, Counter) - Special Counter. If you achieve a successful Dodge, the counter gains +4 Attack / +2 Damage.

Both pewter figures are unpainted and unassembled.

name: Kwak!
description:
Kwak! is a funny game for wily old foxes in which you will have to identify as many Geese and Cages as possible, suitably move the Cages, capture Free Geese and your opponents’ Favourite Geese, protect your Favourite Goose, use Scuffle and Event cards at the right moment, all this while trying to improve your score. There are no dices, and at each turn you have great freedom of choice. Your strategic ability consists in cleverly planning your moves.

You can win Kwak in three different ways:

1) When a Favourite Goose crosses the Finish: The game ends and the winner is the player who owns that Favourite Goose!

2) When a player exceeds 50 points: The game ends, and that player wins!

3) In case there are Geese left on the Track:The game ends, and the winner is the player with the highest score!

Game Components:

- The Map, which shows an internal route (Track), and an external one (Scoreboard).

- 7 Geese, in 7 different positions.

- 7 Magnetic Bases, of 7 different colours.

- 7 Flags, of the same colour as the Bases.

- 7 Cage cards, of the same colour as the Bases and the Flags.

- 18 Event cards.

- 18 Scuffle cards (8 Nails, 6 Fangs, 4 Escapes).

- The rule book, to be kept on hand during the first matches.

name: The Mine
description:
The game is set in a coal mine, where two miners are working. The miners know that in the mine there are many gold nugget and want to find out them before going out.
They are at the center of the mine and to reach the exit have to choose between 8 galleries. Each gallery is composed of seven covered cards that hide landslides, deep holes, flooding, free tunnels....
To clear those hurdles there are many objects:shovels, wood boards...
Each miner moves of a box per turn and every movement turn the following card.
Each collected gold nugget has a value of half point.
The game is composed of tree rounds.
The miner that reach the exit first, gain one point.
Win the game the miner that after tree rounds have more point.

name: Kikerikimäh!?
description:
Roar like a lion, waddle like a duck, draw an elephant on the table, explain what a dolphin eats, and tell where a bear lives: In Kikerikimäh!?, for two players or 3-6 players, whoever can do that the best, leading the other players more often than not in the right direction, will win the game.

To set up the game for 3-6 players, shuffle the 56 animal cards, then deal out cards as evenly as possible among all the players. If a player receives a matching pair of animal cards, remove these from the game as they are not needed. Shuffle the challenge cards and place them in the middle of the table.

On a turn, the active player draws the topmost challenge card – with challenges being something that you draw or describe or imitate, e.g., "describe the animal's feet", "using your fingers, mimic how the animal walks" or "describe or show how the animal eats". This player draws the topmost animal card from her deck, then completes the challenge as best she can. Each other player then looks through their personal deck of animal cards, chooses one animal they think best matches the description or sounds given, then reveal these cards simultaneously. If someone has matched the active player, those two cards are removed from play; likewise, if any two players have revealed matching animals, those cards are removed from play. All other animals are returned to their owners' decks. The next player then undergoes a challenge, and so on.

As soon as one or more players have no animal cards remaining, the game ends and those players win.

In the two-player game, each player takes a set of animal cards and they take turns doing the challenges. If the non-active player reveals the right animal card, those cards are removed from play; otherwise, the challenger's card and the matching card from the other player's deck are placed in the middle of the table as a penalty point. The goal is to score as few penalty points as possible.

name: Philip the Great
description:
An expansion for The Great Battles of Alexander: Deluxe Edition, this module is found in RBM/GMT's C3i Magazine Nr13.

It follows the career of Philip II of Macedonia Alexander the Great's father in two relatively short scenarios. It also includes rules for using Philip in the scenarios included in The Great Battles of Alexander: Deluxe Edition so players can see how Macedonia's greatest king would fare in the campaign he was planning before his death.

Battles:

Erigon Valley, 358 B.C.
Crocus Fields, 352 B.C.

name: Skittykitts: Bonus Characters Booster Pack
description:
This booster pack for Skittykitts includes ten (10) extra character cards. To use one (1) of these characters in the game, simply remove of the the four (4) core characters from the base Skittykitts deck, as well as the core characters "cannot win the game" card. Replace those with the special card card you want to use as well as the "special character cannot win the game" card.

Be warned: These special characters are play test characters and some may be over-powered and some may be under-powered. Try them out and have fun!

name: High and Low Poker
description:
This game is played with one of the Clever Playing Cards dual-value decks. Each card in the deck has one value associated with one suit, and a different value associated with a different suit.

The dealer decides which poker variant to play, how to bet, and how the pot will be split between the high and low hands. Each player uses one set of suits and values on the cards to make his high hand, and the other set to make his low hand.

name: Escape From Pirate Island
description:
Yaaar!

Oh no! You and your friends have all become shipwrecked on the dangerous Pirate Island. Now you all have to work together to escape.

But watch out! The island is teeming with hazards, from the treacherous Tall Peak to the deadly Raging River. Enemies abound on Pirate Island: Headhunters, Skeletons, and - of course - Pirates.

But there is hope. There is a rumor of a treasure buried on Pirate Island. If you and your friends can navigate through the hazards and avoid or kill the enemies, then maybe you can follow the treasure map and find the treasure. Then you could sneak aboard the docked pirate ship and Escape From Pirate Island!

Pirate Island is a cooperative game of exploration and risk management. Your characters move around Pirate Island uncovering new hexes which could be helpful or hazardous. You need to manage your food and resources, running out of either can be dangerous, and you need to fight or escape from deadly enemies.

You also need to find the hexes that contain clues to the treasure map, and then, once you have the treasure, you need to get to the lagoon to board the pirate ship to escape. And you need to do it before time -- represented by the event deck -- runs out.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Holy Rollers
description:
Holy Rollers is a dice game where your group of saints tries to race your opponent's group of saints to the front of the church to find out who's holiest.

Players are represented by 3 dice "pawns" portraying the different sides of the characters' face so you can tell which way they're facing.

There are 4 direction dice and an action die, all of the directions must be used by one character die per turn, and the action die will give special directions.

There is also a countdown die for placing NPC saints in the front pew and 2 placement dice for saints and Bibles.

Players must land on a space with a Bible token to be allowed to sit in the front pew.

The first player to get 3 character dice with Bibles in the front pew of the church wins.

This game was designed to utilize all the copies of Yahtzee Jr. I had found thrifitng. You will need 3 indented dice for each player and 8 for the game, 10 tokens, and one play board.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Caravans of Asia
description:
Caravans of Asia is a strategic game of trade and travel inspired by Marco Polo and the Silk Road. For thousands of years, merchant caravans have traversed the dusty routes of inner Asia, bearing strange and exotic goods from one corner of the world to the other.

In Caravans of Asia you become a merchant caravan seeking your fortune by trading goods across the continent – but beware, for there are many dangers that await you, from treacherous mountains to blinding sandstorms and thieving bandits. Your success will require wise decisions, an eye for danger, and a bit of luck.

Players buy and sell trade goods across Asia, responding to changing market conditions. You can cooperate and make deals with other players, or you can try to go it alone and make all the trades yourself. Manage your money carefully, and make sure you don't get too far in debt.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Trading

name: Indigenous people of Taiwan
description:
In Indigenous people of Taiwan, players are tour guides who plan a trip around the beautiful island of Taiwan. You will also reach deep in the mountains to experience the cultural variety of different tribes. The player who manages to spend the least on travel will become the best tour guide this journey!

Indigenous people of Taiwan is both a standalone game and an expansion for Hello Taiwan! that allows for up to six players to enjoy a fruitful trip in Taiwan.

玩家扮演領隊導遊角色，帶各位來趟臺灣環島旅行，東南西北共四個方向，並且深入原住民部落，體驗原住民祭典文化。在這場旅程中花費最少的旅費的玩家將成為最專業的旅遊達人！

Integrates with


Hello! Taiwan

name: CatRatBatSplat
description:
Roll the four oversized dice and see what combination of cats, rats, bats and splats come up. Then look at your six cards to see if any of them have the combination that was rolled. If you have the right card — act fast! Throw it down and call out the combination as you try to be the first player to get rid of all your cards and win.

Contents: 4 over-sized dice, 40 game cards, rules.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice

name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Moria & Angmar
description:
The Misty Mountains have ever been home to evil things. From the malicious Goblins that prey on unsuspecting Dwarves, to the colossal might of the Balrog of Morgoth, the Mines of Moria are a dangerous place to be at the best of times. Many travellers choose to avoid the route altogether, but instead find themselves confronted by the twisted armies of Angmar, a dark and forbidding land that's home to Trolls, Wargs and Undead spirit creatures kept alive by the will of the Witch King.

This 48-page Sourcebook for The Lord of the Rings contains all the rules you'll need to field an army from Moria and Angmar (including Goblins, Trolls, Dragons, Undead spirits and the mighty Balrog), as well as detailed background information and scenarios.

You must possess a copy of The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game in order to use the contents of this book.
categories: Book, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Mehrkopf
description: Mehrkopf, a tactical card game based on the classic trick-taking game Schafkopf, adds four additional cards to that game as well as the possibility of playing the game with up to six players.

name: Columba: Officia
description: The Columba: Officia expansion adds six cards that feature characters with special powers to the Columba base game. During set-up, players randomly pick one character each in a three- or four-player game and two each in a two-player game. The remaining character cards stay on the table, and they can be acquired later in the game for the price of two "domesticated pigeon" tiles. You can steal characters from opponents for the same price, so keep an eye out for who will help you and hurt them!
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Outlast: The Zombie Card Game
description:
This game offers extremely easy accessibility, fun interaction, strategic gameplay, and diverse experiences. All you need is a standard deck of cards, the rules, one or more friends willing to learn the game and want to have fun.

Players start with a group of survivors, represented by the cards in their hand. Each turn, which represents a normal day, consists of gathering resources, creating defenses, expanding the group's strength, battling other groups of survivors, and of course killing zombies. Throughout the game, players use card combinations in order to experience unique scenarios like fighting against zombie hordes, training up soldiers, and even witnessing their own members turn zombie. The simplistic nature of this game offers great entertainment and interaction between players, yet it provides enough challenge and diversity to keep you playing over and over.

In order to win, players must survive through the deck by increasing the amount of cards in their hand. This is accomplished by gathering Resources, killing Zombies, creating Defenses, and battling other players. When the last card of the deck is drawn, each player takes a final turn. Then players count the remaining cards in their hand and keep track of that score. After three rounds of Outlast, whoever has the highest total score wins and has “Outlasted” everyone.

While the mechanics of this game is simple, the complex part of this game is that each card has a different value, whether it represents zombies, gas, food, defense, guns, or more. Combinations with different cards also add an extra layer of strategy as players must decide what to play to help themselves and hurt others.

The game offers an instruction manual, a place matt, specific player inventory cards, and player help charts (to keep track of the different card values). Each piece is designed beautifully and all work together to give the player an imaginative experience. Being sold at a low price, because of not offering a custom deck, this game calls out to all types of game players who want to play a fun game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Take That

name: Story
description:
Can you tell a good story?

In the board game Story, you and your opponents match pictures, explain why they belong together and then vote for the player who told the best story. The reason why your picture is the best match is up to you. No explanation is more correct than another.

After each round, the players show who they have voted for and points are given accordingly. The player who receives the most votes is awarded 1 point. Every player who has voted for that player’s story receives 3 points. Each player receives between 0 and 4 points each turn.

The player that first reaches 20 points or more wins.
categories: Bluffing, Children's Game, Educational, Humor, Party Game

name: Batavia
description:
The ship Batavia was build in Amsterdam in 1628 on the orders of the VOC (united East-Indian Company). A Dutch initiative to send ships to all corners of the world. In October of that year the Batavia, with 341 souls aboard, would set sail to the East Indies. Everything seemed to be going great on it's maiden voyage... But on June 4th of 1629 the ship ran aground near the coast of Australia. Only a handful of people survived the disaster and the following mutiny...

Every player plays the skipper of a VOC ship. The starting player will roll the die determining how many spaces everybody gets to move. If a player ends his move in a port they can stock up on goods (for free). If a player ends in the Home port he can unload his goods thereby securing them from the pirate and the other players. And if a player lands next to another player he can attack them (high roller wins, difference in roll is the amount of goods that can be stolen).

Secured goods can be used to buy parts of a players own Batavia which also yields an advancement for the players current VOC ship.
After a player has build his own Batavia, he will have to sail it from the Home port to Batavia city to win the game.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Greedy Pirates
description:
You are the captain of a group of Greedy Pirates exploring a cursed Treasure Island to find a huge stash of gold. But you are not alone... As the game proceeds, you will dig for treasures, drink some Pirate Rum, capture the black Pirate Ship and steal gold from competing Greedy Pirates. But beware! This Island is cursed... Do you have what it takes to lead a group of Greedy Pirates? Grab your Pirate Dice and go on an adventure in this fast-paced and addictive analog game!

Greedy Pirates is a quick press-your-luck style game, with lots of player interaction. It is based on a dice-rolling mechanic similar to Yahtzee. The goal of this game is to gain the most points by finding treasures and stealing gold coins from other players. To win this game you have to become a Greedy Pirate! The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Il Gioco del Ponte
description:
Since 1568, the north and south sides of Pisa (Tramontana und Mezzogiorno) compete yearly on the Il Gioco del Ponte - the battle for the bridge. Which strategy will lead your side to victory? What surprises do your opponents have in store for you? Only the most cunning players will overcome their opponent's assault and be declared the king of the bridge!

The boardgame implementation of this spectacle is a collector's item and artistic masterpiece, in which each of the figures is handmade and hand-painted. You pick a side and engage in a thrilling battle with two, three, four or six players. You'll have to divide your strength wisely, and adjust to the strategy of your opponents, in order to also push the handmade (and in real life seven ton) cart to the other side of the river.

How do you play?

The board game is based heavily on the real-world Il Gioco del Ponte event. There are always two sides competing against each other, and the basic rules of the two-player game also apply to the higher player counts. In the two-player version, each player selects a side (Tramontana or Mezzogiorno) and distributes their strength points across six districts.
To start a round, each player picks a magistrature. During one round, players choose one attack card each. A rock-paper-scissor-mechanism decides which player is to act, the winner moves the cart and both players loose strenght equal to the chosen attack cards and each chooses a new attack card. A round is over, if one side has no strenght left or if the cart is pushed completely to the opposite side. A game contains of at 6 rounds, a tie-braker decides in case of a tie. Strategy cards might be played as well to change the effects o the attack cards.

The Italian and English version are already available, for the German version there is a crowdfunding campaign running until July 5th 2015.
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Wales
description:
Age of Steam: Wales was designed for commercial publication and has now been made available as a free print-and-play expansion for the Age of Steam base game.

This map is intended to be played with 3 to 6 players, with the map reputedly playing best with 4 or 5.

Wales features expensive terrain, multiple track gauges (narrow and standard) with different terrain costs, different links records for each gauge, and upgrades of narrow gauge track to standard gauge.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Temporal Cold War Card Pack
description: This card pack is the grand prize for the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, the Temporal Cold War. It consists of 4 Upgrades, 1 Captain and 2 Additional Rules cards.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Pirate Loot: 6 Player Expansion
description:
This 55 card deck includes TWO entirely new suits of pirate to add to your game, allowing it to be played with up to 6 players (when added to the base game).

The first suit is UNDEAD pirates, allowing you to add a horde of shambling zombie pirates to your game.

The second suit is SNEAKY pirates! These shadowy pirates let you flip some of your crew face-down, to keep the other captains guessing!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Pirates

name: Statecraft: The Political Card Game – National Politics Expansion (UK & USA)
