description:
The first expansion for Statecraft - the Political Card Game.

National Politics adds in a real dimension to the world of Statecraft, with contemporary and historical policies, characters, events and actions available to exploit in your nefarious political campaigns to dominate whichever nation you've surged to the fore in.

National Politics (UK & USA) contains 27 cards which fully integrate with the core Statecraft set, and offers players further customisation of their starting set up, as well as new policies and actions to field in-game.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Political
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement
publishers: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)

name: Escape!
description:
Description from the publisher:

Lots of monsters have run into the house! The house owner asks for help from two different wizard associations to capture these monsters. However, the reward will go only to the association with more captures! As a wizard, the players have to represent different magic associations and fight for glory as well as the reward!

Escape! is designed for 4~8 players. All players will be assigned into two different wizard associations. Players shall not only verify the situation accurately, but also refine the items faster than the opponents do to catch the monsters!

一群愛搗蛋的小怪獸闖進民宅了！屋主委託了兩個公會的魔法師來捕捉這些小怪獸，並且約定只會給抓到最多小怪獸的那個工會獎金！玩家們身為代表公會前往執行任務的魔法師，要為了公會的榮耀以及獎金而努力！

這個遊戲適合4~8人一同體驗，玩家會分成兩隊以代表兩個魔法師公會。除了要精準的判斷局勢，更要比對手更快速的提煉出誘導物把小怪獸抓到手！
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Robbi, Tobbi und das Fliewatüüt
description: In Robbi, Tobbi und das Fliewatüüt, Robbi and Tobbi travel the world to solve new robot tasks, with the cockpit indicating how quickly they can travel over land, over water, and in the air. Whoever first manages to resolve the robot tasks and achieve the goals wins!

name: The Dice Road Race
description:
User summary
ダイスロードレース (The Dice Road Race) is a roll-and-move postcard game with a theme of bicycle road racing. You run the final mountain stage, and you win the game if you are the first player to reach the goal.

You begin the game with three dice. Each turn, you may roll any number of dice, and players in the same square may roll that many dice if they have. If a six is rolled with a die, that die is permanently lost unless it is the only die rolled by a player this turn.

Are you going to launch a brilliant attack like Nairo Quintana, or chase up your rivals at your own pace like Chris Froome?
Although the rules are simple, you can enjoy tactics seen in real road races.

This game was first handed out as an added bonus upon purchasing a game from Japanese game store Banesto.

Publisher's summary
『ダイスロードレース』は自転車ロードレースの山頂ゴールステージをテーマにしたすごろくゲームです。

プレイヤーは選手となり、ライバルよりも早くゴールすることを目指します。
各プレイヤーは3個のダイス(D6)を持ってスタートします。
手番プレイヤーは手持ちのダイスから任意の個数(1~3)を選んで振ります。手番プレイヤーと同じマスにいるプレイヤーも同じ個数を持っていればダイスを振ることができます。
「6」の目が出ると一気に進むことができますが、ダイスを失ってしまいます。最低1個は戻ってくるルールなので、常に1個降り続ける限りダイスを失う危険はありません。

ナイロ・キンタナのように鮮やかなアタックを決めるか？それとも、クリス・フルームのようにマイペースでライバルを追い詰めるのか？
ルールはシンプルですが、ロードレースのリアルな駆け引きを楽しめるゲームです。

name: Figment
description:
Game description from the designer:

Figment is a cooperative, narrative card game for children ages 6 and up. Players are required to work closely together and use each other's individual strengths to defeat classic opponents from medieval fantasy tales and, as a team, prevent the destruction of the mythic kingdom!

Each player chooses one of ten classic and recognizable characters: a knight, a barbarian, an elf, a wizard, a princess, and so on. Each character has a specific combination of skills, represented by colorful icons, that can be used to defeat monsters along the way; stars represent physical might, while books stand for lore and hearts embody social skills. As the right combination of skill icons is required to defeat monsters and eventually dethrone the main villain of the piece. By doing this, children not only see that they differ from the other players, they even need to make good use of the other players' strengths — and help them cope with their weaknesses — to succeed.

Players start off in the idyllic medieval kingdom, where they'll confront weaker monsters drawn randomly from a stack of encounters while also traveling from one location to the next. When they feel up to it, certain locations give them access to the evil Shadowrealm, where stronger monsters roam but ancient, powerful magics can also be discovered. In this realm of darkness and shadow, they eventually have to defeat the one, powerful creature who has been organizing the monsters for an all-out assault on the kingdom...

Figment is ideal for young children and was developed in cooperation with educators and elementary school teachers.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Exploration, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.K.S. Hegh'ta Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 2 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, Klingon Civil War. It is a K'Vort Class ship.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Gnomic Parliament
description: Gnomic Parliament is kind of a party game, but with a little bit of tactics. During play, you vote to change the rules of the game, and voting the same way as other players gives you points toward winning.

name: Førstemann til mølla
description:
Førstemann til mølla er det nye brettspillet hvor man på realistisk vis reiser rundt i Sør-Norge for å fullføre oppdrag og besøke severdigheter. Alle kjemper om de samme oppdragene, og som i virkeligheten må man bruke både tid og penger for å komme seg rundt. Men det er kun førstemann frem som får prispengene, og det er derfor avgjørende at du velger dine oppdrag med omhu. Haugevis med prispenger er nøkkelen til suksess, ettersom det muliggjør hurtig forflytning og kjøp av de gullbillettene man også må skaffe seg for å vinne spillet.

Dette er brettspillet for deg som er på jakt etter et utfordrende, morsomt og lærerikt spill. Her er det en fordel å forstå seg på strategi, geografi og økonomi. Spillet passer like godt å spille med familien som med vennegjengen!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Economic, Educational, Racing, Transportation, Travel

name: Kyabetsu Kantei
description:
User summary
キャベツ鑑定 (Kyabetsu Kantei) in English is Cabbage Appraisal.

Cabbage Appraisal is card game where players bid for the right to appraise opponents' cabbages.

At beginning of the game, each player has 200 coins and the same deck of five cabbage cards, each of which is numbered -30, -20, -10, +10, or +20, indicating the quality of the cabbage.

Each round, players take a random cabbage card from the deck, and place it on the table face-down. Only the player who placed the card may look at its face value. Then they bid for the right to appraise opponents' cabbages.

The appraiser (highest bidder) may reveal an opponent's card. If its value is negative, the appraiser takes that many coins from that opponent as a fine for distributing bad cabbages. If positive, the appraiser must pay the opponent that many. The appraiser may repeat revealing until +20 is revealed or they wish to stop.

After the tenth round, when the deck runs out twice, the player with the most coins win the game.

Description from the publisher:
『キャベツ鑑定』はルールの簡単な「競りゲーム」です。
キャベツ農家になって、ガッポリお金を稼ぎましょう！　ただし、あなたが市場に出荷するキャベツは、良いものばかりとは限りません。
悪いキャベツを出荷したことが分かったら、罰金を払わなくてはなりません！
上手くキャベツを売り抜けるのはどのプレイヤーになるのでしょうか？

・ルール
ゲームは10ラウンド行ないます。各ラウンド、キャベツの鑑定権を競ってください。10ラウンド目が終了した時点で、一番多くコインを持っているプレイヤーが勝利者です。
publishers: Rommel Games (ロンメルゲームズ)

name: There She Is!!
description:
Description from the publisher:

A cooperative game based on the popular Korean animation series.

In There She Is!! you help Doki (the bunny) and Nabi (the cat) with theri relationship to overcome a series of events in a world where the interracial relationships is taboo.

The game is played by series of rounds determined by the number of players. These players must find the ways to achieve the goals of every episode, while solving the events that will often appear.

To solve these episodes and events players have the option to use their different abilities or character's skills, to search the right card through a deck of more than 100 objects cards, and earn positive tokens while trying to avoid the negative ones.

There are several ways to lose, but only one way to win: solve all the five episodes, with custom events for each one!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Winter Bowl Inducement Promo Cards
description:
Winter Bowl Inducements are alternate Inducements for use in Blood Bowl (2016). These optional Inducements replace the existing Inducements available prior to a match:

(2) Bloodweiser Keg cards
(3) Bribe cards
(4) Extra Team Training cards
(4) Interference cards
(4) Revitalising Tonic cards
(5) Special Play cards
(2) Weather Mage cards

The Winter Bowl Inducements were part of a promotional organized play kit as part of the release of Blood Bowl (2016) in November 2016. The additional items included in the organized play kit were simple league play rules, Blood Bowl trophy miniatures, Blood Bowl pins, and superlative awards. The promotional organized play kit was provided to retailers who pre-ordered at least 50 copies of Blood Bowl (2016).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Albuera, 16 May 1811
description:
Albuera 16th May, 1811: In early May, French commander Jean-de-Dieu Soult moved a force to attack a British and Portuguese army commanded by Marshal William Beresford. Soult's plan was to defeat Beresford and therefore relieve the British siege of Badajoz. A Spanish contingent, however, had just united with Beresford, and the combined British, Portuguese, and Spanish force now outnumbered the French. Soult attacked anyway, and his plan to outflank the enemy worked well - in the beginning… but a determined defense ultimately repulsed the attack. Can you as Soult decisively prevail against the Allies or as Beresford falter and flounder in the face of French aggression? You decide in this realistic Napoleonic battle game.

Albuera 16th May, 1811 is the 1st Volume in the Napoleonic Battlefield Series (NBS). NBS portrays Napoleonic battles at the regiment or brigade level, giving players a sense of the historical era without overloading with rules and procedures. Rules include ranged artillery bombardment, cavalry counter-charges, random special events, disruption and recovery, and the importance of leaders and command.

This is old-fashioned beer & pretzels wargaming, designed to be enjoyed in an evening. Given its small size, this title is available in ziplock only.

name: Tat's All Folks!
description:
Tat's All Folks! is a 2 player worker placement micro-game based on American traditional tattoo artwork. The two players are rival tattooers in a shop, filling in available spots with their signature piece to gain more clients than the other and become known as the best.

Tat's All Folks! was built for economy, of both space and price. The modular game board is made of 6 double sided cards, creating 64 possible board permutations. 2 of the cards function as score trackers, sliding along the numerical track created by the remaining 4 cards on the board. A 7th card contains all the rules for gameplay, while a final 8th card can be cut up and used as game pieces. The entire game could easily fit in your wallet!

Following standard worker placement rules, the two players will alternate placing their 3 game pieces on the board to perform listed actions and gain/lose clients over the course of multiple rounds. Each player also has a single use special move, called the "Dead Man's Switch," that when activated grants them another immediate turn, which can make or break a player's strategy. The first player to reach 9 clients wins the game.

name: Fragments of Wisdom
description:
Description from the publisher:

Theme/backstory: In 587BC the Babylonian armies of Nebuchadnezzar broke through the walls of Jerusalem, burned the city and pillaged the Temple of Yahweh. Those in the city who survived the siege were deported 1500km to Babylon.

The people of Israel are bleeding. Their capital is destroyed, they are exiled from their land and Yahweh has abandoned them, or so it seems.

Nursing broken hearts, the pious of Israel gather on the banks of the Euphrates River. They comfort each other, and turn to the writings of the prophet Jeremiah. Perhaps they will gain understanding before all their hope drains away ...

Game mechanics: Co-operative card game with a CCG/LCG feel. The box comes with all the cards you need for four starter decks (and a few other cards too). The starter decks are reasonable, but as you improve you will want to craft your own. Unlike other co-op CCG/LCGs there is no 'monster deck' or 'encounter deck' instead there is some very careful shared resource management required.

name: Welt der Sinne: Hören, Sehen, Schmecken, Riechen, Fühlen
description:
"Sensory World – hearing, seeing, tasting, smelling, feeling"

Young Native Americans are preparing for their first sense-awareness trial. Sipokoo, the wise owl, guides the young Natives in mastering a wide variety of tasks, sharpening their senses. Where exactly is the bell? What figures can you identify with only your fingers? Which two bags are equally heavy? The game box includes everything you need for the basic games exploring hearing, seeing and feeling. Later on, household items can supplement the games related to smelling and tasting.

The basic game comprises 6 beginner’s trials for hearing, seeing and feeling.

Tasting and smelling games are added for advanced play variations.

Expert-level games challenge true nature scouts.

"Sensory World" contains overall 16 different games.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Honeycomb Cavern
description:
Honeycomb Cavern is a fast roll and write game for one or more players set in the universe of our intrepid explorer and treasure hunter Sadie Cat. The game should take under 5 minutes to play and is presented in a book format so it is easy to take with you and store on a shelf.

The game has players rolling dice, moving along a collapsing tiled room, collecting treasure, and avoiding fire from the dragon statues. From the first roll to the final roll, every decision is important to escaping with the most points or falling into the cavern below.

name: コプラス (KoPlus)
description:
User summary
コプラス (KoPlus) is an abstract game themed on far future Earth, where players compete to capture a space being known as 'KoPlus', which are Cosmic Fireflies.

A simple game played on a modular board, where you play a tile to capture the most points. However, the game gets crunchy with the rules forcing you to play the 2 tiles alternatively, and failing to connect your tiles would grant you devastating penalty points.

Meeting some conditions may grant you a powerful "consecutive play". When to launch the move is also a tough decision.

The game board is modular, and changes according to the number of players: 2 player is 3x3, 3 player is 3x4, and 4 player is 4x4 board pieces.

The name KoPlus comes from the two game pieces, pentominos in a cup shape that looks like the sound 'Ko' in katakana (コ), and a plus shape (+). Put them together and you get KoPlus!

The players take turns placing their pieces, connected to any pieces on a side. One player places in コ + コ + order, the next places in + コ + コ order, and so on. At the end of the game, if a player has been able to connect their own pieces together well, they get bonus points. But having their pieces scattered gets them negative points.

As the game progesses, players try to place their pieces to cover the scoring squares on the board. Maximum scoring is nine points in a turn, and players must make legal moves even if they won't score. The game ends when no more legal moves are open.

There is an extra move available when a player hits 20, 40 and 60 points scored. They get a right to have an extra move immediately. This not only increases their scoring opportunities, it can also help them break out of a difficult position.

The game is a mix of planning and opportunity, and has been very popular in Japan after its release at the Tokyo Game Market in Spring 2017. Game design is by GameNOWA and production design is by SukiGames. The game designer originally styled the game name in Romaji as 'COPULAS', but settled on KoPlus as a better name.

Publisher's summary
コプラスは、遠い未来の地球を舞台に、宇宙ホタルと呼ばれる宇宙生命体コプラスを捕まえるアブストラクトゲームです。
手番に1枚、モジュラーボードにタイルを置いてなるべく多くの点数を稼ぐ簡単なゲームですが、2種類のタイルを交互に置く縛りや、タイルをちょうどよく繋げないと大失点を被るルールから、終了時の盤面を強く意識して手を進める必要がある歯ごたえのあるゲームです。
条件を満たすことで使える強力な行動、「連続手番」をどのタイミングで使うかも重要なポイントです。
mechanics: Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement
publishers: Game Nowa, 数寄ゲームズ (Suki Games)

name: Fedőnevek: Magyar bónusz csomag
description:
The bonus pack contains 10 double-sided cards, most of which are names of famous Hungarian people.

Balaton / Kékes
Latinovits / Hofi
Széchenyi / Rákóczi
Csontváry / Puskás
István / Árpád
Rubik / Polgár
Buda / Dobó
Liszt / Bartók
Jókai / Molnár
Karinthy / Ady
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents, Word Game
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: フタリシロ (Futarishiro)
description:
フタリシロ (Futarishiro) is a castle-building game set in the age of warring states. To win, you must build a castle that's harder to overcome that the opponent's. Perhaps you can build a moat, arrange a tower, store weapons, train soldiers, and prepare for battle.

It's difficult to build a castle exactly as desired, though, as you have to read the psychology of your opponent to get the castle tiles that you want and design your territory in the best way.

name: Soul Puzzler: Turbo Edition
description:
Soul Puzzler - Turbo Edition is the All-in-One Expansion for Soul Puzzler, a 2-player, head-to-head, tile placement puzzle game inspired by the puzzle-based video games of the 90's to now. Soul Puzzler - Turbo Edition is easily accessible to all players with added characters and abilities to add increased depth that will please the more experienced gamer and past Soul Puzzler players.

During each turn a player may take one of two actions, that of playing a Soul Token or switching an existing Soul Token's Position. Once the Soul Token is placed or a Soul Token is switched, the turn then goes to the next player. When you have 3, 4, or 5 of your Soul Tokens in a Row or Column, you remove them and score points equal to the number of tokens you remove. All Tokens above the removed Soul Tokens fall to the bottom most portion of the board. The first player to reach 15 points wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fantasy, Puzzle, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Skaven Team Card Pack
description:
This is a pack of 44 handy reference cards for a Skaven Blood Bowl team, along with blank cards allowing every coach to create their own players! Contained in the pack:


Reference cards for Lineman, Gutter Runner, Thrower, Blitzer and Rat Ogre.;
Reference cards for the following Star Players: Glart Smashrip, Hakflem Skuttlespike, Kreek Rustgouger;
The following blank cards that you can use to create your own players: 10 Linemen, 6 Gutter Runners, 3 Throwers, 3 Blitzers, 2 Rat Ogres;
A team roster card, with match record on the reverse;
The following 10 Special Play cards: Assassination Attempt, For Whom the Bell Tolls, Warpstone Dust, Rat Race, The Musk of Fear, What's It Made Of?, Concussion, Warp Lightning, Total Eclipse, Fleas!


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Schusselige Schurken
description:
As a real rogue, you bag plenty of loot. So much that you have to stash it away in treasure troves. If only you could remember where the heck you have hidden it. 18 doors – and they all look identical. But where was that trap hidden again? Can you stay on top of things?

Go through all the treasure troves, one by one. As you go, each in turn says the number of the next treasure trove. Start with “1” and work your way through to “18”. It sounds easy enough, but be careful: some of the treasure troves have traps hidden in them. In that case, you don’t say the number, but must say a code word or make a secret sign instead. That’s the only way to escape the trap. Have your fellow rogues caught you making a mistake? Bad luck, now you collect penalty points. Have you caught one of the others? Good luck, then you receive points. At the end of the game, who is the one with the best memory and the most points?

—description from the publisher

name: Myth: Dark Frontier Swordsworn expansion
description:
This expansion for Myth comes in every copy of Myth: Dark Frontier.

Comes with:

1 Miniature
30 Card Novice Hero Deck
10 Card Journeyman Hero Deck
1 Hero Reference Card
2 Starting Gear cards
13 Exclusive Hero Myth Cards

The miniature is also used in Myth: Dark Frontier.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Beasts of Balance: Kickstarter Promo Battle Cards
description:
This Kickstarter Promo contains 2 new Battle Cards, Divine Rewind and Friendly Fire.

Divine Rewind: Select a Beast. It transforms into an earlier version of itself.

Friendly Fire: The next 15 seconds of volcano damage will instead give life to your Beasts.

The prototypes of these cards were called Theory of Devolution and Lava-Va-Voom! respectively.

name: Dungeon Fighter: Jean Solo Promo Card
description:
Jean Solo bonus card for Dungeon Fighter, handed out by Horrible Games at Spiel in Essen 2018.

Jean has 3 abilities that can be used after hitting a monster (Adrenaline: double damage; Scavenge: draw and distribute 3 equipment cards; Explore: Look at the topmost monster card from the tower).

When you Hit a Monster, place 1 XP on your Hero sheet (not on the Chest token). When you activate on of Jean Solo's special abilities, you must also discard the indicated amount of XP from your hero sheet. if you can't, you activate the ability.

ADRENALINE: Discard 3 XP. You may double the damage dealt by
this throw OR recover 1 HP for each damage dealt.

SCAVENGE: Discard 2 XP. Draw 3 Equipment cards and put them aside face-down. Distribute these cards after the fight.

EXPLORE: Discard 1 XP. Look at the topmost Monster card from the tower, then either put it back or place it at the bottom of its pile.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Envyra: Easter Promo Tiles
description:
This mini expansion makes grey high point tiles easier to get for more players thus creating greater competition later in the game.

Allows to play Envyra ADRENALINE MODE!

SETUP & RULES:
At the beginning of the game, replace 2 tiles (4/5 point) as displayed (replaced tiles are not used in the game). During the game, player is eligible to move his cube on to Easter tiles as soon as they have captured tiles of at least 2 different themes (colors).
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Deduction, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Yōkai Quest: Mystic Forest
description: The second expansion for Yōkai Quest allows you to face with the forces of mystic forest and brings 2 new heroes to play, new items and adventures.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Vampire Counts
description:
Warhammer: Vampire Counts is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Vampire Counts faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Fairy Fair
description:
The Fairies are having their Fair, and it's exactly as magical as it sounds! What's not so magical is the intense planning that goes into making the annual event a success. This year, the fairies have turned to YOU, fair impresario extraordinaire, to bring together all the elements needed for the grand occasion. Fail, and you'll let down not only the fairies, but all the kids of the various assorted fantasy races who have been looking forward to this magical night all year long.

Fairy Fair is a solitaire, print-and-play, roll-and-write game that takes place in the Legends of Dsyx fantasy setting.

The player will roll dice to build various stalls and attractions inside a grid representing the fair grounds. Don't like what you've rolled? Roll again! Unlike in most roll-and-write games, players have UNLIMITED rerolls to make sure they get the fair just right. Unlimited, that is... until doubles come up, at which point the turn immediately ends without the chance to build anything at all. Sorry, but life isn't "fair!"

Once the time track representing the approach of opening night is completely filled in, however, is when the games -- and game -- REALLY begins. Now, the player must guide the revelers along the choicest path through the fair, stopping at the various attractions to play carnival games, eat fanciful foods, and ride the many magical rides. Attractions alongside this path will flourish, while those that receive no foot traffic will need to close.

Only those sights that remain open at the end of the fair will score points, and only by scoring high will the fairies even consider hiring you for the job again next year.


Released in the September 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: City Building, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Arch Villain
description:
Arch Villain is a push-your-luck game where you are trying to build your super hero and as you do the villain gets stronger and is trying to knock you out of the round. The game is played in 5 rounds in which each player is dealing with the same villain. Each player must either arrest the villain, leave the conflict to protect citizens, or get defeated.

Players place power cards, talent cards, health tokens, die tokens, energy tokens, and weapon cards in a drafting area of the board. Players can then either draft each round (which includes buying weapons, buying powers, and buying talents with energy tokens) or attempt to arrest the villain.

When a player arrests the villain, he gets a bonus power, contact, or other token or card choice--the first player to arrest the villain gets first pick.

Each round has a new, stronger villain. If a player is defeated, he leaves the round and gets a consolation prize of health and energy to help with the next round.

Victory points are gained as the arrest takes place and bonus points are part of the options for victorious heroes. The player with the most points at the end of 5 rounds is the winner.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Dragon Castle: La Fortezza di Moongha
description:
Originally available at "Modena Play 2019", as a promo.

A new castle layout.

—user summary
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Crazy Burger
description:
Crazy Burger is a game about making hamburgers and stopping other players from doing the same.

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME:
The first player to get a full set of seven cards featuring all hamburger ingredients wins the game.

CARDS:
There are 7 ingredient cards and 10 special cards. Each card is in the deck 6 times. Players begin with a starting hand of 7 cards.

GENERAL RULES:
At the beginning of each turn take a card, either from the deck or from the top of the discard pile. If the player doesn’t want to draw a card they can pass.

At the beginning of a turn, a player may draw a card from the draw pile or the discard pile. Then they can play cards from their hands. The special cards are used to attack other players, mostly forcing them to discard or give away hand cards. A player who loses their last hand card is eliminated from the game.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Set Collection, Take That

name: Card Hunt
description:
In Card Hunt, players play increasing higher cards to try and earn the most points. The game is played with a standard deck of cards. All players start with a series of cards from 2 to Ace. After playing any card, the players take turns over multiple rounds playing a card with a higher value or passing. Whoever played the last and, therefore, highest card, receives the whole trick. The goal is to gain as many cards as possible through these tricks.

Included in New Tactical Games with Dice and Cards.

name: Bioutifoul
description:
You are a very Bioutifoul art dealer! A parody of the art world with magnificent designs. Easy to play and take along.

Bioutifoul includes 24 original works, signed Sophie Gerl!

You are the head of an art gallery and you work with the greatest artists of the moment. You make it rain and shine on their quarries. Each of your exhibitions goes around the world, and your love of art is measured by gold bars. Who among you will have the most Bioutifoul gallery?

How it works ?
4 artists: Alice, Sunny, Heinrich, and Rodrigo.
It's up to you to influence their odds at the right time, to buy or sell their paintings at the best prices. The Influence cards you play will also help your opponents! You are free to buy, sell, or mount exhibitions, within the limit of 3 actions per turn. Those of your choice, in the order of your choice. The artists you work with will be important at the end of the game, as the most Bioutifoul gallery is the one that has passed the most prestigious exhibitions.

(Publisher's description)

...

Vous êtes un marchand d’art very Bioutifoul ! Une parodie du monde de l’art aux dessins magnifiques. Facile à jouer et à emmener.

Bioutifoul comprend 24 œuvres originales, signées Sophie Gerl !

Vous êtes à la tête d’une galerie d’art et vous travaillez avec les plus grands artistes du moment. Vous faites la pluie et le beau temps sur leurs carrières. Chacune de vos expositions fait le tour du monde, et votre amour de l’art se mesure à coups de lingots d’or. Qui parmi vous aura la galerie la plus Bioutifoul ?

name: Cocktail Party
description:
Unleash the inner mixologist in you with the Cocktail Party card game from Ridley's Games! Lift your spirits and collect the right ingredient cards to make the highest scoring cocktails before last call! The game is played in rounds, and each round consists of 2 phases. During the Ingredient Phase, all players get to take an ingredient from the centre. In the Cocktail phase, all players have the opportunity to make a drink from the centre by discarding cards from their hand. Don't forget to tip the bartender along the way.

—description from the publisher

name: Federation Planetary Force
description:
Who says the fly boys should have all the fun? We grunts, we happy few, live life hard and full. Do you have what it takes? Can you achieve the rank of Grand General before the bugged-eyed aliens call in your marker? All you need to do is advance 11 ranks, commanding 11 increasing assignments, while engaging in 22 different missions and acquiring up to 15 different skills. You also are eligible for decorations and commendations of the highest order. Sound like a lot to track? Nonsense! It is all contained on ONE page. You roll. You write. Hopefully, you get promoted . . . or at least live to fight another day . . . which for grunts, is all we ask. This follow-ups Federation Stellar Force and the next game in the One Page In A Life Series (OPIAL Series).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Monopoly: Gent
description:
The city of "Artevelde" is for sale! Ghent, the proud city, is maybe one of the most varied cities of Flanders.
A historical center, which dates from the Middle Ages, is combined with modern architeccture, art and a vibrant atmosphere.

Monopoly Gent is the ideal way to (re)discover Ghent in a different way. Visit the "Sint-Baafs" cathedral, buy the "Gravensteen", build a hotel on the "Korenmarkt", go shopping in the "Veldstraat" or treat your friends during the "Gentse Feesten"! This version of Monopoly takes you to all the beauty the city of Ghent has to offer.

This unique edition is the gadget for every inhabitant of Ghent or Ghent-lover.

Have a lot of fun during playing the game and especially: "Nie neute, Nie pleuje"!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Havana Dice
description:
Havana Dice is a stylish Cuban twist on the traditional bluffing game of Liar's Dice, also known as Dudo. Roll the dice in this push-your-luck game that is at once fast-paced and easy-to-learn.

Using poker dice and unique dice cups, players roll their own dice in secret before bidding on the number of dice under everyone's cups—but if a bluff is successfully called, the bluffer loses a die.

Poker chips act as wild dice. A player may discard them when their bid is called to act as a die with the value of their bid. Once a call is made, but before players reveal their dice, the bidder must announce that they are using one or more of their poker chips and discard them. Every discarded poker chip counts as one die of the current value.

—description from the publisher

name: Sprytny Lisek
description:
"Clever Fox"

Catch the fox before he catches your chickens!

Together with other players, play the role of hosts, whose peaceful life is disturbed by the appearance of a certain guest. Protect your ducks, chickens, rabbits, geese and turkeys from the red fox with the help of the fearless Burk!

Sprytny Lisek ("Clever fox") is a cute card game for the youngest players. Pleasant and funny plot, enriched with beautiful illustrations of animals, will become an ideal form of spending time together with the child.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Złap liska ,zanim on złapie Twoje kury!

Wraz z innymi graczami wcielcie się w rolę gospodarzy, których spokojne życie zakłóca pojawienie się pewnego gościa. Przy pomocy nieustraszonego psa Burka ochroń swoje kaczki, kury, króliki, gęsi i indyki przed rudym lisem!

„Sprytny lisek” to urocza gra karciana dla najmłodszych graczy. Przyjemna i zabawna fabuła, wzbogacona pięknymi ilustracjami zwierząt, stanie się idealną formą wspólnego spędzania czasu z dzieckiem.

—description from the publisher

name: Treasures of Microlandia
description:
"There has to be some treasure somewhere on this island...right?"

Treasures of Microlandia is a two player deduction game about digging up your rival's treasure before they discover yours! Players begin the game by choosing where to bury their treasure on the map. On your turn, you can either ask a question about where the treasure is located, or you can guess the treasure's exact location. The first player to dig up treasure wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, Map Reduction, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition

name: Black Party: Der Tod des Paten
description:
In Black Party the players embody figures who are involved into a spectacular murder case. One of the players is the murderer. But the others also have their dirty secrets or a motive and each of them have an extra task that only they know.
The group decides by guessing and reconstructing the crime who is the murderer and afterwards the players see if the group was on the right track. So it's about getting away with life. Because what good is it to be innocent if the others think you are guilty?

In Black Party - Der Tod des Paten the players are members of a mafia in Montemare.
One day the godfather is shot from a passing Fiat as he leaves the church. Who is the murderer?
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Negotiation, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Crazier Eights: Olympus
description:
A gateway fantasy card game in the world of Greek mythology with gods, heroes, and other aspects of the stories.

The game consists in a 52 card deck. Every card has a unique ability. The first player with 0 cards in hand wins.

—description from the publisher

name: The Field of the Sun
description:
In The Field of the Sun, players flip cards from a communal deck of cards, hoping to collect certain suits of cards. The game will end when the deck is exhausted, and the player with the most cards of each suit will score positive points for that suit, but all other players will score negative points. The player with the most points wins.

On their turn, a player flips cards from the deck one by one into a row. After each card, the player may choose to stop; if they do, they collect any one card from the row and place it face up in front of themselves. If a player reveals a card of the same suit as one already present, their turn ends immediately and they must take the last revealed card.

There are a few special cards; the row is not reset between players' turns; and when the second card of a pair is collected, the two cards may be turned face down for a specific amount of positive points at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Little Future (リトルフューチャー)

name: Giddy Up! Game
description:
Saddle up and ride with horses of every color, breed, and personality! Round-up four beautifully photographed horse cards and read a colorful description of a horse. Then, each player secretly votes which horse best suits that story. Score when your "horse sense" matches other players. You'll be surprised what your horse-loving friends think!

—description from the publisher

name: Dicetopia: Faction Pack
description: Five extra Factions for Dicetopia from the Kickstarter campaign - Backers, Divers, The Caligula, The Umbra, and The Hex Swarm.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: TorKings
description:
TorKings is the game connoisseur’s (geek-worthy) extreme upgrade of the classic game of alignment.

There’s new rules, new game options and hardware from the distant future. It's now a whole lot more than the old game of line up 4!

The games now range from the classic game of Align4 (4 in a row) to TorLord – the creative mode where you win title of TorLord or TorKing and the right to change and evolve your own rules of engagement with a diversified set of tokens.

In between those games are the games of TorGalor and TorKings – both radical and massive improvements to the game of alignment that truly unleash the genre’s strategic depth and gameplay diversity to the next level.

Then there’s the new interactive cooperative team play mode that blows the dynamics out of the water even further. A game mode that really hits the sweet spot with satisfying, engaging fun for families and friends.
New Developmental Tool: With both enhanced strategy games and interactive cooperative team play, TorKings is a new cross purposed STEM and Social IQ building tool. Idea for developing minds and team building alike.

The Geek Spectrum: TorKings gameplay is adaptive to suit the full spectrum of players. Pick your board size, pick your game and pick your team. Wherever you lie on the spectrum – there’s a game option to suit.

As immersive and fun as good Euro-games are they are unfortunately cursed by lengthy rules that are difficult to access, long gameplay and lengthy setup.

TorKings is a complete matrix of game options to suit your occasion. The rules are super accessible, the game depth is selectable from newb to guru, the game duration is also selectable, the setup practically instant, you can play on a single, double or triple sized board and you can play one-on-one or play interactively in teams! – That’s one freaking convenient and dynamic piece of gameware!

So players of all ages can dive into the fun of the game of their choice in no time. – Quick, easy, super engaging and a load of fun!

Way Back: The classic game of alignment goes back 5 decades (released as Connect4 in 1974). It’s one of the most popular board games in the western world. We’ve either grown up with it (or a clone) or we’ve been adults with kids who have played it to infinity and beyond.

But it’s a classic - so why change it? The answer is that the gameplay is massively underdeveloped!
The telling proof of that is the general attrition of the game by the time players hit their tweens. Albeit - they then grow up and return to the game for a similar time period with their own kids!

The reasons for tween attrition are many but the most important factor is that the gameplay of chasing a single alignment is not strategically rich enough to maintain interest for naturally expanding minds. It’s too confined, too routine and lacks diversity. If only those problems could be fixed…

By comparison other strategic games like Go and Chess have a good following as minds mature. Those games have the strategic richness to match and engage evolving minds.
But how do you make the game of alignment strategically richer to engage growing and mature minds? The answer is layered but here are the basic elements of the solution:
1. Kill the sudden death approach.
• Getting a single alignment is fun. But getting multiple alignments is a lot more fun - so in the new rules a side wins by getting the most alignments in a game.
• That finally opens up the new possibility of getting more points for multiple alignments.
• As the game plays on through alignments there is a far richer move and counter-move dynamic set up. The dynamic shift to achieving the more dynamic multiple alignments while of course blocking the bigger game or your opponent.
• Such a simple and obvious rule change – but with a massive cascade of instantly compounding strategic depth and dynamics
• You now also get paid for each new alignment you make - from your opponents unplayed tokens. That’s also the super simple way you keep score! Again super satisfying and adding another layer of risk management, separation anxiety and competitive dynamics. – Genius!
2. Expand the game board size
• Modular board games allow the board to get wider and that finally allows the strategic development to expand. The result - a massive increase in player engagement and satisfaction.
3. Introduce a diversity of token characters with new properties to meaningfully contribute to the gameplay and diversify game options further. A satisfying upgrade for seasoned strategists.
4. Open up interactive co-op team play
• The modular boards are a total natural fit for others to join and play interactive cooperative team games. The result is a further cascade in dynamics as the human element is introduced. It’s easily one of the most fun ways to play. It’s also one of the most accessible co-op styled board-games in the world! A true contender that may finally bring cooperative styled boardgaming into the mainstream!
Flexibility: The options above can be toggled on or off in different game options to allow players to grow into the new gameplay levels. Combining all of the above entirely unleashes the true potential of the strategic alignment genre. Once you play the new games it feels strange indeed that it’s taken 5 decades to finally make this most obvious transition.

The Revolutionary New Hardware:
• Smart Tokens: Now your tokens finally sort themselves and shoot straight back at you at the press of a button. That gives you more game time and turns the tedious task of manually sorting tokens into a magic treat for everyone, every game!
• Modular Gameboards: Players can now join up to 3 boards together to make a bigger fully integrated board. The result is a massive boost to gameplay diversity and depth.
• Iconic 3D tokens: We’ve turned design thinking inside out when we developed the TorKings tokens. They are a mixture of sculpted 3D forms and voids beautifully framed by the surrounding torus. They are a breakthrough in visual accessibility that allows token diversity to explode along with gameplay depth. They are also very tactile and visually stunning in the game grid.
• Snap Latch : We’ve put an end to the violation of your tokens randomly releasing in the middle of your game. The snap latch snaps shut and secures your game.
• Spinners: The tokens can spin in a variety of ways. They are handy as timers, selectors and impressively cool play things in their own right.
• Safety: The tokens re designed to allow airflow regardless of orientation in an airway. That allows parents to breathe a little easier when younger kids inadvertently wander into the mix.
• Premium Quality: We’ve designed the game to be a very different premium journey for players of all ages. It’s a completely new level of enjoyment and fun.

Description from the designer - James T.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Educational, Math, Party Game

name: Nordwind 1945
description:
Game covers operation Norwind, the last major German offensive operation at the western front during World War 2. The goal of the offensive was to break through the lines of the U.S. Seventh Army and French 1st Army in the Upper Vosges mountains and the Alsatian Plain, and destroy them, as well as the seizure of Strasbourg. If it'd happen, Germans planned to continue their attack on the rear of the American 3rd Army.

Additional scenarios pictures French attack on Colmar and American counterattack after the failure of the German offensive.

Game uses WB-95 system, regiment-scale, with American, French and German (regular and SS) units.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Into the East
description: Extends the Invasions map eastward to central Asia and northwest India. Adds three nations (Göktürks (Blue Turks), Guptas, and Kidarites), two independent kingdoms (Ghassanids and Lakhmids), and some additional special units (such as the Armenian heavy cavalry).
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Bearzzz
description:
Mmmm, the honey's delicious. Help Little Bear to take 5 pots of honey from the kitchen while Mummy Bear sleeps on her rocking chair. But be careful, because some noises could make Mummy Bear wake up and catch us.

Roll the dice to know the color of the cards we should flip, if it's a honey pot, Great!!, if it's something which make noise, Carefull!!, because that could make Mummy Bear wake up, but if we flip the card with no noise, then Mummy Bear will sleeps again.
We will win if we get all the honey pots before bear Mum wake up, otherwise, we lose.
It's a cooperation game for 2+

name: Drinking Quest: Old Habits
description:
A great stand-alone game or the followup to DQ: Liquor Before Honor
A throwback to the golden age of 80’s RPGs!

Quest 1: Slime Time

In this quest the heroes will fight oozing monsters, find sticky treasure chests, avoid slimy salesmen and maybe have a slippery sexual encounter or two.

Quest 2: OktoberQuest

This quest pokes fun at heritage beer festivals.

Quest 3: Whiskey & Wights

You’ll fight the alcoholic undead! You’ll loot corpses, fight a wrecked reaper, drink a 10,000 year old Scotch and even stop to make bacon in your underwear!

Quest 4; Crafbor’s Keep

This quests see the adventuring party visit a CRAFT CIDER BREWERY run by a sadistic tyrant who really loves cider.

Bonus Quest: High Fantasy

After years of players asking Jason to make a “Weed Quest
the best that’s going to happen is this quest where the heroes walk through an Alice in Wonderland type forest with hallucinogenic effects.

Bonus Quest: Sober Up PSAs

This quest features 12 ways to sober up in Public Service Announcement style. Add this quest onto the end of the game if you want to drink some water.

—description from the publisher

name: Lost Worlds: "Brimstone" The Fire Giant
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.


This book represents Brimstone the Fire Giant a character in the Lost Worlds Series of combat picture games, and is playable with all other books that carry the Lost Worlds logo. each book is unique and has its own special qualities. Collect them and discover for yourself their magic.

(From the booklet: Lost Worlds: "Brimstone" the Fire Giant)
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Tee Oder Kaffee Refill
description:
Collect sets of breakfast or tea time menus and gain victory points. In this tiny set collection game you play sets of cards to score points and get your hand empty, because this brings you bonus points.
The twist is between collecting bigger sets to score more points for a single set or play smaller sets to score for the empty-hand-bonus and get 5 new cards for free.

With the new refill-edition you can play the game with up to 6 players and you get the new refill cards. These return a tea or coffee back to your hand or bring an extra point on cake sets. You must flip your refill-card after every use.

The game comes in a tiny tin box and you can take it with you everywhere you go.

—description from the publisher

name: Gingerbreads
description:
Gingerbreads is a cooperative family game, in which the players will be helping uncle Otto with his order: baking polyominos of gingerbread, coating them with different-colored icing and storing them in the box. If the players fill the box completely before the icing runs out, they win!

During the game the players take turns, going clockwise. On their turn, the player must perform one of the following actions:

• Bake a gingerbread: roll the die — its face will show the gingerbread shape(s) the player will be able to bake during their turn. They choose one shape and take the topmost gingerbread from the corresponding pile for themselves. Each player may have only one gingerbread in front of themselves at a time. The player may also adjust the die result, discard their current gingerbread, or refresh one of the gingerbread piles — but they will have to discard an Icing sphere — the most valuable resource — for that!

• Coat their gingerbread with one Icing sphere: the player chooses 1 of the 9 available Icing spheres from the dispenser that would fit their gingerbread and place it on the corresponding slot of the tile.

• If the player can’t or doesn’t want to do anything of the above, they must discard an Icing sphere from the dispenser.

There are three complexity levels: easy, medium, and hard.
Easy level: No die rolling — the kids bake gingerbreads of any shapes. 

Hard level: Malfunction cards are added — they affect the Icing dispenser and introduce different restrictions for the current turn.

-description from publisher
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Industry / Manufacturing, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Matching, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Megawatt: Discover Energy
description:
Megawatt is a card game that challenges you to build an electricity grid. Use Tech cards to supply power and Upgrade cards to improve your grid. Boost your hand or mess with other players using Action cards.

Adapt as the world changes around you when new Event cards appear. Events cover a variety of real-world scenarios which put your grid to the test. Can you power the future?

Find out more at www.megawatt.game

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Events, Hand Management, Income, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Take That

name: Borneo
description: This is a board game version of Borneo.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Pâtée Impériale
description:
Pâtée Impériale is a game of strategy cards, combinations and memory to be played individually or in teams of two.

Form the best suite of courtiers in order to obtain the most prestige points and get noticed by the emperor.

Each player starts with an equal number of cards in hand. Players take turns choosing a card and performing the described action.

At the end of 3 rounds, you should have accumulated the most prestige points than your opponents to win the game.

name: Triathlon
description:
A trick taker for three players in which you try to complete a "triathlon" by accomplishing three tasks: winning a number of tricks equal to a multiple of three (3, 6, 9, or 12 tricks,) winning the last trick of the hand, and winning the "middling" number of tricks (neither the least or the most.)

If you complete a triathlon in one hand, you immediately win! Otherwise, whichever player is able to first complete three triathlons across multiple hands wins.

The game is played with a 39 card deck: A-6 in four suits, plus three jokers.

—user summary

name: Card Shark Pool
description:
It's like pool, but with cards.

Card Shark Pool is a light-weight, casual card and dice game for two players. Plan your shots, clear the table.

There are no complex calculations for angle or rebounds. Roll dice based on the length of the shot, and use special abilities on each card to draw, roll, and carom.

—description from the publisher

name: The Final Light-Year: The Cratos Sector
description:
April 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds a new sector map, new overlord, minion and commander ships and a new event.


Released in the April 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Betrayal!
description:
Shortly after Poland was conquered in 1939, Hitler begin urging an immediate attack in the West. The original plans were uninspiring and his generals feared an attritional stalemate. Over the winter the Germans keep taking the measure of their opponents and hit upon a plan was that inspired, risky, and utterly decisive. Ironic of Hitler to assume his remarkable success was simply the new template for all future campaigns. His eyes turned east.

But why, exactly, did France fall? Against the Odds 2017 Annual features four top designers all tasked with re-examining the 1940 campaign and answering that very question.

'Betrayal!' is a strategic level game of the German invasion of France, Belgium, and the Netherlands in May 1940. After
finishing campaigns in Poland, Denmark, and Norway, Hitler turned to France. The goal was to knock France down and
then prepare for the subjugation of Britain and the invasion of the Soviet Union.

Pre-war planning, coupled with valuable experience gained in Poland, would lead the Wehrmacht to excel in lightning
warfare never before seen on such a massive scale. While the French had re-visited World War One with a static Maginot
Line defending their border, the Germans went beyond this and brought in blitzkrieg. There were a few bumps along the
way. The smaller British army and those from tiny Belgium and Netherlands tried to help France.

The game has two Allied players, one French and one British. They will alternate, depending on initiative, in handling
the automata German side. Internal differences between the allies can arise according to their separate and unique victory conditions.

name: Crocs' Socks!
description:
Oh oh, the crocodile's missing a sock! Who is the fastest and finds his matching sock so that Kroko has a complete pair again? The Crocs' Socks! game is an active board game for children and parents. You play it with one to four players. The game consists of cards with coloured socks, cards with a crocodile with only one sock on and four ploppers. One of the participants turns over a card and then everyone tries to catch the missing sock with the plopper as quickly as possible. But watch out! Does Kroko need a left or right sock?

—description from the publisher

name: Schermstrijd
description:
Schermstrijd is a family game. Children battle against their parents to gain more screentime! It's a simple card game in which you try to duplicate the colored wifi-code laid out in the center of the table. Sabotage your opponents and be the first to complete your code to win the game!

The game is played in 3 to 5 rounds (you can choose). Set a starting time and roll the dice to see how much screentime can be added or extracted.
4 colored wifi-card are layed out in the center in the beginning of the round. The first player to duplicate the code wins the round.

During a turn you roll a dice to see what actions you may perform. This can vary from stealing a card to changing the code in the center. You play cards to complete your code or to prevent your opponents to complete theirs.

Schermstrijd the battle is a fun and easy family game to end discussions about, well... screentime. In only 30 minutes of offline fun it is settled. Do you dare to battle?

—description from the publisher

name: The Fox and the Rabbit
description:
A solitaire roll and write game created for the 10th Roll and Write contest.

Players roll 3d6 (red, blue & yellow) and use the values to lead both the fox and the rabbit along trails to find food. Dice can be combined to cross the primary, secondary and black numbers on the trails. Players can use powers to modify dice and can gain extra dice or powers during the game.

Meanwhile, at the end of each turn the Farmer AI sets a trap.

When both animals have eaten 3+ foods they can escape through the fence using the required values. Alternatively, once the Farmer AI sets his 13th trap, he will try to set it off using a different required value.

Whichever achieves the required values first (both animals OR the farmer)wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The World Travelers Society
description:
The World Travelers Society is a tabletop adventure game with a strong narrative, inspired by true events sprinkled with bits of a treasure hunt and at the heart of it, a mysterious box.

Your adventure will start with a hand-made wooden box and padlocks with Chinese characters preventing you from getting inside. After opening the main compartment you will go through a myriad of documents and artifacts that will transport you to 1930s Shanghai, when the city was called the Paris of the Orient, catered to every whim of the rich, and became known as a place of vice and indulgence.

Working on the clues in the box alone won’t be enough, being inspired by true stories, people and places you’ll have to go out into the real world to continue your investigation, going down rabbit holes, looking through existing online archives and books, watching videos taken in Shanghai — just about anything to immerse you in the narrative and help you find true traces from the past to help you solve clues in today’s world…

You can play this game alone or with a group. Your ultimate goal is discover the World Travelers Society’s Secret by deciphering one by one all the clues.

Every time you solve a clue, simply enter your answer in the dedicated website. If it's correct, you'll receive a confirmation. You can also use the Hints to nudge you toward the right direction.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Roll and Colour: Notepads
description:
A roll and write game with a difference — it’s all about colouring! Simple game which can be a relaxing solo experience or a competitive race, with easy, medium and hard versions.

The game is played on small A6 sheets. Each shows a 3x3 grid with 17 shapes drawn across the grid. Columns are numbered 1,2,3 while rows are labelled 4,5,6. A different colour is also assigned to each number.

Roll four dice. Choose a column, row, and colour from the four results. Select an appropriate shape and colour it in. Repeat until one player has filled in their sheet.

The aim of the game is the end up with non-adjacent colours. Score one point for each shape which does NOT share a grid square with a shape of the same colour. On easy sheets score an additional point for each of the six colours used, while on harder sheets score for colours used on different types of shapes, or for a specific shape.

Comes with three different designs: tulips (easy), frogs and lilies (medium), and balloons (hard).

-description from publisher

name: dungeon in memory
description: In dungeon in memory, players place one tile at a time in a stack. During the game, the players are considering what the path of the tiles would look like if they were laid out according to the direction showed. When a player thinks that the path has run into itself and cannot proceed, they add their "lost" tile into the stack. When all or all but one player have added their "lost" tile to the stack, the players resolve. The tiles are laid out from the start tile and players who accurately predicted when the path could not continue will earn a point. The first player to earn 3 points wins.

name: Spy Business
description:
The 60s. The Cold War at its peak. The secret services of the world powers sabotage, assassinate, blackmail and intrigue. Only the actions should not come out. Stealth is everything.

Spy Business is a tactical, deductive card game for two spies aged 8 and up. You take the lead of two rival intelligence agencies and try to find out as much information about each other's actions as possible.

At the same time, you are careful to keep your own actions secret. The more explosive an action is, the higher its value and the more important it is that it doesn't come to light.

You may now take turns revealing four cards at a time. Then add up the points of the revealed cards. Every enemy secret goes to your account, no matter who revealed it. The points of the double agent go to the person who uncovered it. However, no points are awarded for the dead end. When you have deducted the minus points from the overlapped cards, whoever has the most points left over wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: The Tower of the Ice Lich
description:
The Tower of the Ice Lich is a fast, simple, solo-adventure dungeon card game created as a pixelated homage to 16-bit videogames, fantasy RPGs, and classic Sword and Sorcery literature.

Choose between 4 characters. Face multiple challenges in the form of 30 unique rooms and 30 different events and acquire 12 marvelous items that help you on the way to defeat the Lich and its 9 special attacks.

Replay and experience a different tower the next time. Or use the cards as inspiration when you need a quick dungeon for your regular RPG session.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: NameIt!
description:
The audio-based trivia game.

NameIt! contains over 400 audio questions that test your knowledge of songs, signature tunes from TV and movies, animal sounds and lots of mysterious sounds.

The goal of the game is to recognize as many sounds as possible, as quickly as possible. The first player to 20 points wins the game.

The game is controlled by an electronic box that determines which category the question will be in. Each player has a button on the box that they then press as soon as they know the answer. After the gong sounds, the game says the correct answer and if the player answered correctly they get points, but if the answer was wrong then the other players get points.

name: Founders of Teotihuacan: Worship Tiles
description:
Originally available in pack E of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

3 new worship tiles to add in to their respective stacks.

Green tile: Spend 1 Stone, and 1 Wood to receive 3 Victory Points. This may be repeated to a maximum of 12 Victory Points in total.

Blue tile: Multiply the number of Green Temples within your City by the number of Stone Buildings you have, and receive that many Victory Points (to a maximum of 9 Victory Points).

Red tile: Receive 4 victory points and choose one of your Worship tiles, and resolve its effect.

name: Homeland
description:
Welcome to Homeland – A 2-6 player, fantasy, strategy, and barter card game – where an entire world fits into your pocket!
Homeland aims to fill the void between a simple party game and a complex strategy game. It is perfect for those who gravitate towards strategy games, those who standardly don't have interest in games, families, and everyone in between. It is extremely simple to pick up for first timers, and each round only takes about 15-30 minutes.

The game contains 53 cards. Players will live in one of six regions with a distinct terrain and climate, represented through cards. You also have "tamed beasts" cards with which you maximize your strength through combinations of the beast cards whose power is tied to climate and terrain of the region cards. Use Military Might cards which capitalizes on their terrain and brethren. Construction & Agriculture cards provide additional bonuses based on climate. Players can also utilize Climate Change effects to alter all Homelands and World Effects to damage specific climates and terrains.

Players will rely on luck, strategy, and bartering ability to lock-in five cards over the course of the game to create the strongest Homeland!

—description from the designer

HOMELAND - The Rules
PocketableGames.com
Players 2-6 I Time: 15-30min I Ages: 10+
SETUP:
-Each player randomly receives one of the six HOMELAND cards; your HOMELAND has a Climate and Terrain
-Your HOMELAND card is placed faceup and visible to all players
-Remove the remaining HOMELAND cards from play
-The Hand: Shuffle and deal 7 new cards to each player. These cards are MILITARY, AGRICULTURE, TAMED BEAST, WORLD EFFECT, and CLIMATE CHANGE cards -they award or penalize points based on your Climate and Terrain as well as complementary bonuses
GAMEPLAY:
-One randomly selected player begins as the Lead and places a card from their hand faceup on the table as the main offering
-All other players simultaneously offer a card they would be willing to trade the Lead
-The Lead may either accept a single trade or discard their own offering and draw a new card (if the deck is empty you must trade)
-The traded/untraded cards are returned to their owner's hand
-The Lead locks in a card from their hand facedown to strengthen their HOMELAND
-Play passes to the right, the new Lead repeats the above steps
-The game is finished when all players have locked in 5 cards finalizing their HOMELAND
SCORING:
-Players reveal, starting with the initial lead and passing right, if they locked in any Climate Change cards; effects take place in order of reveal
-Players then total their remaining locked in cards
-The HOMELAND with the most points is the winner!

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Gnarlwood – Gryselle's Arenai
description:
The Har Kuron Hurricane has descended on the Gnarlwood, and Gryselle the Slaughterer leads her band of gladiators on a mission of sanctified murder to hone their skills. The Arenai are masterful warriors, each a veteran of countless mortal duels – but they are also peerless performers, their acrobatic leaps and dazzling flourishes making every act of carnage a prayer to their bloody god. Gryselle’s coterie of killers each has her own speciality – Retaria vaults across the battlefield while Kalexis launches lightning-fast attacks with her bladed armour. Thrialla uses a barbed whip to toy with her victims, as Traxya punishes each misstep made by her opponent with her blade and buckler.

Gryselle's Arenai are an aggressive warband seeking to drown the Gnarlwood in blood. Thanks to their persistent Flourish ploys and deadly Combo attacks, these fast-moving aelves can put out a huge amount of damage while nimbly dancing away from any reprisals. This set includes a full Rivals deck to use straight out of the box, and the models are all push-fit – so you can get playing nice and quick.

This set includes:

5x push-fit Gryselle's Arenai miniatures – no glue required to assemble, cast in bloody red plastic to stand out even when unpainted



5x double-sided fighter cards, one for each warrior in the warband – Gryselle the Slaughterer, Retaria the Entangler, Kalexis the Silvered Blur, Thrialla the Lash, and Traxya the Aegis



1x Gryselle's Arenai Warband Background / Rivals Deck Card


A 32-card Rivals deck consisting of:

12x Gryselle's Arenai objective cards
10x Gryselle's Arenai gambit cards
10x Gryselle's Arenai upgrade cards


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Wizard Kittens: Library Edition
description:
The card game of kittens and spells!

These wizard kittens have accidentally unleashed the contents of a book of curses! You and your fluffy friends must collect the escaped curses and put them back before the librarian, Professor Whispurr catches you!

This Library Edition of Wizard Kittens includes an additional character cat mat, Cinder, as well as the Magical Monsters Expansion with enough cards for a 5th player! Van Meowsing also joins your courageous crew of kittens to help defeat new magical monsters!

An adorably magical semi-cooperative set collecting card game by Magpie Games.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Greater Than Games, LLC, Magpie Games, Sovranti

name: Fishing Lessons: Leland's Tackle Box
description:
Plenty of people tried to gift Leland a new tackle box, but he always swore by this one. Perhaps it'll hold something useful for you, too.

This 4-card expansion for Fishing Lessons adds Tackle cards which must be played to win. Shuffle and randomly add 2 of them each game, with one face-up to start. When adding a card to the Lesson Row from your hand, you may play a face-up Tackle card as well. Tackle cards cover an existing Lesson card and replace it with a powerful action for the turn before being discarded to reveal the original Lesson. After playing a Tackle card, flip the other one face-up and play it on a subsequent turn. Play both before the game ends or you'll miss the boat!


A tackle card is played on top of an existing lesson card. When Step 2 is resolved, the actions on the tackle card are resolved –and then the tackle card is discarded right after it is finished. In this way, the tackle card replaces that lesson card only for the one turn, and in the next turn the lesson card underneath would be available again. The tackle card must be placed on top of a lesson card, and cannot be played on its own. The tackle card cannot be played on top of the lesson card added during the same round.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Programmed Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Hunt a Killer: Starstruck
description:
Just4Fun, a boy band from the early 2000s, planned to hold a reunion concert after years apart. During one of the rehearsals, Jake Morgan, the band’s frontman, died in a tragic stage accident. A superfan believes that Jake was murdered, and she’s willing to do anything to help you solve this case.

Contains no ciphers! You'll have to rely on your powers of deduction and observation to piece together this gripping murder mystery.

Difficulty: 1/5 - Easy

name: Ducky Ducky
description:
The duck fishing stand is in full swing. The ducks move forward as the water flows and the children try to catch them to win a range of prizes.
The players need to plan their moves in advance to catch the right ducks and match the various prize cards.

—description from the publisher

name: Build War
description:
"In a world where multiverse collide, players wage a war for their own universe.
The stakes are the characters called "applicants" who are important to the universe...
Players can call on characters from all the Multiverse to join their forces to form the strongest squad and win the war!"

Build War is a deck-building game with varying action phases and innovative mechanics for 1 to 4 players .
The four-player simultaneous deck-building phase proceeds at a very high speed and high tempo:

Each player receives 10 cards, assigning 5 cards to the initial deck and 5 cards to the initial hand.
Build Draw System: drawing two cards at the same time allows for speedy deck construction.
Cards can be acquired at no cost, so powerful cards can be played from the beginning. However, there is a space limitation and managing it is an important part of gameplay.
Color and number coded cards, each with its special ability, can be combined in powerful combos.
All players play the war phase simultaneously.
Revenge system: if you lose, you can take over 5 cards from the deck.
The war lasts four rounds, or until someone loses all their lives, and the player with the highest life at the end wins!
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Multi-Use Cards, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Outer Space: The Galaxy-Building Card Game
description:
Players take turns placing cards in a grid to create an ever-expanding galaxy. Players score points based on connecting stars to form constellations, nebulas, and black holes. Depending on which combination of scoring cards are in play, players can score points in different ways for each galaxy card played:

Stacking black holes on top of each other scores increasingly more points (1 black hole scores 1 point, 2 stacked scores 3 points, and 3 stacked scores 5 points and forms a supermassive black hole)
Each connection vertex of a constellation formed by playing a card earns 1 point
Each matching star in constellation chains scores 1 point
Each quadrant of a nebula added to or created by a card earns 1 point
Meteoroids score 1 point per nebula they go through and 2 points when they enter a black hole


The game ends when the last galaxy card is drawn. The player with the most points wins.

name: One-Hit Heroes
description:
Pick a hero and fight for your life! One-Hit Heroes is a co-operative boss rush game where your team must defeat the boss without getting hit even once. The more bosses you defeat, the more your Armory improves as you unlock more card variety each time you play an Episode.

Each boss has a custom deck of moves to try and land hits on your team, but each of you have a unique hero deck with your own tools for blocking, dodging and damaging the boss.

Defeat bosses to be rewarded with card packs that you can tear open and draft from. Each card pack will let you power up and specialize your hero further for the rest of the Episode. But in order to defeat the final boss of each Episode, you'll need more than just a refined deck - you'll need to play your cards carefully and work as a team to survive long enough to win.

Each turn has four phases: SCOUT, where you reveal the Boss's next move; FIGHT, where you play up to three cards; REST, where you redraw to five cards and clear your playing space; and SURVIVE, where you resolve the Boss Turn. When your life hangs by a thread, you want to defeat the boss before it has time to land a lucky hit - however, each damage you deal increases your Aggro, making you more vulnerable and making the boss even stronger. That means you can't simply DPS your way to victory — you'll also need to manage your Aggro and find ways to block with Items to avoid getting Hit.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Church VS. Martin Luther
description:
A must-follow trick-taking game where Martin Luther rebels against the sale of indulgences by the church.

In this game, the red suit (hearts and diamonds) represents money, and the black suit (spade and clubs) represents sin. Game includes a separate phase after trick-taking, where players may use 1 Indulgence card. Red, Black, and Indulgence Cards will be worth different points, depending on whether Martin Luther is present (i.e. a player has no trump and no Indulgence cards) during end-game scoring.

You need a standard playing card deck, in addition to the game-specific components (13 indulgence cards, 5 player aids, and 1 Japanese rules card).

name: Mr. Smith Living in Swiss
description:
Mr. Smith Living in Swiss (Tongue-twister) is a game of quickly reading or repeating sentences that are difficult to pronounce quickly. Race to accurately and swiftly read the unfolded word cards to claim victory.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: 5ive: King's Court Player Expansion
description:
The Player Expansion provides 15 additional cards to support 5-6 player games. Featuring Vikings, Ancient Egyptians and Tiki Characters - cards have been produced to seamlessly integrate to your standard 5ive: King's Court Deck.

For returning to standard 1-4 player games, 15 cards can be removed from the deck again, ensuring that 3 full 'courts' are removed (3 each of Block, Destroy, Recover, Draw, and Discard).
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: LumberJerks
description:
Embrace your inner jerk and chop block your friends. The aim of the game is to be the first player to chop down your tree, while making it as hard as possible for others to cut down theirs. The fastest lumberjerk wins!

Each player's turn is split into 2 phases:

During the Chopping phase, the player must attempt to chop their tree with a roll of 3 or higher. The game immediately ends when any player chops all 7 of their Tree cards; that player wins!
