Strategy Tactics [戦略 戦術] is a Tactical level Japanese board-wargame, published in 1985 by Bandai Games, based on a hypothetical World War 2 level weapon system.
This game is intended to be an "introductory" wargame for newcomers.

name: Teed Off
description: Golf with a deck of special cards.

name: I Giochi del 2000: Posto di Combattimento
description: Posto di Combattimento is a little but complete set of wargame rules about Naval Tactical combats in World War 2, this 32-pages booklet contains also all the characteristics for naval and aircraft units for Germany, UK, Italy, France, Japan and USA.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: NWS: Nights of Fury – Guadalcanal Naval Battles
description:
NWS: Nights of Fury - Guadalcanal Naval Battles is the first in a series of high intensity naval combat naval wargames that will offer realism and detail yet have streamlined and hard hitting game play for 2 players or solitaire play. Full color cards with highly detailed ship graphics for easy and quick recognition. Full color and detailed marker cards, random event cards, battle map, and plastic damage markers are also included. Full color island cards showing Savo, Florida, and Guadalcanal islands will also be used for the battle map. Scenario cards will include random events, weather, visibility, land effects, and other cards that will determine the setup and play of the battle. Quick result combat modifier charts will also be included to allow for fast reference to determine combat results.

All the critical details will be covered such as flotation and structural damage, spotting and detection, Admiral capabilities, formations, maneuvers, land effects, radar effects, armor ratings, fire controls, torpedo combat, gunnery, evasion, combat range effects, random events, crew qualities, searchlights and starshells, and more. This is not your typical generic naval card game where realism and detail are sacrificed for the sake of playability. The USN, RAN, and IJN ships each have their own researched and calculated combat factors and with the details to make combat realistic and effective. A rapid fire, efficient, and easy to learn combat system with basic, advanced, solitaire, and optional rules. No other naval combat card game has yet to incorporate the features this combat system will handle.

Game Info is available at: http://nws-online.proboards.com/thread/18/nights-fury

name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes
description:
Legend of the Galactic Heroes is a wargame set in a anime universe.
It is based on the most popular Japanese space opera novel "The Galactic Heroes Legend", "Ginga Eiyu Densetsu".

In the distant future, the Galactic World human is divided between two major powers: "Galactic Empire" and "Free Planets".
The Empire is under the rule of a dangerous emperor and corrupt aristocrats, while the people of the Free Planets have lost the ideals of their foundation and are under corrupt populism. Both camps have no ability to destroy the enemy or to settle the war which has dragged on for hundreds of years.

But the times have produced two geniuses of war into the same period. One is "Reinhard von Lohengramm", the incomparable artist of war.
The other is "Yang Wen-li", called "Miracle Yang", the magician of war. Their appearance will change the era that they live in.

In this game, players command Galactic Empire or Free Planets Alliance. This game contains three types of space combat ship units (BB, CL, CV) and various units which appeared in the original story. This game combines three types of starships, "Battleship", "Galaxy Cruiser", and "Galaxy Fighter".

The game uses a complete original system. Players organize Fleets under the command of unique admirals by combining characteristics of Starships. Each counter in the game is an Admiral and is rated by his fighting skills.

You use resource points to create or buy ships and put them under your admirals. The game system is very close to "Hitler's war".

When you fight a battle, each fleet is placed upon the combat display. A die is rolled for initiative and the phasing side then moves their ships. The tactical map has several columns, each denoting a range bracket. Players must determine how they will do with their ships. They can move once and fire or move twice and not fire. However, ships have certain ranges that they can be used at. Battleships can be used at long ranges, cruisers at medium, while carriers can be used at short ranges.



This game came out in Old Games Journal #40.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Income, Point to Point Movement, Variable Set-up

name: England Expects
description: "England Expects" is a rare, "vintage" Card Game with a British Royal Navy theme published by Pepys around 1940. It features beautifully illustrated cards depicting a variety of British military navy scenes, backed by a picture of Nelson's column.
categories: Card Game, Nautical, World War II

name: MINT 400 Off Road Game
description: During the first phase of the game, the players roll and move on the outer part of the board, getting their trucks, coupons, and spare parts. After using the coupons to pay the "entrance fee", they begin doing a pre-determined amount of laps on the inner part of the board. The more laps that were chosen, the more spare parts that will be needed to complete the laps. There are also "good news" and "bad news" squares on the outer and inner board, which act as random events. The player who completes all the laps, or makes the most number of laps, wins. The rules book also contains more info on off-road racing and contains driver profiles on Parnelli Jones, Team MacPherson (Jerry McDonald, Jeff MacPherson, adn Joe MacPherson), John Baker, Walker Evans, Ivan Stewart, and Kjell Eriksson.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Limbo
description:
Limbo - How Low Can You Go?

Components:
5 Limbo Blocks (wooden blocks (5cm x 5cm x 13cm)
1 Limbo Bar (wooden block (0.5cm x 5cm x 13cm) with Velcro pad
1 Limbo-low-nose (with Velcro pad)

The five limbo blocks are stacked on top of each other on the floor with the limbo bar on the top. Players take it in turns to wear the "Limbo-low-nose" and bend over an pick up the limbo bar with their nose. This must be achieved with only the feet in contact with the floor. Each player has three attempts - players who cannot do this, or touch the floor with any part of their body other than their feet are eliminated.

Once everyone has succeeded or been eliminated the bar is lowered by removing one of the limbo blocks so that the limbo bar is now resting on four blocks. Players now attempt at this height.

Play continues in this way, gradually reducing the height of the bar until either only one player is left or until at least two players have successfully picked up the bar from the floor. If this happens all five blocks are placed under the limbo bar again, and the exercise repeated, but this time players are only allowed to stand on one foot!

name: Le Balene
description: "The Whales" - Italian game issued for Greenpeace campaign against whales hunting. 108 double faced cards for a fun party game where players creates absurd but formally correct phrases to close their hand.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Spectrum
description:
One player is red/orange/yellow and the other is green/blue/violet. The winner of the game who places down more of his or her tokens onto the playing board than the opposing player. Each color which is placed on the playing board must always touch an adjoining color in the correct sequence of the spectrum (red may only touch orange, green may only touch yellow and blue, and so on).
The game starts with each player playing their six extreme tiles (red and violet) anywhere on the board, not touching each other. It is from this start the remaining tiles are played.
There is an alternate set of simpler rules for younger children.

name: Tangled Tales: Nancy Drew – Mummy's the Word Adventure Deck
description:
Step into the shoes of Nancy Drew, girl detective...

As a volunteer tour guide for the River Heights Cultural Museum, you've made sure everything is locked up safe and sound for the night. But being the meticulous Nancy Drew, you can't help but take another look around... and stumble right into a mystery!

When you discover a priceless gold statue from the new Egyptian Wing in a place it doesn't belong, all of your "girl detective" instincts kick in. Something is wrong! You begin investigating, but with a storm raging outside, the dark, closed museum becomes an eerie place to be. The ancient artifacts cast sinister shadows. There are strange, echoing sounds all around... and even stranger footprints!

Can you make your way through a creepy world of mummies and jackals to uncover the clues needed to solve the case... and catch a criminal?

Expands:

Tangled Tales Starter Set: The Gatekeeper Chronicles 1 – Nightmare Unleashed Adventure Deck
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based

name: Marco Polo
description:
From rules:
Marco Polo is a game based on business skill of the players.
Every player (from 2 to 6) identify himself in the noble Venetian facing all with risks of his incredible journey, and showing his own abilities of good merchant and manage before the others to end successfully the enterprise.
Aim of every player must reconstruct his puzzle of 16 pieces.

name: Cabbage Patch Kids Hide-And-Seek Game
description:
from the box:

It's fun to play the Cabbage Patch Match! Just draw the top card from the deck and place it face-up in front of you. Then, slide the lever on the game unit and watch the kids rise out of the cabbage patch. Quickly--you don't have much time--find the kid who matches the kid shown on the card, and you're on your way to a win! Keep matching kids to cards until the kids go back into hiding and it's someone else's turn. The game is over when no more kids remain in the cabbage patch. Sounds easy, but you'll have to be fast to win this game! A good memory helps, too--try to remember, if you can, who's hiding where!

name: Professor Noggin's Creatures of Myth & Legend
description: Gryphons, basilisks and phoenixes all existed before Harry Potter. Learn about these mythical creatures and explore the science, religious beliefs and cultures that created them.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Fantasy, Trivia
publishers: Éditions Gladius International, Inc., Outset Media

name: Ordfejden
description:
Ordfejden, Swedish for "the word feud", is a dice based crossword game by the Swedish snack-company OLW. Including timer, 15 dice, score sheets and rules it was given away as a freebie when buying two packs of OLW snacks.

Ordfejden is a word dice game.

name: Scramble! Wargames Rules for Aerial Combat 1935 - 1945
description:
A miniatures game which uses 1/300 scale aircraft to portray air combat from 1930 to 1945. 48 page rulebook.

"Take to the air in the dark days of the Battle of Britain or try to defend the Fatherland against the USAF. This game is for 1/300 scale aircraft and uses a simple movement system which takes account of the turning and climbing abilities of the aircraft. The advantages and disadvantages of different formations and aircraft types become apparent very quickly."

"This set of rules operates in three dimensions while only physically using two, height being indicated beside an aircraft. Weapon effectiveness is taken into account, and the skill of your aircrew is paramount. This is varied by nation and period to get the right feel for the game. The system also caters for game balance to ensure that no game is a walkover. There are simple rules for ammunition expenditure, Flak, Bombing, Night Actions, etc. Players can handle about 4 planes each."

"The rules are quite short, but are supplemented by introductory data with over 200 selected aircraft from the main theaters of World War Two. The theaters concerned are those NOT marked with an asterisk in the list below. These illustrate the differences caused by new designs and trying to stuff more into an old design. The Second Edition incorporates a number of rules revisions and some new rules to make life even more exciting for the unwary. A whole section of Optional Rules introduces new complexities into the game, as well as also offering some emerging technologies."

Publisher ratings: Complexity - 4/10; Level of detail - 7/10.

There is a separately sold data annex, adding more aircraft: "Angels 15".

Publisher's Home Page for the Game: http://www.aandagames.co.uk/scramble.htm

name: Sahara
description:
Object of this game is to deliver 2 loads to the 2 oases and return to the staring point first.

The loads are carried by nice camels or dromedaries and movement depends on the number of loads as well as on the wind, which is determined with a roll of a spinner. The spinner is also responsible for determining how the sand dunes are shifting and if there are some Fata Morganas on the horizon.
( Fata Morganas are caused by hot and cold air which distorts the appearance of objects on the horizon either at sea or in the desert to make them look like, well, castles in the air.)


Additionally, there are some fixed desert fields on the board, but the main problem is, that when encountering such obstacles you need the use of water canisters. Each player has only 6 canisters and losing all of them means a restart or sometimes an elimination of the game.

name: Fantasy Wargaming
description:
From the dust jacket:

"Welcome to the wonderful world of fantasy wargaming! Whether you're a beginner who wants to try the hobby, a seasoned campaigner looking for a realistic system, or an outsider who simply wants to know what fantasy gaming is all about, Martin Hackett has produced an indispensable reference guide.

He has devised a complete fantasy gaming system which makes use of a special scheme of tables to produce accurate, realistic yet surprising results and a fast, easy to learn game which gets away from the tedious and over-elaborate procedures used in other systems.

Know what a kobold is, or a ratatole? As well as a full list of spells specifically designed for mass battles, there is a quick-reference bestiary which sets out the properties of these and all the other creatures that may be encountered. An entire fantasy battle scenario has been created - in effect an imaginary world which sets the scene straight away for all sorts of adventures, as weird as your imagination can devise. Also described in a fantasy realm, the setting for astonishing campaigns that will take you on quests for gold and virtue an much more besides.

All this is supported by useful notes on how to enhance the game with models and sculptured scenery, plus a list of figure manufacturers and advice and guidance on getting the most from this absorbing hobby."

Hardcover, 232 pages
ISBN# 1-85260-213-9

name: Femettan
description:
The game is for 10 year olds and up.

The players try to explain words to their partners by using only words that starts with the letters on 4 dice throws.

name: Wanted: Dead or Alive
description:
From the publisher:

"A complete Wild West gun fighting game! Contains a simple 14 page rulebook, 4 good guys, 4 bad guys and a deck of playing cards; all you need to play the game."

name: Pirelli Rallye Monte Carlo
description:
The Pirelli Rallye Monte Carlo game represents a rally race with the board representing a Leg that consists of four road sections and three special stages. The object is to be the fastest over three legs or three runs over the entire track. In the 1980's the sport was a bit different. Road sections were over public streets and going too fast or too slow garnered a time penalty. The Special stages were over closed public roads, private roads or trails in rural areas and speed was not restricted. In the game, the Road sections have a set number of dice throws in which a player is to travel the section with his car. You may roll one or two D6 that have numbers 1,2 or 3 on the faces. Finishing in less rolls garners a 10 second penalty and finishing in too many rolls gets a 5 second penalty. For each special stage, a card is drawn with details of that stage and players must try and choose the best tyres for that stage, with weather conditions being a contributing factor. Then an Unexpected Weather condition card is drawn. The tire choice combined with info from the two cards modify the die rolls during the Special stage. The player then chooses to roll the red die that has more pips and two crash faces or the blue die with less pips and only one crash face. Along the Special stages are spaces that result in car damage if a player lands on those spaces. Prior to starting the race each player may place Repair Stations along the Road sections to repair damages incurred along the Specials stages. If a player lands on a Damage space in the first Special stage, that Damage penalty, 10 seconds, will be applied thereafter to each section until the player meets the requirement for entering one of his Repair Stations. The player who completes the three Legs in the fastest time wins the rally/game.

Basically a roll and move game with a bit of flare within the theme of the sport as it was conducted at the time of the game's production.

This being a game for the Pirelli tire company, there is more information concerning tires in the game materials than is necessary to play the game. The only tyres available are from Pirelli and the game materials seek to show how each tyre should be used, with the rulebook containing a lot of information about how rallies were organized and run at that time and how to choose tyres for each stage.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Busting the Bocage
description:
Busting the Bocage: Hedgerow Fighting with the 2nd Ranger Battalion.

This scenario pack depicts fighting involving the US 2nd Ranger Battalion on and shortly after D-Day, from June 6th to June 8th 1944.

Contents:
Cover sheet
1 page of rules
6 scenarios
22"x36" map

The updated version of this module is included in Critical Hit magazine #7.3.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Dynamite
description:
Dynamite is a fun game for those seeking an hour of joy, tension and fun.
At the beginning of the game a "Time Bomb" is set to explode in 30 seconds. each player must put a card from his hand thus reducing the time left by number on the cards.
Special cards allow to delay the explosion by adding 5 minutes or forcing the next player to put 2 cards!
As the countdown approaches zero the tension is rising.

name: Wargamer's Handbook
description: The Wargamer's Handbook was intended as a set of introductory miniatures (20mm to 25mm) rules for those just starting wargaming. It employed a standardized system that could be used (with minor variations) across different periods of history. The latter included ancient warfare, medieval/renaissance, the American Revolution, Napoleonics, the American Civil War, and World War Two.
categories: American Civil War, American Revolutionary War, Ancient, Civil War, Medieval, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame, World War II

name: Red Christmas: Moscow Counteroffensive
description:
Red Christmas-the CSIR and the Moscow Counteroffensive, December 22-30, 1941, brings the ASL enthusiast directly into the path of a combined-arms Red Army assault. Mixed German and Italian forces try and stave off disaster on the Eastern Front in a series of pitched battles depicted in the module's scenarios.

Historical battlefield maps are what CH is all about and Red Christmas continues that tradition with two new historical maps depicting the villages of Orlovo Ivanovka and Novo Orlovka, situated directly in the path of Stalin's Moscow counteroffensive.

This is not a complete game! Ownership of Beyond Valor is required to use this product. Ownership of Hollow Legions is NOT required. Variant 'Berlin Style' MMC, SMC, SW, and needed Guns are provided for Italian combatants.

Contents: 6 scenarios, 2 historical maps, variant special rules, and die cut color counters.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader
Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Fujisan
description:
Four Shinto priests have traveled from their various prefectures in pilgrimage to the top of Mount Fuji. You must find pathways for them to move up and down the mountain until they can all achieve the summit. Often, this will require you to guide them into positions from which they can assist each other.

Rules can be found on Piecepack Wiki

Game System

Piecepack Game System

name: TAZmania
description:
Looney Tunes TAZmania game!

Players place strips of plastic, called bars, in their own side of a cage holding none other than the Tazmanian Devil in the form of a ball with his face on it. But this ball moves, and if players take enough of your bars away during play, Taz will bust through your side of the cage making you...not the winner.

Cage guards are Tweety, Sylvester, Daffy and Bugs. The cage needs adult assembly.

So you set up your cage bars as strategically as possible, crossing them if you think that may help. Then on your turn, concentrate on pulling the bars out of your opponents' sides of the cage, causing Taz to escape from any side but your own.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Comic Book / Strip, Dice

name: Tsaritsyne 1919: La Chute du Verdun Rouge
description:
Subject : This game covers the fourth battle for Tsaritsyn, from June, 12th to July, 1st 1919. Wrangel's cavalry Army of the Caucasus attacks the fortified area of the Red Verdun. With infantry and tanks reinforcements, coupled with sudden appearance of Mamontov's cavalry corps manoeuvring on the rears, the Whites manage to take the city at the end of June.
The Reds benefit from special advantages such as Budyenny's cavalry corps, river flotillas and trenches.

Scale : regiments or brigades. 1 hex = 4 km. 1 turn = 1 day

English or French versions available. 20 pages booklet (rules and historical article), a player aid and 306 full-colour counters. The map is 42*60 cm (about 16*24 inches).
The counters have to be cut and mounted (high quality Desk Top Game).

booklet contents :
- Rules : 9 pages
- Examples : 1p
- three scenarios : 3p
- historical notes : 3p (and maps)
- author's notes and play notes : 1p

Scenarios :
- introductory scenario
- scenario in 4 turns : the last days of the battle
- the full battle

name: Stalingrad:  The Leather Factory
description:
Stalingrad: The Leather Factory, 2nd ed. is a solitaire strategy game depicting the battle of Kuporosnoye, September 13-15, 1942 between the German 29th Division and the Russian 35th Guards Division at the beginning of the epic battle for the city. This area was at the southern edge of greater Stalingrad, with a large leather factory along its north side. In the game, the player (Germans) tries to capture objective hexes and headquarter locations from the Russians (played by the game system).

The game uses a solitaire system that reflects the historical situation but includes enough variability and uncertainty to enhance the fog of war feeling to foster replayability. The standard game is suitable for novice wargamers. There are advanced optional rules presented that contain rules that may be “plugged in” as desired to the standard game, to provide a more detailed and challenging game for veteran players. Designed by Gary Graber.

Tactical, company-level, 300 yard hexes, 100 counters, 8.5"x11" color map, 16-page instructions, designed specifically for solitaire play, stresses high playability and historicity. The game puts you in command of elements of the German 29th Division, pushing towards the Volga.

This second edition offers newly revised rules, optional rules, and components.


1st edition description

This is a solitaire design based on the early September, 1942 German assault on Kuporosnoye at the far south of Stalingrad. The player controls the German 29th Division, and the game system handles the Russian 35th Guards Division defenders. The game includes 8.5" x 11" cardstock map, set of uncut, color unit counters, and full rules. This game is presented as a simple "standard game" suitable for novices, to which several advanced options can be added. The game stresses "uncertainty" for the solitaire wargamer, which is provided by hidden Russian units, random reinforcements, variable "daily orders" from HQ, and imprecise victory conditions. Published in Panzer Digest #3.

name: Course Cavalière
description:
In this card and dice-free horse racing game, players place bets on the horses in the race based on their position in the final standings. On a player's turn, the player chooses actions by placing cubes in the move zone or in the exploit zone. Players seek to make the horses finish in the position secretly chosen. The race is in 12 segments.

Awards

2008 - Les Journées Ludiques de Québec - Public Prize

name: Universal Fighting System
description:
When it comes to card games, you know you're the best. Now prove it with fist-pounding bone-breaking attacks and perfectly timed blocks of the KING OF FIGHTERS 2006 and the SAMURAI SHOWDOWN Collectible Card Games.

As part of the Universal Fighting System (UFS), the action flows quickly between players as punches and kicks are thrown and grapples and throws are executed with deadly precision. You are one of the characters from KING OF FIGHTERS 2006 or from SAMURAI SHOWDOWN and you will become the champion!

The 60 card starter deck contains everything one player needs to start fighting in the UFS arena, including a rule sheet. It contains 3 exclusive cards, not available anywhere else.

Each booster contains 10 The King of Fighters 2006 and/or Samurai Showdown V CCG cards which are 100% compatible with the entire library of UFS collectible card games. Players need at least 1 UFS starter deck to used the cards within.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: El Dorado: Game of the world's hidden Treasures
description:
Game hails from the heydays of Parker Brothers Company regarding their game components quality and design. On the other side this is a nightmare for game collectors, as the box measures 20×14×2 inches. Add a gameboard twice its size, other game components and both box halves made of ultra-thick cardboard, a book containing all the game's treasures of the world and their descriptions and last but not least metal game pieces, and you have a game weight of over 3 kg.

Gameplay is simple but fun for the whole family. Out of nearly 100 cards you get a random set of 5. They show the treasures you have to find and to dig out. You travel one of the numerous routes on the board depicting a world map to reach your destination as fast as possible. In order to do this there is a clever system how to use your dice roll. When you reach your destination you take 2 special dice, pay the digging fee and try your luck.

To enhance your treasure income, you can choose whenever you want to unearth one of the nearly 50 additional pirate treasures. But destination is hidden, and if luck is not on your side, you have to travel round the globe to reach it, and you are not allowed to skip it!

Game ends when the first player reaches home port after his last treasure of the initial 5 has been lifted, but winner is the one with the most income.

Highlight of the game are the pawns: Tiny little petroleum lanterns made of metal in 6 different colours.

Parts Inventory:

2 d6 of various sizes/types of the day
2 special red lucite dice with zeros on four sides
6 lantern movers large or small
64 or 65 black cards
30 red cards
20 $500 chips
30 $1,000 chips
30 $5,000 chips
30 $10,000 chips
10 $50,000 chips
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Age of Battles: Crusaders
description:
Zvezda – 8204 – The Crusaders

This box contained 2 full plastic soldiers inside, Zvezda – 8002 – Christian Knights and Zvezda – 8009 – Saracens , both Italeri re-releases by Zvezda, for a total of 58 plastic soldiers (It also contained an exclusive Priest/Pope figure).

Part of the Age of Battles: Napeonic Wars – Rulebook (3rd Edition) table-top gaming system using 1/72 scale miniatures, the Crusaders box set covers the battles of Dorylaeum (1097) and Arsuf (1191).

Box contents include:
2 Sets of miniatures
- 12 foot and 11 mounted Saracen Warriors (8009)
- 25 foot and 9 mounted Christian Knights (8002)
1 Exclusive priest miniature
8 Regiment stands
8 Regiment cards
16 Flag stickers
1 Pen
2 Rulers
1 Angle pattern
1 Age of Battles rule book
1 Crusaders game booklet
1 D20 die

Note that the miniature sets included are actually Italeri miniatures.

From the back of the box:
The military-historical game "The Crusaders" reflects the events that took place in the end of the XI th-XII th centuries when numerous crusader armies moved to the East to free the sacred city of Jerusalem from the Saracens.

This game is for 2-6 players. The enemy armies led by the players meet in a desert in Asia Minor. Tactic maneuvering are very important in the gane. Under a skillful leader a smaller army can defeat numerous enemies. You can either recreate the historic battle or change the course of the fight. Anyway you should rely on not only the number of your army but also on your leadership and war skills.

Zvezda 8204

name: Klaus die Maus entdeckt die Welt
description: Klaus the mouse traveled around the world and took a lot of pictures of many different things. But a strong wind mixed up all his pictures. The aim of the game is to help Klaus to spatialize the things to the continents where they originally come from. Therefore the players place their figure on a map of the world. If it is placed on the right continent, they get a chip. The first one who gets the 10th chip wins the game.

name: Blood & Steel: Expansion
description:
From the publisher's website:

The Blood & Steel Expansion Pack is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and is an extension of the highly successful Blood & Steel folio game on the battle of Kursk.

The Expansion Pack involves the two other pivotal battles around the Kursk salient: Oboyan Hills and Rzhavets bridgehead using the Blood & Steel game system.

Expands:

Blood & Steel
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: A Call to Arms: Dilgar Imperium
description: A 24 page softcover expansion to A Call to Arms: Babylon 5 Space Combat this book adds the Dilgar to the game. The book contains a brief history of the Dilgar focusing on the Dilgar War as well as providing the game details for the fleet and special rules used by the Dilgar. Note there are no scenarios in this book.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Der Maulwurf sucht seine Freunde
description: Ravensburger children's game with a memory and matching element. The game uses colorful tokens showing penguins, butterflies, , frogs, mice, and porcupines and players must find the right matches by picking them up using special plastic cups.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Wild World Lotto
description:
Match animals from around the world
Learn about wildlife from around the world. Match animals from jungle, ocean, desert and polar environments with their habitats in this beautifully illustrated lotto game.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Memory

name: Lordz of the Hood
description: Players compete to take over one of the four 'hoods' of Buffalo, NY. Move around the board, purchasing properties you land on, paying rent if they are owned. Properties can be improved by adding illegal activities. If you don't want to pay rent, torch the place!

name: Pocket Knight Chess
description:
The board is set-up as for a normal game of chess. The moves and sequence of play are not changed.

Before the start of play, however, each player takes an extra knight which is placed "in a pocket". Once during the game, the player may put this extra knight on any free square on the board. The knight may be placed to give check or checkmate. The only restriction is that the space must be empty. Placing the pocket knight is instead of making a normal move. After this, the additional knight moves as usual.

NB: It is recommended that the knight be put in a pocket, or at some distance from the board, so that it is not confused with pieces which have been captured during the game.

Pocket Knight Chess can also be played with no additional pieces, just two knights per player. In this version, each player removes a knight from the opening set-up prior to starting play. This knight becomes the "pocket knight". The "same" knights should be taken by each player (i.e. both remove their Queen's Knight).

name: Dungeon Sprint
description: A one page print-and-play high speed dungeon crawl. Traps, monsters, loot collection, character classes, undermining the other players, all there in fifteen minutes and one page.

name: Chwech
description:
This game uses a standard deck of cards with two jokers. It is designed specifically for 6 players, although variants allow other number of players as well.
Each player is dealt 9 cards, then tricks are played. During a trick a player may pass or play, in that case he has to follow suit or play a joker. The game ends when everyone passes in a turn.
Then the score of a player is the number of cards he has played, multiplied by nine if he won a multiple of nine cards (0, 9, 18, etc), otherwise the number he won in excess of such a multiple. Hence the goal is to win a multiple of nine cards while playing all the cards.

name: Hamlet
description: This game is played with a standard deck of cards stripped down to AKQJT987 plus one Joker. Eleven tricks are played, hence one player will win either the middling number of tricks, or, if two win the same number, a unique number of tricks. That player is designated Hamlet. A new trump suit and a scoring multiplier (whether it is more desirable "to be or not to be" Hamlet) are decided at the start of each round.

name: Sudoku: Tactics
description:
In Sudoku: Tactics, players take turns drawing 1-5 number tiles and place them in any order to complete rows, columns and 3x3 sub-grids following the rules of Sudoku. Each completion scores one point, and the tiles in the completed areas are removed and returned to the tile pile. If a player is unable to legally place a number, a "Sudoku Jam" occurs; all tiles with that number are returned to the pile and the previous player scores a point. Since the board is never entirely filled up, the game is played to an arbitrary number of points or time limit agreed to in advance.

Similar to other Blue Panther products, the box, nine-piece board, scoreboard and 81 tiles are all laser-etched wood. The board pieces fit together like a jigsaw puzzle. The game also comes with a printed paper instruction sheet and five pairs of plastic cubes to mark player scores.

name: War Unleashed: Volume 1
description:
From the official WarriorElite newsletter (summarized):

War Unleashed - the companion to War for Edath.

Battlefield rules - now you can battle over large battlefields for the full tabletop, battlegame experience where strategy in deployment and movement is key - many Terrain Maps (battlefields) will be available free to download online & others will be included in future expansion packs.

The Art of War - campaign rules where you'll compete over a region of Edath. Includes gaining experience and 'leveling up' troops, champions & leaders.

The Art of the Master - expanded rules for Combat & Battle Masters that unleash their true potential. Includes skills and is the basis for having characters in your games.

Background on the World of Edath is also contained within War Unleashed. A map, history, world details, Edath's species, the warring factions, countries of Edath, the Dzaa Empire & the Supernatural - including magic - are all covered.

War Unleashed comes in paperback, A5 format - 144 fully illustrated pages and an 8 page, full-colour section of artwork.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Chess³
description:
"An environmental sculpture in chrome steel and crystal clear polished playing boards which moves chess into an intriguing new dimension." (side of box Description)

This game is a relatively straightforward 3-Dimensional extrapolation of the standard chess concept, and as such the goal and theme are much the same, with one player each starting one the top and bottom boards.

Some of the moves for various pieces have been changed, with all pieces moving as per usual on one plane, but the movements from plane to plane of the Queen, Bishop, and Pawn are not as one would initially expect. Most other 3D moves are restricted to moving one square only directly above or below the initial position of the piece.

Board and set could also be used for several other Components: Three Dimensional Chess, as there are no original pieces.

name: Star Conquest
description:
Star Conquest is a game of resource management that emphasizes three aspects: the extraction of minerals (mining) and its management, policy/diplomacy (Consuls), and militarization (Fleet of Ships). Players compete each other, economically, politically and militarily, in a grid game that represents the Alpha Centauri System.

Players build their own ships, increasingly powerful using combinations of different minerals (Neutronium, Duranium, Molybdenum and Tritanium) that are obtained in the different sectors System.

Each player starts the game on their home planet with a fleet Ships and mineral reserves. To prosper you must know properly optimize their ships, their consuls and Minerals Colonies obtained. For your empire grows you will need spread out (space exploration), for it must build more and better ships to control neighboring sectors in the system. Of course, the other players try to do the same, so you must provide at all times attention to their movements.

Awards:
This game is one of the 13 finalists of the 2010 Concurs Ciutat de Granollers de creació de jocs.
Accésit (2nd place) I Concurso de diseño y creación de juegos mesa "Ojo al Dado" (2013)

License:
The game is released under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike licence.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Economic, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Monopoly: The Rolling Stones Collector's Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The world’s longest running rock-n-roll band teams up with the world’s most popular board game to bring you the ultimate Rolling Stones experience. The Rolling Stones Collector’s Edition of MONOPOLY celebrates some of the greatest rock-n-roll music of the 20th century and beyond. This completely customized game features the band’s albums including Sticky Fingers, Exile On Main Street, Voodoo Lounge and more, allowing fans to build their own Rolling Stones music collection. Game includes six collectible tokens: Dice (Tumbling Dice), Horses (Wild Horses), Tour Bus, Road Case, Drum Set and the Licks Logo.

Hang Fire!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Keks
description:
"Keks" is the German word for "cookie, cracker"; actually it's derived from "cakes", yet "Keks" is singular.

Keks is a tile removal game for 2 players. It's designed for nestorgames' game system Nestortiles.

To play this little game arrange all 60 tiles in a square of 8x8 leaving out the corners (this is the "keks").

If it's your turn, break off any same-color tiles that have at least 2 open edges. But never break the whole keks into pieces! Each tile is worth one point, except the very first tile of a certain color, which counts zero points. As soon as you collect 3 same-color tiles (of value), you won that color, except for the very first color, which is won in the game. This color counts - again - zero points.

You win the game by winning the fifth color.

Happy keksing!

name: BattleTech: Record Sheets – 3085
description:
Publisher Blurb:

MORE ’MECHS FOR THE BATTLEFIELD...

You’ve grasped the tactics involved with the additional units and weapons from Total Warfare to defeat your opponents. Now you own Technical Readout: 3085 and want to deploy some of those ’Mechs, vehicles, conventional infantry and Land-Air BattleMechs on your gaming table. Grab your dice and start rolling, because these sheets are for you!

Record Sheets: 3085 contains more than 65 pre-printed ’Mech record sheets that will have players firing autocannons, missiles and PPCs at each other in no time. More than twenty vehicle and conventional infantry sheets bring the excitement of combined-arms game play to any table top. Two ready-to-play scenarios focus on the highlights of this volume, while an extensive Rules Addendum section provides a sneak peak of all the advanced rules options provided in Tactical Operations. Finally, Land-Air BattleMech Quick-Start Rules allow players to instantly field these unique, Star League-era units.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleTech: Jihad Hot Spots – Terra
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tearing Down the Walls!

For more than ten years, the Word of Blake’s Jihad has engulfed the states of the Inner Sphere and the invading Clans in chaos and fire. Reeling from attacks on all fronts, realms have fought one another while the Word’s masters built a powerful Protectorate around humanity’s home: Terra. But with the rise of a resourceful rebel leader, Devlin Stone, the collective might of the Great Houses and rival Clans have united for an all-out assault against the Protectorate - one that can only end when humanity’s home is free once again!

Jihad Hot Spots: Terra continues the Jihad plot book series started with Blake Ascending, bringing readers into the latter years of the war between the Word of Blake and the Inner Sphere. Seen from the eyes of those who fight and die in this epic struggle, this book includes articles and intelligence excerpts from across the Inner Sphere, along with additional rules and campaign tracks for both BattleTech campaigns played using the Total Warfare and A Time of War game rules. This book also provides a rare, in-depth look at the Terran system itself, including the history and varied cultures who live on these most revered worlds. Also included are rules and units for the elaborate defense network the Word of Blake unveiled against Stone and his allied Coalition throughout the Protectorate campaign.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost Legacy
description:
A fantasy themed customizable card game using a fixed distribution method. In Lost Legacy you build a custom deck of 50 cards from a selection of character, item, counter, equipment, environment, weapon, and spell cards to challenge your opponent(s) on a modular game board. The game incorporates elements from both CCGs and miniatures games (character cards are actually moved around the game board). The object of the game is to acquire the most honor, honor can be acquired by destroying an opponents character during an attack, your opponent running out of cards in their deck, and having a character at certain locations on the game board.

Blurb from publisher's website:

Lost Legacy is a card game made by a small family owned company called Dreamastermind, Inc. located in Illinois. It is a very strategic game designed to challenge players, but not their wallets. In most card games, players must purchase multiple booster packs to acquire a couple random cards. In Lost Legacy, players need only purchase one Expansion Set to acquire every card from that set! This allows anyone to easily pick up on the game and build any deck they want without breaking the bank.

name: Owlman
description:
An asymmetric strategy game based on Britain’s answer to the West Virginia Mothman sightings. The game can be played using pieces from a chess and checkers set. Owlman is an abstract strategy game with unequal forces, based on a loose theme of cryptozoological investigation.

The Owlman side has just one piece (a black knight) which starts in the upper left corner. Doc's side has Doc (a white king starting in the lower right corner) and 12 helpers (checkers starting near Doc).

Owlman's main objective is to frighten all of Doc's helpers out of the woods. Doc aims to reach the Owlman's lair (the upper left corner), along with one of his helpers (adjacent to the corner), who will help him set up his "cryptozoological" camera.

The game is played in alternating turns, moving pieces on the 8x8 board. All pieces can step to an adjacent space. Only Owlman can capture, by stepping toward a helper, who is then frightened out of the woods. Owlman also has a special "swoop" move (like an elongated knight's move, but 4x2 instead of 3x2).
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: From Mud to Glory: American Football
description:
Statistical replay game on American Football, using a simple approach that consents to replay an entire season in a few hours.
Each team is rated for TDs made and allowed (a different value for Run TD and Pass TD), plus FG attempts, FG %, P/K return TD made and allowed and TD scored by defence.
In each match, both teams values are compared with a few tables and several dice rolls are made to determine the final score.
As in most of TCS sport games, a random modifier is added under the form of the so called third die, a dice modifiers that adds spice and variations to the game

There are several different sets, each dedicated to a different NFL decade, or AFL

name: Colour Bazaar
description:
Isles of Purple and Red, renown for their fine fabric and vivid dyes, are far across the sea. When the island trading houses send cargo ships to the Sapphire Ports, they can only guess what the demand will be for different styles once the cargo finally arrives. So the houses send agents ahead in faster boats, on missions to promote the products the the house anticipates sending. At the same time, they try to guess what will be in demand.

Each of the six Decktet suits represents a different colour or style of fabric. Players use cards to influence the value of each style and collect chips representing investment in particular styles. The goal is to have invested more in the styles that are ultimately the most popular.

There are four separate fashion markets, represented by the four Pawn cards.

On your turn, you play a card to one of the four markets. The only restriction is that your card must share a suit with the previous card played to that market. The card play changes the value of that suit. After playing a card, you select one of the remaining chips and take it; each chip represents a share of that suit.

name: 1835: Schlesien
description: This little 18xx add-on expands the 1835 board to the north-east. It also introduces another Minor Company, the Ober-Schlesische Bahn (4a) which replaces the Koln-Mindener Bahn (4) and works like any other pre-Prussian railroad. The expansion also included 1 overlay tile for Berlin, 2 more 2-trains, a company charter and a token for the new railroad.

name: Battaglia di Lepanto 1571
description:
Battaglia di Lepanto 1571 is a Tactical level wargame for 2 players that simulates the Battle of Lepanto between Christian and Ottoman fleets.
The game includes a hex map depicting the sea and part of the coast, on which the players will setup their fleets of war galleys. Each war galley is represented by a hexagonal counter with all important data on it, and with two sides (normal and damaged).

Taking turns, the players will give orders (move, board, fire or ram - this last one only available to Ottoman galleys) to their fleet and move their ships in order to win the battle. Orders are issued using Order cards, while the combat is resolved with 6-sided dice. Boardings are resolved by playing Tactical cards, attempting to outmaneuvre the opponent. When a player cannot play a Tactical card that "parries" his opponent card the boarding is resolved with a roll of dice.

The game lasts 7 turns under the basic rules, and ends when a flagship is captured or destroyed. The game comes with advanced rules for capturing ships, playing the game in 14 turns, adjusting cannon fire, and using different victory conditions. The full colour manual comes with a historical background and original illustrations.

While self-published the quality of the components is quite good. Contents list as follows:


1 Order Cards deck (movement and combat)
1 Tactical Cards deck (for boardings)
10 6-sided dice
32 hexagonal, double-faced ship counters
1 board
60 markers (wrecks, orders given, captured ship)
1 32-pages full colour rulebook


Note: the game is only in Italian.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Railway Rivals Map SP: Spain
description: This is an expansion map for Railway Rivals and Dampfross which involves players first building track and then players may race between cities. The base game involves route building like in crayon rails and the second part of the games involves racing along player routes between cities to win prize money. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins.

name: Crash Tower
description: Players build the tower. The object of the game is to be the only player who doesn't make the tower tumble down.

name: Congo
description:
Congo is a game created by the Frenchman Charles Watilliaux between 1874 and 1907. This game would have fallen into oblivion were it not for another Frenchman named Michel Boutin after a public inquiry into this game in his book: "Jeux de pions pour aujourd 'hui" in 2001 and reintroduced by Oriol Comas in his book "The World Games "
Congo is a very simple abstract strategy game with a board and a easy game mechanics.
This game tries to emulate a site on the banks of the river Congo.
4 people play and have 12 pieces each and take turns placing them anywhere on a 5x5x5 hexagonal board. The only requirement for placement is that it is not adjacent to a piece of another color, although you can play adjacent to your own color. After placing a piece, it can not be moved in any way. When a player is blocked and can not place any more pieces, they are out. The game continues until no more pieces can be played by ANY player.
When a game is complete, points are then awarded. Each player gets one point for each piece not played by a player who went out before them. Thus, 3rd place gets the points for all pieces left by 4th place, while 2nd place gets points for both 3rd and 4th place's pieces. The winner gains points from all 3 who fell by the wayside.
(Adjustment: If you allow ties in how many pieces are left over instead of "first unable not play is first out", then both people who tie gain the points of the other person they tied with.)
The best thing is to play four games, so that each player has the chance to play first.
The winner is the one with the highest cumulative score after four games.
When only two people play, it requires each player to use two colors, and each player must take into account that the two colors belonging to a player can not touch each other.


El Congo es un juego creado por el frances Charles Watilliaux entre 1874 y 1907, este juego hubiese caido en el olvido a no ser por otro frances llamado Michel Boutin que luego de una investigacion publico este juego en su libro: "Jeux de pions pour aujourd´hui" en 2001 y retomado por Oriol Comas en su libro "El Mundo en juegos"
El Congo es un juego de estrategia abstracta muy simple pero con un tablero y una mecanica muy bella. Este juego trata de emular un sitio en la orilla del rio Congo.
Jugando de a 4 personas cada jugador posee 12 fichas y las van poniendo una a una en el tablero hexagonal. La unica condicion para la colocacion es que no este adyacente a una ficha de otro color, aunque si puede estar tocando las fichas de su mismo color. Una vez colocada una ficha no se puede mover mas y no hay capturas de ningun tipo.
Cuando un jugador esta bloqueado y no puede colocar mas fichas deja de jugar, cuando el tres jugadores ya no tienen colocaciones de piezas posibles se termina la partida. En ese momento se otorgan los puntos. El primer jugador que quedo bloqueado le otorga tantos puntos como el numero de fichas que no logro colocar en el tablero a los otros 3 jugadores que continuaron jugando; el segundo bloqueado hace lo mismo con los otros dos jugadores que quedaron en carrera y por ultimo el tercer bloqueado entrega puntos al ganador del partido, es decir que el ganador recibe puntos de los otros tres jugadores que han quedado por el camino.
Lo mejor es jugar cuatro partidas, para que cada jugador tenga la posibilidad de jugar primero.
Y ganara el que tenga el mayor puntaje total de las cuatro partidas.
Para jugar de a dos personas solo se requiere que cada jugador utilice dos colores y hay que tener en cuenta por mas que los dos colores pertenezcan a un jugador igualmente no pueden tocarse entre si.

name: SyGo
description:
SyGo or Symple Go is a multi-move abstract strategy game for two players. There is a parallel to Go, because players try to control area with living groups. The goal of the game is to have more stones + enclosed areas on the board than the opponent at the end of the game.

The game follows the protocol of Symple. All placement and balancing rules of Symple apply. However, as opposed to Symple, capture is possible. A group is captured, if it has no liberties anymore. Captured stones are flipped as in Othello, meaning they change color. It is noteworthy that this kind of capture does not create liberties for the capturing group.

SyGo is usually played on a 19x19 square board.

Online Play


http://mindsports.nl/ - (turn-based)

name: Sphex
description:
Sphex is a connection game that can be played with a Series: Shibumi set, as it uses a 4x4 holes board and balls in two colours (white and black).

Rules: The board starts empty. The opening player places one ball of their colour, then players take turns placing two balls of their colour on legal positions (holes or platforms). The mover can additionally place a neutral ball on their turn, in any order.

Aim: A player wins by connecting any two opposite sides of the board level with a chain of their balls. Balls connect if they touch, i.e. orthogonally adjacent or resting upon each other.

name: StockCar Jr. Racing
description:
User Summary

StockCar Jr. is an auto-racing game. The object is to be the first player to complete 15 laps.

Players qualify for racing order with a dice roll. Car movement is controlled by rolling the dice as players seek to vie for positioning in "The Groove," an area of the track which allows for the fastest possible movement. But this is more than just a roll-and-move game...

Players can choose a car setup that's either Tight or Loose. A Tight setup is more conservative and safe, while a Loose set up gives more reward at the cost of greater risk. Players can also switch between high and low gear. Special rules cover cornering, getting "out of groove" and "out of shape," and accidents/collisions.

Another interesting feature of the game is the ability to collect Power Points. Cars can gain these when they are caught in traffic or have no legal moves. They can be used later to help with tricky maneuvers.

All cars pit after their 4th and 9th laps. Each car gets a Pit Card which indicates how long the pit stop is how many spaces of movement it gains while exiting.

The game comes in rather large "pizza box" style container with a checkerboard patterned cover.

Components include:
- A large gameboard with a track three spaces wide for the cars to travel on,
- 2 sets of instructions,
- 6 sets of control tables which represent high and low gear for the Loose and Tight car setups,
- 6 sets of gauges to track Power Point usage,
- A color-coordinated pair of dice and wooden playing pieces for each of the six race teams (aka players), &
- A set of 20 Pit Cards
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Masterquiz II
description: An expansion to the game Masterquiz from 1985. This expansion contains 3000 new questions and a deck of special cards which the players can use strategically during the course of the game. The players get 7 special cards each from start. The game is played in the same manor as Masterqiz, but the special cards gives the opportunity to duel against other players, take a 2nd guess, choose category etc.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Iron Reign
description:
In Iron Reign, you play the role of a king competing to expand your kingdom while battling to keep opponent's kingdoms in chaos. Glory is obtained by raining down Iron munitions on your enemies' castle walls. This turn based strategy game allows players to experience new adventures and tactics in every campaign.

Iron Reign is played in a series of phases that make up each round. Kings must first manage their kingdom's Gold. Purchase an army of troops, a fleet of ships, an arsenal of cannons, kingdom specialists, and most importantly new castle walls to expand your kingdom. Move your troops and fleet into battle. Take aim and let the Iron fly; this is a key part to setting back and crippling your enemies expansion. Hopefully you purchased enough new wall segments to repair your castle and expand into new areas on the map. If you can't repair at least one of your castles your reign has ended and your enemy has claimed victory. After a tough round of battle deploy new units on the board and prepare for the next round of battle to begin.

Some struggles will end in a kingdom falling to an enemy while others will result in one king expanding the kingdom and taking over so much territory that victory is claimed. So many strategy combinations can be put together for victory. Eight unique kingdom specialists (occupations) can be hired to change your kingdom's strategy. These range from markets that yield extra gold to workshops that convert troops into massive land roving siege weapons. What will be your strategy, quick expansion or maybe an arsenal of cannons?
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Advanced Wizard's Quest
description:
Wizard's Quest is a fantasy-themed area control wargame in the 1970's. It's simple & fun to play with up to 6 players. After the rise of modern euro games, I found the game has lots of potentials to be upgraded to the next level. Since the game is out of print for a long time, I decided to redesign this game in 2011. The project is named Advanced Wizard's Quest.

AWQ is not an expansion but an all-new game or sequel to the old game. There are new rules, tokens & cards. The only thing reused in base game is the map. However, you don't need the old WQ to play this game. All the game components are available for download in the file section below. New races, monsters, unit types, treaures & events are added with a new alliance & treasure hunt system. However, I retained the unique random native spawning & monster attacks system in the original game which is the spirit of Wizard's Quest.

Here is the game setting:

"Three centuries has past since the Orcs were banished from Marnon. The old kingdom from Eric's line was splited into three clans. Each clan claimed their lords being the rightful heir to the throne.

Meanwhile, there are reports that natives of the island are coming back...but not just the Orcs this time. There are the Elves, the Dwarves & the Lizardmen. They all came back to reclaim their homeland since ancient times. However, the greatest threat is not from the natives. There are rumors that a dark force emerged from the ruins of the abandoned castles.

Added to the chaos is the return of two great monsters, the Dragon & the Hydra. Various monsters are also reported everywhere. People begin to believe that the protector of the island, the great wizard, Peacemaker, was dead. Yet there is a legend saying the great wizard may come back one day, but in a very different form....

The constant expansion of the frenzy natives finally pushed the humans back to the coasts. Seeing this as a chance, some warlords declared their independence from the old kingdom. New flags are flying over the castle in the north. This marked the end of the old kingdom & the beginning of a new era - the Age of Heroes."
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Yelnya: Crushing the Salient
description:
Zhukov's first counterattack on the Eastern Front
As August turns into September of 1941 and the Nazi hordes push ever deeper into the heartland of Mother Russia, General Zhukov’s Reserve Army has been given an opportunity to counterattack.
While it may not yet be time to drive the hated facists out of the beloved Rodina, pushing them back, away from Moscow, with their tails between their legs is always worthwhile ! Besides with the Nazi panzers out of the way, what better time to trial the new assault theories while conducting an encirclement of your own ?
Yelnya is designed to be an easy to learn and fast playing game for two players while still being a challenging puzzle for both sides if played solitaire

During each turn the Russians have an opportunity to bombard the germans before both sides move and attack. at the end of the turn both sides may receive reinforcements and a check is made to see if the german high command authorises a withdrawal.

Once the withdrawal order is given (usually about half way through the game), focus of play shifts from positional warfare to the germans escaping with as many units as possible

name: CodeX
description:
CodeX is a card game where you try to be the first player to complete your personal code. Every players' code consist of five colorcoded numbers. You must play your hand cards in to the table in right order to win.

At the start of the game, every player gets one of the ten code cards determine players personal goal. Then turns go clockwise until someone wins. On your turn you may play from zero to three cards in to your code and then you must discard two cards. Start of the next turn you fill up your hand to five cards. The game deck consist of three type of cards. 50 number cards which range from 1 to 5 in 5 colors. 15 wild cards in 5 colors. Wild cards are used to change color of your number cards. Then there is 5 lock cards to make some special moves.

name: Wirbelwörter
description:
Fast-paced letter-dice game.
Each turn the category-card is drawn and the dice are rolled.
Who forms first the word in this category containing the rolled letters gets the card as a point.

The player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Real-time, Word Game

name: Clashing Blades!
description:
Clashing Blades! is a two-player card game representing a fencing match, played with a standard 52-card deck. The heart cards are used to represent damage and the ace-10 of the other suits are used to play. In each round, players start by simultaneously choosing cards, with play passing to the player threatened with damage after that. Spades are used for attack, diamonds for defense, and clubs for parries and ripostes.

Advanced rules add uses for the extra heart cards (extra-powerful attacks) and face and joker cards (events).

The game was originally released as a printed set of rules in a "shareware" version. A second edition with custom cards is forthcoming from Popcorn Press.

name: Tonooo
description:
Tonooo is an abstract game; the aim of the game is to be the first to have four small cylinders of different colours in front of you.
Each player in his turn :
-Either draws a small cylinder from the bag and places it in one of the 4 big cylinders
-Or he picks up one of the four big cylinders and takes all the small cylinders placed in it.

Each time there are at least 2 identical small cylinders, the players keeps one of them in front of him.
Each time there are not 2 identical small cylinders, the player is penalized and replaces one of the small cylinders in front of him in the bag.
Each time there are no small cylinders left, the player is eliminated.
There are also the uncoloured small cylinders (jokers)...

name: Gettysburg: Bloody July, 1863
description:
(from Paul Koenig Games website:)

"Gettysburg: Bloody July, 1863" is a two-player brigade level wargame simulation of the Battle of Gettysburg, July 1-3, 1863. As the Confederate player, you must try to crush Meade's army before it can concentrate. As the Union player, you must hold on from the initial shock of the blow, regroup as your army slowly concentrates, and then either weather the storm or launch your own counter-attack against Lee’s outnumbered forces.

GBJ is an old-fashioned beer and pretzels wargame that is not burdened with cumbersome command & control or supply rules.

Paul Koenig's Bloody Civil War Series is based upon the intermediate system of Avalon Hill's Gettysburg 1977.

name: VOR: The Maelstrom  – Pharon
description:
Praise the Vorack!

The ancient, undead pharon race dominates the Maelstrom from its homeworld deep in the Inner Ring. Armed with the untold secrets of the Maelstrom, ultra-advanced weaponry and dark magic, the pharon legions wage war on the living and feed on their fallen enemies to sustain their long-dead bodies.

The Pharon Forcebook provides background on the mysterious origins of the cursed and demented pharon race and presents new pharon units such as slaves, Fists of Anubis, slayers, nobles, harvesters, and soul reavers. This book also contains a Pharon Battle Terrain table, new campaign rules and force traits, and five new pharon personalities that will terrorize your foes!
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Vowel Play
description:
Vowel Play contains over 3000 words divided into four levels and everyone can play together. Recruits (early readers), Rookies (grades 4-6), Pros (grades 7-11), and All-Stars (grades 12-adult). Vowel Play can be played by all ages at the same time.

The spirit of baseball is captured in this fast-paced game while inspiring kids to learn to spell words in order to score "hits" in the game. It's played like a real baseball game with strikes, outs, runs and innings. Players provide missing vowels from four words on "League" cards in order to advance around the bases and score runs.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Sports, Word Game

name: Airlock
description: In Airlock, the players take turns selecting tiles from a central pool and connecting them to build their own personal space stations. There are three rounds, and each round contains fewer tiles to choose from. Each player selects six tiles the first round, four the second, and two the third (for a total of twelve at the end). The player whose space station scores the most points after all three rounds wins.

name: Ace of Aces: Wingleader Deluxe Boxed Set
description:
The Wingleader Deluxe Boxed Set doubled the number of aircraft in the original version of the game and added rules for a campaign game. The Ace of Aces Collector's Guide, by Joseph J. Scoleri III, has this to say:

"The Wingleader Expansion Set was a special addition to games distributed by Chessex Manufacturing. The expansion was added at the time that Chessex acquired Nova's inventory. Dennis Greci estimated that there were approximately 500 of these sets.

A brief review of the Expansion Set shows that it is a "must have" for Wingleader players, if only for the twelve new aircraft cards (which add another 24 aircraft to the game.) Also included are campaign game rules, designed by Alfred Leonardi and Greci, which allow for large scale tournament games. There are also two suggested Speed Bonus rules for dealing with combat between aircraft of varying maximum airspeeds."
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Real-time, Wargame, World War II

name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition Disney – Jeu complet
description:
French complete board game of the Disney edition.
Categories:
blue (Mickey): from Disney Parade (a french TV show) to Euro Disney (name of Disneyland Park in France when it opens) through the life of Walt Disney
pink (Baloo): all about the general culture, from history and geography to sports
yellow (Gyro Gearloose): how to become a perfect scientific
brown (Bambi): to learn all about our animal friends as well as the nature and the environment
green (Pluto): all about the Disney characters, from the number of Beagle Boys to the age of Popeye, through the name of Scrooge and color of the loincloth of Mowgli
orange (Snow White): everything about Walt Disney movies, from The Rescuers to Cinderella through 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea and The Jungle Book

The rules are similar to the classical Trivial Pursuit.

name: Ascension: Eternal Tormentor Promo Card
description:
Cost: 5 Rune
Value: 3 Honor
Effect: Defeat a random monster in the void without paying its cost and put it on the bottom of the center deck
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Pegasus Expansion Pack
description:
The U.S.S. Pegasus is an Oberth-class starship that served as an experimental vessel for the Federation under the command of Captain Erik Pressman. With a small crew, their primary objective was to test prototype weapon systems and engine upgrades, many of which were employed in future Federation starships.
This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

U.S.S. Pegasus Federation Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 14 expansion packs from WizKids Games.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Team Work for Kids
description:
Team Work for Kids takes the long-lived Team Work series from Adlung-Spiele and now uses kid-friendly topics. Gameplay reminds the same, with teams of two explainers needing to describe a concept to others — but only by saying sentences together. More specifically, they need to build sentences on the fly by alternating words without consulting with one another as to what they want to say.

Team Work for Kids includes a simplified version of the game for players as young as six, while the normal game is for players eight and up.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game

name: The Mule Shoe Salient
description:
May 10th, 1864. A solid month of fighting found Grant no closer to the destruction of Lee's army than when his offensive started. Indeed, his losses exceeded Lee's by nearly two thirds. After escaping disaster in the Wilderness (when arguably only the wounding of Confederate General James Longstreet salvaged a stalemate from sure defeat), Grant now found himself grinding his army against the deadly abrasive of Rebel entrenchments.

Desperate for a clean, quick solution, Grant listened attentively to the notions of a brash 24 year old Colonel named Emory Upton. Attack on a narrow front, Upton maintained, and do not pause to fire. The condensed mass, several lines deep, would simply ram its way across the parapets. The first line, after making initial penetration would then fan left and right, widening the breach. The succeeding lines would drive straight ahead, deepening the plunge. A reserve would then arrive, to stem the sure gray counterattack.

Mule Shoe Salient is a regimental-level simulation of the Federal assault on May 12, 1864 at The Bloody Angle, which was the culmination of the Battle of Spotsylvania.

Each unit represents several companies of 120 men/strength point, or artillery sections representing 2 guns. Players alternate moving units and firing. The Federal player wins if their units occupy three or more victory hexes, while the Confederate player wins if no victory hexes are occupied by Federal troops. Any other result is a draw.

11x17 map, 140 die-cut counters, 12 page rulebook.

(source: One Small Step website and user's description)

name: Robotech RPG Tactics: Zentraedi Regult Battlepod Squadron
description:
From the official product description:

Prepare for invasion with Robotech RPG Tactics! Take command of the deadly mecha fighting forces of the United Earth Defense Force, the Zentraedi Armada, or the Malcontents. Robotech RPG Tactics is an epic 6mm scale battle game where players control whole armies from the Robotech universe. Take to the battlefield to crush your friends in a dynamic tactical game where the outcome is always hanging in the balance.

Produced in the millions, the Tactical Battlepod is a light, fast mecha thrown at enemy forces in waves until the enemy is overwhelmed by their sheer weight of numbers.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Puppet Murder
description:
Puppet Murder is a minimalist eight-card game where players draft roles and attempt to kill one another. The card draft is reminiscent of the one in Citadels, but the resolution of each round is solely in terms of which player kills which other.

Each player begins the game with three "life" chips. When one is killed by another player, the killer takes a chip from the victim and flips it to the "kill" side. If at the end of a round, a player has three "kill" chips (and retains a "life") the game is over: the first player to achieve that state has won. Equally, if a player has lost all their life at the end of a round, the game may also be over (though the victory conditions are more complex in that case.)

name: The Ten Million Year FilmCow Wars Card Game
description:
The Ten Million Year FilmCow Wars is a card game starring many of your favorite and least favorite FilmCow characters. It can be played by 2-4 people, and each game lasts around 15-30 minutes.

Can you score more points than your friends and/or bus stop acquaintances? I have no idea, maybe. I am not a mystical seer. The veil of time covers even my eyes."

The game is played by drawing s hand of cards and choosing one to play and one to discard. Each card falls into one of 5 color coded "suites". The first player to collect one of each suit wins the game. Each card features conditions such as requirements to play, or effects that happen once in play.

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Young Copper Dragon Expansion Pack
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Copper Dragon Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature, upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Unfair
description:
Unfair is an asymmetric N-in-a-row game. Players take turns placing pieces on an 11x11 board.

White plays first, and places two pieces per turn.
Black plays second, and places four pieces per turn.

White wins by making an orthogonal contiguous line of 4 pieces.
Black wins by making an orthogonal contiguous line of 7 pieces.

Diagonal lines do not count.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.R.W. Terix Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 3 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, the Q Continuum.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Guesstimaster
description:
Become the Guesstimaster in this fast-thinking game, by Acabo Games. Challenge your mind, use powers of deduction and guesswork to come up with answers for the toughest of questions!

Invite up to 3 friends, either test your wits against each other or join forces and use your knowledge to make educated guesses on facts about the wider world. Even if you relinquish the lead, you can impact the game in your favor: steal your opponents’ points, make them reveal their answer first or swap places with them!

Three categories of questions (Market, Technology and Mindplay) require varied knowledge and excellent guesstimation skills to obtain mastery. Get your neurons firing and earn the title of the Guesstimaster!

Example questions:


How many people have visited the Eiffel Tower since its construction in 1889?
How many red blood cells does an adult human have on average?
How many cups of coffee are consumed in the U.S. every day?

name: Dominup
description:
Dominup is a game for 2 to 4 players that can be played with a Double-seven binary-coding dominoes set (36 tiles) or a standard Dominoes set.

There are two types of placements in Dominup. In both cases the tile must be aligned with an imaginary orthogonal grid:


‘Climb’ placement: The tile is placed atop two adjacent tiles of the same level, so that the numbers (symbols) of the placed tile match the symbols underneath (one of each supporting tile).



‘Expand’ placement: The tile is placed on the table and orthogonally adjacent to at least one tile already placed.


Randomly distribute the tiles face-down among the players (as in dominoes).

The player with the double-7 starts by placing it in the middle of the playing surface.

Starting with the second player, players take turns in anticlockwise order doing all of the following steps in order until the game end condition is reached:

1. If you can make a climb placement with at least one of your tiles, then you must do so. You can choose which tile to place, as long as the placement is legal. Repeat this action until you can’t make any more climb placements.

2. If you have at least one tile left, then make one expand placement.

If, at the end of your turn, you have no tiles left, then you’ve won and the game ends. However, the other players can continue playing to determine 2nd, 3rd, and 4th place if they wish.

Variant: Misere Dominup

In this variant, the player who runs out of tiles first loses.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Montgolfier Expansion Pack
description:
Star Trek - Attack Wing: U.S.S. Montgolfier Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 23 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Montgolfier is a Saber class ship.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.R.W. T'Met
description: This ship is the competitive prize for "The Void" episode Organized Play event.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order
