name: Mamma Mia: Joker-Zutat
description:
Mamma Mia: Joker-Zutat is a promotional expansion for Mamma Mia consisting of 2 cards, given away for free at Stadt-Land-Spielt 2015.

The Joker-Zutat (wildcad ingredient) can be used as every ingredient.
It can be used with every Mamma Mia! or Sole Mio! game, but has a Mamma Mia!-backside.

name: 原始人の晩餐 (Supper of Primitive Man)
description: 原始人の晩餐 (Supper of Primitive Man) makes you the head of a primitive tribe, and by hunting and gathering you can nourish that tribe, increasing its numbers and moving toward victory.

name: To the Sound of the Guns: Scenarios for Johnny Reb
description: To the Sound of the Guns is a 48 page softback book of scenarios for Johnny Reb (you must have Johnny Reb in order to play these scenarios). Each scenario takes one of these battles - these windows on our country's darkest time - and allows you to be a part of it.
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: October War: Arab-Israeli War 1973
description:
October War is a wargame of the 1973 Arab-Israeli War.

There are two Theaters of Operation: Sinai and Golan, both portrayed as a point to point system (since most of the major actions were fought over key points or lines of communications). There are two players in the game, one commanding the Israelis, and the other the Arabs, and the game emphasizes critical factors of the conflict, but allows for large units to break down into smaller units, representing organizational flexibility and cohesion. The game is driven by the drawing of event markers which represent major tactical and strategic factors that affected the course of the campaign historically.

Published with Modern War #25, Sept-Oct 2016

name: Voobrazhariy: Junior
description:
From the publisher (translated):
Explain what is plasticine or a popsicle, show other players autopilot or a gate, draw sneezing or an underachiever — any of that in just in 1 minute! You just have to be understood.
"Imagination: Junior" — is a fun game for a cheerful company and is based on guessing words. The Junior edition is designed for young players and contains the tasks that are understandable and accessible to children.

From the publisher (Russian):
Объясни, что такое пластилин и эскимо, изобрази гололёд и салочки, нарисуй чихание или двоечника — всего за 1 минуту. Главное, чтобы тебя поняли!
«Воображарий: Junior» — увлекательная игра на загадывание и разгадывание слов для весёлой компании. Издание Junior рассчитано на самых юных игроков и содержит задания, понятные и доступные детям.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Lulu Vroumette
description:
Lulu Vroumette and his friends decided to make a race up to the house as quickly as possible to party.
But the road is full of pitfalls ; it will be necessary to take risks by using the big die to go fast either be careful by using the small die.
On the way, collect daisies which will help you to progress more or less fast in your race, take shortcuts.
And attention not to be slid in the puddle or in the mud!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Super Hazard Quest: New Items
description: The "New Item" expansion offers 16 new Item Cards, some of which have powerful new properties that can change the Dungeon as a whole.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Maze, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Intercepted Messages Resource
description:
The Intercepted Messages Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in Tin Man Episode Organized Play Event. It is considered a Resource and costs 5 squadron points.

When using this Resource, you receive 5 Evade tokens on the Resource at the start of the game. If an enemy ship performs a certain action from it's Action Bar (Scan, Target Lock, Battle Stations or Cloak), you may place one of these tokens by your ship for free. Once placed, the token does not return to the Resource. You may only use the Resource once per round.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Boxing Clever
description:
Description from the publisher:

Two fighters enter the ring, but only one can emerge victorious! Do you have the stamina, speed and strength to be the victor!

A boxing themed card game for 2 players.

Setup:
Divide the cards into five decks: Fighters, and the four Skills decks - Punch, Dodge, Counter and Cross.

Shuffle the Fighter deck and give each player two Fighter cards. Players choose one card and place it face up and one card on top of it face down. Use the corner of the face down card to mark the starting stamina of 10 on the face up fighter. Note - each fighter has a unique set of skills and a favored hand.

Separately shuffle each of the Skill decks and deal a number of cards to each player as listed under ‘Skills’ for the Fighter’s card setting any extra cards aside.

Then, shuffle all Skill cards previously set aside and deal one to each player. Any remaining cards are removed from the game.
Both players now have a deck of 21 Skill cards. Each player will look at their cards and choose 11 cards to take in hand for the first round. The other 10 cards will be used in the second round and are set aside.

Types of Skill Cards:
Punch cards are attack cards and deal damage, reducing a player’s stamina.
Dodge cards are defense cards, reducing stamina damage.
Counter cards are defense cards, reducing stamina damage from the other player and then immediately become attack cards and deal stamina damage to the other player.
Cross cards are attack cards and deal stamina damage, and then give a bonus attack value if the next card played by the player is a Punch card.

Play:
Players will simultaneously choose a card from their hand, placing it face down in front of them. Both players will then reveal their cards at the same time and place them face up in front of them in a row. Players then assess who will take stamina damage based on the two cards just played.

After 10 cards are played in the first round, both players will place their 11th card in front of them and add the number in the upper right of the card to the current stamina on their Fighter card. This is the only time stamina is added to a player’s total.

Both players will then take the remaining 10 cards into their hand and fight a second round. If at any point, during any round, a player’s stamina is reduced to zero that player is knocked out and the other player wins. The player with the higher stamina after two rounds is the winner.

If, after two rounds, players have the same stamina value, each player will choose 10 cards from their deck of 21 and will compete in a third and final round. If players are still tied after a third round, the match is a draw.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Hunting Sasquatch
description:
The Wild Animal Channel has put up a bounty of one million dollars for the person or person who can bring in a live Sasquatch. So gather your gear and your friends and journey across North American in your Hunt for Sasquatch. But be wary as you will have to face off against other Cryptids such as the El Chupacabra, The Wampus Cat, The Van Meter Bat Monster, and many more!

Each turn you will take on the role of a group of hunters
and try to capture one of the location cards on the table. You will roll all the dice and match your rolls to the symbols listed on the card's victory conditions. But be careful because in these dangerous locations you always apply your dice to the Lost Conditions first and if you fill them you are defeated. If you fill neither then you can push your luck to see if you can push on to obtain victory!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Humor, Party Game

name: Vault Wars: Chromatic Cavern Promo Card
description:
Promo card for Vault Wars

Text:
You may keep this as a Gem Item.
When scoring, choose one Gem type and score victory points as if you have one more of that type

Cannot be sold, traded or exchanged. Storage Fees must be paid.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Balloon
description:
"For our friend and her new beginning..."

Balloon is a colorful game dedicated to friendship. Balloon features a color-friendly Cards and peaceful feelings with a sky background and lots of balloon!

Balloon has 2 modes of gameplay; party mode and couple mode. Party Mode is the easier and more fun mode of the game, where players need to make a balloon party merrier by adding confetti (flip Balloon Cards from clear side to confetti side) and by doing so they also sabotaging other players in a fun way. Meanwhile, in Couple Mode, players are required to use strategy to make sure they can fill their board faster or get higher Victory Points.

On both Party Mode and Couple Mode, winners are determined by most Victory Points, but how they acquire it is different. On Party Mode, Victory Points are distributed at random but on Couple Mode are based on how they perform on their player board.

There are one unique way to end the game, each time a player trade their resource to a Balloon Card, one resource has to be discarded, if there are 5 cards discarded with same color, the game immediately ends and Victory Points counted!

name: Marvel HeroClix: Captain America Civil War Starter Set
description: Standalone set for Heroclix inspired by the movie Captain America Civil War. Can be played alone or combined with other HeroClix sets. Contains minis for Captain America, Winter Soldier, Iron Man, Falcon, Black Widow, and Black Panther + character cards.

name: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy – Frank the Influential Reviewer
description:
A promotional card given out during the 2016 Essen Spiel conference by G@mebox. Later available as part of a draw, entry by commenting on the G@mebox website guestbook.

Featuring Frank Schulte-Kulkmann, aligned with the Prussians and provides bonus friend card draws for each Contribution card a player holds.
categories: Age of Reason, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: War
description:
All that exists of this game is the board. It is not known whether there was a spinner or die/dice were used to move the players along. Number of players is unknown.

The game looks to be about the Spanish American War (the enemy flags are Red and Yellow, similar to the Spanish Flag of the time). The theater could reflect the battle for Cuba. Possibly reflecting the Naval battle of Santiago Bay in the lower center and San Juan Hill as the final point the players are trying to attain.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mission Impractical: 1st Promo Pack
description: Mission Impractical: 1st Promo Pack is a mini-expansion for Mission Impractical that consists of 11 new tasks and 16 new items. Some of the cards contain slightly more mature content than those in the base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Reis door de ruimte met Andre Kuipers: Het bordspel
description:
Fly through space with André Kuipers! Defy gravity in space and hunt for astonishing objects and phenomena from the universe. With each mission you complete, you will learn more about the universe and earn a flightpatch! If you know how to finish first by completing your missions and returning safely to your rocket ship, you win!

Introduction
Each player has a set of flightpatches which needs to be collected. After assembling the flightpatches, the player has to return to the rocket ship. The first one to do so, wins the game!
The player moves by sliding through the level and only the end of it, a wall, a sphere or another player can stop someone from sliding.
Some flightpatches are difficult to gather and that's when the spheres come in! Everyone is allowed to use a sphere in order to be able to collect a flightpatch, but also to thwart another player.
This game consists of ten levels with various difficulties.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Long Long Line in HELL
description:
You are the leader of the ogres group. Aim of this game is queuing your ogres (dice) a distribution stations and get a beautiful stone. Can receive stones of your choice from the player who placed the most dice at the distribution stations.

However, the demons are not very smart, so they will not move as you would expect. A player who successfully directs the ogres and get more stones than other players will win.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: What's up? Junior
description:
What’s up? Jr. is a fast paced game where all players will have to create a crazy fun story using the elements shown on the game cards (castle, car, etc.). During the game, the different action cards will force you to continue the story using mime, challenge your peers or even introduce yourself into the story. Once the cards have been dealt, one by one you will place a card face up, telling a story that includes the image on the card. The story should be logical but can be as crazy as your imagination allows. But you must be aware of the action cards, as you could have to change direction, duel, tell the story with mime, etc. Will you be able to end the story?

—description from the publisher

name: Samhain: Useful Items
description:
This expansion for Samhain contains 3 tokens and 4 additional place cards.

Tokens:

Magic Cauldron: It allows players to move more members of the clan.
Gladius: Influence the action cards that can be used in each turn.
Magic Potion: Provides additional powers to those who own it.


Cards:

Spring: allows you to use your items at best.
Sacred Oak: Provides bonus resources during the game.
Circle of Stones: Allows you to manage the will-o-wisp tokens easily.
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Worker Placement

name: DUNE: Struggle for Arrakis
description:
10193 AG – The drug spice melange is the most precious substance in the known universe, enabling humans to achieve great mental feats. It can only be found on the planet Arrakis, commonly referred to as Dune, its profitable harvesting operations administered by the Great House Atreides.

After a treacherous sneak attack by the Padishah Emperor and House Harkonnen, the young Paul Atreides finds refuge with the indigenous Fremen who believe him to be their “Giver of Water”, a messianic off-world prophet destined to lead them out of darkness. The new Duke forms a massive army of Fremen fighters with the aim of fulfilling the prophecy, changing the course of humanity forever.

"DUNE: Struggle for Arrakis" is a two-player Strategic wargame depicting the insurgency known as the Arrakis Revolt. The game builds upon Mark Simonitch's The U.S. Civil War (GMT), adding new twists like changeable terrain, heavy storms and sandworms – all with a simplified ruleset and a more manageable playtime. The game is non-profit and free to download and play.

—description from the designer
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Sussed?: Lifeology
description:
Finding out what everyone thinks about things has never been easier or more fun! Sussed All Sorts is a family friendly quiz with a twist: instead of general knowledge, you’ll be answering questions about each other! As you read aloud a series of real and imaginary scenarios, you’ll be given choices to make. Whoever can suss you out scores. Who has the most points wins.

Over 200 topics to talk about including secret agents, driverless cars, flirting, writing code, sky diving, armadillos, news bloopers, body odour judges and meditation (to name a few!). So, who've you got sussed?

—description from the publisher

name: Vote ME!
description:
Vote ME! is a vocal party game for three or more players, split into Parties and can take from about 10-15 minutes (3 round game, a few players) up to 90 minutes (9 rounds, 7+ players).

Each round has three steps:

1) Draw cards - the area card that is being contested and the Policy and Theme card for the round

2) Give speeches - one player from each party has to give a 1 minute speech based on the rounds Policy and Theme

3) All players vote for the Party (other than their own) that they thought gave the best speech. The Party with the most votes wins the area card.

At the end of the game, the Party with the most area cards wins.

The Policy cards cover things you would normally expect to see in an election, and are there to provide a focus for the speech. The Theme cards provide additional flavor for the speech content, and normally, only the title of the Theme card is used, with the 6 options used as inspiration. However, if you want to add a bit more of a challenge to your game, you can roll a dice and use the corresponding option to the number rolled as the theme.

name: Duckaiju
description:
Welcome to the Duckaiju. You have been found worthy to participate in the production of Kaijuice. You will be guided by other Acolytes in this process. As you unlock more talents and abilities your value will attract those Devout members who want you to succeed within the organization. Whoever has the most points at the end wins. Be careful not to acquire too many Kaiju-Beans. They will make you sick. Pull up a stool and let’s get you started with your... um... administration.

Setup with three decks having four face up cards in the center of the table. Players play cards in front of themselves so you never have to hold anything in your hand because we are an open book in this organization.

The game is played over several rounds in which players take one action each doing the following:
-Acquiring Duckaiju, Acolytes, or Devout cards
-Producing or trading Kaijuice
-Performing card specific actions.
Each card and Kaijuice gen is worth victory points at the end of the game. Whoever has the most victory points at game end, wins. Be weary of the Kaiju-Bean. Too many of those and you could lose.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Take That

name: 愚者の園 (Fool's Field)
description:
User summary
In this game, the players, as kings of two neighboring countries, aim to quickly end the war between their countries. Deploy Soldier cards to the Field to reduce the cards in your hand. The last player to use up the cards in their hand wins.
—description from the publisher

In a turn, you either play a card to the field (if possible), or retreat and pick up all cards.

愚者の園 (Gusya no Sono) is Fool`s Field, a two player card game of hand managment.

Each player is dealt 6 cards at the beginning, and the rest forms the draw deck. Then, players do multiple battles. For each battle, players play cards to the 3x3 battlefield by matching the cards' icons. If you can't play legally, or wish not to play, you have to call a 'retreat' and lose the battle.

If you lose the battle, you must take all the played cards in your hand, and discard down to the hand size of 6 cards. If you win the battle, you draw from the deck up to 6, unless the deck is exhausted; then you won't draw further.

Then start the next battle, with the previous winner placing the first card from their hand to the center of the battlefield as the lead. Continue battle until one player has got rid of their cards. That player wins the game.

The cards have 3 kinds of icons on the 4 sides of the card: sword / shield / flower. When playing a card, a sword icon must be matched against another sword icon. A shield must be matched to a flower, and flower against a shield.

Since the battle loser must draw back their played cards, players build up partial information but with discards, there are still unknowns. At the start of the game, players can manage their hand from their draw deck. But as the deck is exhausted, it gets harder to control the battle.

Publisher's summary
「愚者の園」”Fools Field”は、すこし変わった2人用の対戦カードゲームです。
このゲームの目的は、いち早くゲームから抜けること。そのためには、相手よりも早く手札を使い切る必要があります。
手番では、場に札をプレイして手札を減らしていきます。
うまく札を配置し、相手を手詰まりに追い込めば、場の札を引き取らせることができます。
手札と山札の減り具合を読み、勝敗を決するフェーズを見越して、手札をうまく構築しましょう！

"Fool's Field" is a rather unusual kind of card game for two. The object of the game is to get rid of your hand faster than your opponent. On your turn, you play your cards to the battlefield to reduce your hand. Play wisely, and when you make your opponent short of legal plays, opponent is forced to claim all the cards played to the battlefield. Keep your eyes on your hand and remaining deck, plan ahead, time your moves, and construct your hand!
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Zathura
description: This game was released as an advertising insert in the November, 2005 issue of Nickelodeon Magazine, promoting the movie Zathura. It is a a "flip and move" game (moving by coin flip) with multiple interconnected paths through the solar system. Players must move to seven different planets and answer the trivia questions printed on them correctly before returning to the start space to win. Various spaces cause loss of turns, bonus moves, etc.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Trivia

name: Blood Red Skies: Messerschmitt BF109 E Squadron
description:
This is an expansion set for the WWII aircraft miniatures game Blood Red Skies by Warlord Games and designed by Andy Chambers. This expansion includes a squadron of German Messerschmitt BF109 E fighers and additional accessories to add to the core game.

Components included in this expansion are:
6 Messerschmitt Bf-109E Fighters
6 Advantage Flying Bases
1 Aircraft Card
6 Aircraft Trait Cards
6 Double-sided Pilot Skill Discs
1 Aircraft Markings Sticker Sheet
3 Action Cards

The Messerschmitt BF-109 'Emil' was the Luftwaffe's premier single-engine fighter at the outbreak of WWII. This powerful Luftwaffe fighter ran wild over Poland, the Low Countries, and France, devastating its opponents. Throughout the war, the BF-109 constantly improved its aerodynamics, weapon systems and engine to keep up with Allied Fighter development.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, World War II

name: What's For Dinner?
description:
Ever been with a group of people and can't decide what to eat for dinner? What's For Dinner? is a light and fast game designed to cleanse the palate, inspire hungry players, and bring friends and family to the table. Grab meals that match your cravings and traits before other players snatch them, or you might go without.

Each player is dealt three dining trait cards, discards one card, keeps one hidden, and reveals the third for all players to know what their eating trait is, e.g., vegetarian.

The game comes with a custom food die that represents all food groups: fruit/veggie/meat/dairy/wheat as well as bacon [fats & oils]. Bacon is a wild in the game, representing any of the five basic food groups as the player chooses. Each player rolls the food die during their turn to see what they crave during the round, then either acquire a matching meal card in play from the meal card pyramid of five community meal cards, or veto a specific meal card and discard that card into the dumpster (the bottom of the game box), then draw a wallet card. Wallet cards can be used during the game to purchase a corresponding meal card, better their turn, or impact another player's turn.

The goal of the game is to get the most meal points as others decide to go along with your food choice. The game-end is triggered when the last meal card is drawn from the meal card draw pile.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That

name: slash2: thirst blood
description: Slash 2: Thirst Blood is a standalone sequel to Slash. Players compete to create the One True Pairing by choosing popular culture figures from their hand of cards to pair with the character chosen by the matchmaker. If the matchmaker chooses your card, you win the round, and score those points. If they don't choose your card, you can petition the table to override the matchmaker by telling a short fanfic story of your choice.
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Role Playing, Storytelling, Voting

name: Wonderland Xiii: The Caterpillar Promo
description:
2018 Pre-order Promo

The Gift Pack includes 3 Caterpillar cards.
During setting, shuffle all the Spirit cards with the Caterpillar cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection
publishers: Play With Us Design (玩聚設計)

name: Mini Madness Cthulhu: The Arkham Investigation
description:
Deep inside the vicious mind of the elder gods, resides the madness of mankind. You are not an ordinary person, have seen many things, gaze at the abyss of your own mind, many must called you liar, crazy, even a fraud, but now, the madness that you spoke of, trapped in the nightmares of your soul, broke free into our world, and bring something ancient, evil... and hungry.

Welcome to the Mini Madness Cthulhu - The Arkham Investigation - a mini 9 card game self published, that have elements of Cthulhu's and other H.P Lovecraft histories, as well cosmic horror creatures and elements.

As a Free PNP (print an Play), Solitaire or cooperative game, your goal is to save the world from being devoured by the Ancient Gods, to do that you must collect artifacts and clues, yet it seems simple. To "win" (survive) the game you'll have to fight the cultists, monster and the "Chaos Die", and be able to stay unharmed and mentally fine.

In this game, you have resources, and have to travel from the cards and resolve it rolling dice. Be aware of each ability from every one of the four investigators. As the game proceed the Ancient God will slowly awaken, and make things more difficult. As you collect the symbols "elder signs" you may have the specific amount of the chosen Elder God, when you do so, you beat the game, and save the world - HURRAY! - but... for how much time?

---

No fundo das mentes viciosas dos Deuses Anciões, reside a loucura da humanidade. Você não é uma pessoa comum, viu muitas coisas, olhou para o abismo da sua própria mente, muitos devem chamar-lhe mentiroso, louco, ou até mesmo uma fraude, mas agora, a loucura de que você falou, presa nos pesadelos de sua alma , se libertou em nosso mundo, e trouxe algo antigo, maligno ... e faminto.

Bem-vindo ao Mini Madness Cthulhu - A Investigação Arkham - um mini-jogo de nove cartas auto publicado, que tem elementos de Cthulhu e outras histórias de H.P Lovecraft, bem como criaturas e elementos de terror cósmico.

Como um PNP gratuito (Imprima e Jogue), jogo solo ou cooperativo, seu objetivo é salvar o mundo de ser devorado pelo Deuses Antigo, para isso você deve coletar artefatos e pistas, parece simples, eu garanto a você que não é. Para "vencer" (sobreviver) o jogo você terá que lutar contra os cultistas, monstros e o "Dado do Caos", e ser capaz de permanecer ileso e mentalmente bem.

Neste jogo, você tem recursos e precisa viajar dos cards resolvê-los rolando os dados. Esteja ciente de cada habilidade de cada um dos quatro investigadores. À medida que o jogo avança, o Deus Antigo despertará lentamente e tornará as coisas mais difíceis. Ao coletar os símbolos "Elder Signs" você pode ter a quantidade específica do Deus Ancião escolhido, quando você faz isso, você vence o jogo e salva o mundo - OBAAAA! - mas ... por quanto tempo?
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Gitzog Wurldkilla: Ork Commander Set
description:
Gitzog Wurldkilla has had enough of his vanguard forces having all the fun. Rumours have circulated back to him that his old mate Krogskull has got ahead of him and is burning stuff before it can be properly looted. Gitzog knows his Waaagh! will lose momentum if all the good scrap sites are on fire, so it’s time to bash some heads together and get everyone back in line. Anyone in his way will be shot, eaten by his squiggy beast Redfangz or cut to chunks by his shearing power klaw.

Add a Commander – a powerful hero character with unique abilities and rules – to your Ork kill team with this set. It contains a multipart plastic Warboss miniature, a set of cards packed with exclusive rules and a sheet of tokens for use in-game:

- An Ork Warboss: this multipart plastic kit represents Gitzog Wurldkilla – or the Commander of any Ork Kill Team you wish – a tall, muscular and imposing sight even by Ork standards, accompanied by a large, impressively-betoothed squig and clutching a kombi-weapon in one hand, the other replaced entirely by a vicious power klaw.
- A datacard for Gitzog Wurldkilla, featuring his characteristics, weapons, abilities and specialisms, along with a card featuring his background
- A card featuring Gitzog Wurldkilla’s skill tree – Warboss specialisms which can only be used by that character
- 5 Ork Commander Tactics cards, including 2 Tactics exclusive to this set
- A sheet of tokens for use in games of Kill Team – this includes 1 Move/Charge token, 1 Fall Back/Advance token, 1 Ready/Shoot token, 6 Tactic/psychic power tokens, 3 wound tokens, and 3 objective tokens.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: ジャンブルオーダー (Jumble Order)
description:
Goblins, elves, demons, dragons, and humans.
Races with different blood continued their never ending battle throughout the history, but finally found a path of holding hands and living together without conflicts. They vested into common interests beyond the boundaries of the race, and founded a new country. However... it is not possible for living things to coexist without contentions, as the history often repeats itself.
Conflict is inevitable as more and more small countries unite themselves through “interest” instead of “blood.” The war is about to break out where humans turn against other humans, and goblins point their blades against other goblins...

Jumble Order is a “deck-building game” where you manage your country (Deck) by incorporating various races, winning at wars, gaining territories, and flourishing your country. You will aim to become the great lord by strategically building your deck and finding powerful card combinations. However, it will not be easy to manage the crucible of races with conflicting interests.

You will need precise planning and flexible judgement to be successful at managing the “Jumble Order” where you never know when and in what order the cards will come out out of your deck!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Athens: The Birth of Politics
description:
Recreating the political life of ancient Athens, from the birth of Democracy to the titanic struggle with Sparta, players cooperate and compete to manage its fortunes, especially its politics, wars and government.

Players must constantly balance personal advancement against the security of the state. They trade and fight to build up the empire, vie for power in the Assembly and on the battlefield.

Each player represents a specific class – Aristocrats, Merchants or Farmers – with its own Statesmen, (dis)advantages and goals.

In a unique feature, the game reflects the ancient Greek theory of Anacyclosis – the cycles of government – as it changes from Democracy to Oligarchy to Tyranny and back again. Players can strive to change these forms, for their own advantage, and thereby alter the very rules of the game.

Player activities include
- collect income
- maintain bodyguards
- trade
- contribute to the state treasury
- plan a persuasion
- persuade another's statesman
- assassinate
- play action cards
- attract followers
- redistribute funds
- change faction leader
- sponsor events
- purchase discards
- make proposals
- negotiate
- vote
- elect officers
- send forces to wars
- fight a war
- earn influence and popularity
- stand for public reaction
- stand for trial
- draft action cards
- change the form of government
- resist oligarchy
- declare a coup
- support a coup
- fight a coup
- ostracize a leader

Players can achieve victory by a variety of means, including
- successful coup
- having the most popularity when the game ends
- having the most popularity minus votes and talents if the Athens fails, that is, due to state bankruptcy, four or more active wars, loss or failure to prosecute a perilous war

-description from publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Battle for the Carolinas
description:
The war for independence has moved south toward the Carolinas. Great Britain is threatening to extinguish any rebellion that dares to foment disobedience to the crown. Its up to you to procure supplies, garner troops and persuade the colonists to join in the rebellion. While siding with the rebels, you will have skirmishes with those loyal to the crown. These are just the precursors to the culmination of events leading to the battles of Cowpens and Kings Mountain. Will you amass a big enough army and enough supplies to defeat the British?

Inspired by Palm Island, Battle for the Carolinas is a handheld, solo game where you assume the role of the patriots trying to purge the Carolinas of the British. Each turn you will build your army and gather more weapons in the hopes defeating the British in skirmishes and ultimately, in the battles at Cowpens and Kings Mountain.

Originally an entry into the 2018 Solitaire PnP Game Design contest, the "Parchment Edition" has full color cards and introduces two new cards, the battle at Waxhaws and the Swamp Fox
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer (Fifth Edition): Siege
description: This 88-page softcover book has rules for a whole new way of playing Warhammer Fantasy Battle (5th Edition) focused on sieging a castle. New rules for things like siege engines and dropping items, say boiling oil; a new flow for play; and a system for buying castle defenses within the scope of building Fantasy armies are all presented.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Antic (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
Now we are going to the alternative Ancient World that looks like Ancient Greece, 8734 year from foundation of the World.

This is the 2nd expansion in new storyline and it continues the global story from expansion T.I.M.E Stories: Geologists. You may play this expansion as standalone game, but I recommend you to start from 1st expansion in storyline.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Table Fighter
description:
Table Fighter is a fast paced fighting card game for 2 or more players. It's easy to pick up and play, but has enough depth to keep even the most skilled players hooked. Table Fighter is inspired by traditional fighting games: you are rewarded for anticipating what your opponent will do and your skill completely replaces randomness.
In Table Fighter, both players have a deck of six cards that they arrange before playing, and a super card which sits face up on the table. Because each player chooses the order of their deck, there is no randomness created in shuffling.

Players can intentionally rearrange their decks using a "betting" mechanic to super-charge their moves and avoid their opponent memorizing their order, but the order of one's deck is always a direct result of their actions and combos.

Players select actions in their hand and then simultaneously reveal them. The winning card is chosen through a rock-paper-scissors-like mechanic. Each player starts with 20 health, last player standing wins!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Red Skies: German – Junkers Ju 87D Stuka Squadron
description:
The Ju87 was the Luftwaffe's dedicated dive bomber, indeed the name "Stuka" is derived from the German word Sturzkampfflugzeug - "dive bomber". Early in the war it was a deadly adjunct to the Panzer Divisions as flying artillery with pinpoint accuracy. The Battle of Britain exposed the overall weakness of the Stuka to opposing fighters, but the upgraded Ju87D model continued to perform its essential work on the Mediterranean and Eastern fronts.

Metal components.

Contents:
6 Junkers Ju 87D Planes
6 Advantage Flying Bases
6 Base Extensions
1 Punchboard with Double-sided Pilot Skill Discs
1 Aircraft Card
1 Doctrine Card
1 Negative Aircraft Trait Card
1 Waterslide Decal Sheet
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Four's Not Enough: Fairy Party!
description:
Fairies love parties.
However, they never host it themselves. It's a hassle for them to send out invitations and arrange a hall for it. This is where you come in!
You set up the party for them and in return receive "Sparkles".
But be careful! Don't start the party until all the fairies have gathered. If you try to start the party prematurely, you'll put the fairies in a bad mood!

Gameplay:

The player is helping fairies and in return receiving Sparkles. The player will play fairies (cards from value 0-3) to party halls face down. If you think you've gathered 5 or more fairies, give the order and start the party.
If a player has gathered 15 or more chips (sparkles), the game ends. At that point, the player with the most chips is the winner.

—user summary

name: Monopoly: Walking Dead
description:
Monopoly: Walking Dead turns the classic real-estate trading game into a fight for survival against the zombie hordes! Players compete and trade resources for iconic locations from the hit series, including the Greene family farm and Woodbury, then build up fortifications to protect against the Walkers. Only one player will be left standing when the dust settles!

Special customizations include Houses and Hotels that are renamed Fences and Guard Towers, Community Chest and Chance cards that are renamed Survivors and Walkers, and six The Walking Dead tokens -- Michonne's Katana, Rick's Revolver, Carl's Hat, Daryl's Crossbow, Negan's Lucille and a Walker Head.

Includes 60 minute speedplay rules.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Name it
description:
Name It is a Draw-a-card-&-write game which is based on an Iranian traditional party game called Esm-o-Famil (First name and family name).

In Name It, players try to name as many words in various categories as they can with the each letter card revealed.
There are also a deck of Event Cards, starting a cool challenge in every round of the game. The main part of the game is writing, but some parts are done orally.

In every round a card revealed which has a letter on it and then all players simultaneously try to write down a word with that letter in categories shown on a category card (which is varied from personal to entertainment). Each player scores for his/her right words and at the end the player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Constellations Roll & Write
description:
Equipped with a pencil and a galaxy sheet, all players use results from a dice roll to create constellations (a group of stars). Each player attempts to place the numbers in their galaxy in the best possible way and to make wise use of power-ups to score the most points.
Everyone plays at the same time!

—description from the designer

name: Buzzwords
description:
Are you thinking what I'm thinking? You'll never know unless you play BUZZWORDS!

A challenging word game of first thoughts and second guesses. See how well you can zero in on a given category and determine its most obvious BUZZWORDS. Then find out how well you and your friends can think alike by guessing each others BUZZWORDS.

—description from the box

name: Super Susuru Soup
description:
Super Susuru Soup is a Japanese card game. Susuru means slurp; in Japan, noisily slurping up your ramen is good manners. It shows the food is being thoroughly enjoyed.

This is a game to collect high-class and trendy ingredient cards to make soup. However, it is difficult to foresee trends. Even if you collect the best ingredients, you may not be able to use them if they are not in trend... Try to make the best soup by collecting trendy ingredients that are also quite high-class.

高級で流行りの素材のカードを集めてスープを作ることです。ただし、流行りは先読みするのが難しい。どんなに良い素材を集めても流行りの素材でなければ使えなくなることも...流行りの素材で且つなるべく高級な素材を集めて最高のスープを作ることを目指しましょう。
publisher's summary

name: Zuid Afrika: Those Restless Years – The Anglo Boer Confrontation 1883-1900
description:
In the middle of the 19th century, the Boers had won the first Anglo-Boer war and managed to rescue themselves from the English rule, but their newborn Republics were unstable both politically and economically. Furthermore, there, remained a situation of great hostility against Great Britain. When immense diamond veins were discovered in Transvaal, the following decades (1860-1890) opened the way for a new economical and armed conflict.

"Zuid Afrika: Those Restless Years - The Anglo Boer Confrontation 1883-1900" is a card-driven wargame for 1-4 players that traces the path that led South Africa to the Second Anglo-Boer War (the most dramatic one), which ended in 1902, after a long, fatiguing guerrilla warfare.

In Zuid Afrika (ZA), up to four players seek to influence the fate of South Africa. They are:

the British (government of the Cape colony).
the Natives, Bantu and older populations.
the Boers heirs of the Dutch colonizers.
the Uitlanders (literally foreigners) often technical and / or mining personnel, also discriminated like black labor men.


Each faction uses its forces or abilities to influence areas on the map, has its own victory goal, different from the others. The British seek military victory in addition to neutralizing anti-racist demonstrations. The Natives try to turn mining workers into guerrilla warfare and try to establish communities in territories. The Boers try to enlarge their resources and exchange them with weapons. The Uitlanders promote a cultural struggle against apartheid and act, above all, in the cities, seeking the favor of the population.

—description from the designer

name: Risk: The Battle for Medieval England
description:
England has faced many battles in the past; The Battle of Hastings in 1066, prompting the Norman Conquest; The Second Barons’ War of the Roses in 1471, Securing the throne for Edward IV; Culminating in The Battle of Bosworth Field in 1485, where Richard III of the House of York was killed, heralding the end of the Plantagenet dynasty and the birth of the Tudor age.
In our new Risk game it’s your turn to engage in combat never before seen on such a scale, attempting to conquer England and take the crown!
Play as one of five different armies, as you try to capture England and take the throne. Only once all opposition has been wiped out can you lay your claim and become the true King or Queen of England.
As you fight for supremacy, the opposing armies will do their best to stop you. If your army is not victorious by the end of the Middle Ages, then the battle is over and all armies must retreat as the king’s men regain control of the land. With special Power cards to boost your forces or destroy your plans, and special missions to capture strategic strongholds, this game of Risk is an epic battle for control of England.. and the royal throne.

—description from the publisher

name: Rune-atic Chambers
description:
Runeatic Chambers is a cooperative dungeon exploration game for 1 to 2 players. Players aim to collect specific amount of Runes to proceed to the lower levels of the dungeon. If you successfully reached the deepest level, you win the game. However, if you received too much damage or too many phobias, you lose the game.

The game is composed by cards as a dungeon tile, a die for monster fights.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: ELEMANCERS: Light and Dark
description:
ELEMANCERS: Light and Dark is a 2-6 player team-based fantasy area control strategy game in which you take control of an Avatar and Clan wielding 1 of 6 elemental magics: Dark magic (Shadow, Necro, or Ice) or Light magic (Celestial, Beast, or Flame). Using these powers, you summon creatures, cast spells, activate enchanted weapons, and invoke creature abilities.

You play as part of 1 of 2 Factions (Tenebris = Dark Faction or Lux = Light Faction) warring head-to-head which are trying to take control over the Realm by either having the most elemental power, or by finding lost lore and artifacts in order to learn how to resurrect their Primal God of elemental magic at the Hollow of Fate. This location being the place where the gods were last seen after their epic battle, as well as where the dragon Baransu is currently residing, waiting to awake to rid the world of elemental magic and the Factions of Light and Dark!

The game is made up of 2 Rounds, with each Round having two phases: Activate and Conflict. During the Activate Phase, all Clans obtain more Battle Cards, Power Tokens and Creatures. During the Conflict Phase, Clans take turns spending a Power Token to either summon creatures, draw more Battle Cards, utilize their Avatar’s power, or activate a found Legendary Weapon. After spending a Power Token, the Clan may then move any creatures of theirs on the gameboard, followed by an option to Battle at any contested locations. Creatures in the game have a variety of different traits that can be used in Battle, and Battle Dice, Creature Traits and Battle Cards are used in Battle to defeat the enemy!

In the course of the game, Clans complete Saga Cards (secret objectives) to find Lore throughout the Realm and finally a Legendary Weapon’s location and use. These artifacts provide a power boost in the game and help satisfy one of your Faction’s win conditions. Lore Cards provide the history of a Legendary Weapon and story beats encountered at different triggers in the game. Clans are also trying to control matching element locations to place more Power Tokens on the gameboard in order to have the most elemental power to win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Finale Ending, Hexagon Grid, Moving Multiple Units, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Player Elimination, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement, Zone of Control

name: Mazmorras de Puestosombrío
description:
Powerful evil creatures have been imprisoned in a magical dungeon for a millennium. But over time, the magical protection has worn thin, and the monsters are about to escape and wreath havoc on the nearby town of Puestosombrio. The players are entering the dungeon to defeat the ancient evil and save the town.

The players explore the dungeon, which is laid out from cards. When they meet monsters, they can attack them, using their personal stats and equipment to modify their single die roll. Defeating monsters lets the players collect new powers and gain treasure, but the final boss monster also gains strength throughout the game. The goal is to eventually defeat this boss monster.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: The Closest Ghost
description:
You and your best friend are exploring a haunted house on Halloween. Suddenly, a ghost pops up and you both drop your trick-or-treat bags, scattering your precious candies all around you. The first player to finish picking up their candy wins — but be sure to watch out for ghosts!

Can be played with real candy, which you eat as you collect it.

The board is made of two Looney Ludo boards / Martian coasters.

Players take turns moving their own avatar piece, removing any candy they land on, and then moving the closest ghost. Win when your half of the board has no more candy.

—description from the publisher

name: Batyskaf
description:
Be ready for an underwater adventure! Travel with a bathyscaphe and take photos of the most interesting animals! If you dive deeply under water, there is a chance that you will catch extremely rare and fascinating specimens. The one who creates the best photo collection and gets the most pearls wins the game.

The game teaches good planning and trains the skill of estimating risk.

Object.
During the game, you dive with bathyscaphe to get the most interesting animal tokens. You use oxygen cards for this. Bathyscaphe submerge and emerge can be done at one time - as long as you have the right number of oxygen bubbles.

The end of the game.
The game is coming to the end when there are no oxygen cards in the deck. Count all the pearls that are on your animal tokens.
The winner will receive the most points for the collected pearls.

—user summary

name: Kabammm!
description:
Elevate your reflexes and visual perception to superhero level when playing Kabammm! Get rid of your cards quickly by matching icons and take advantage of powerful combo moves! The more you play Kabammm! the faster you will become.

Flip a card and quickly overlay your card by matching two icons. Shout your superhero call and make combos by matching the right colors. First player with no cards left wins!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Comic Book / Strip, Party Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: Bowling the Card Game
description:
Bowling the Card Game is a light, simple, fun game that simulates bowling using a special deck of cards.

This game was designed and created by five siblings aged 4-14. They were inspired to create a fun, realistic bowling game by their grandfather who is a passionate bowler. The result was Bowling the Card Game.

The game involves hand management and press your luck as the players try to deal with troublesome splits, and hoping for that one perfect card to complete a spare. It also reinforces basic math skills through learning to keep score and add up your totals.

Deluxe Edition comes with bowling score pad.

name: Dungeon Royale: Solo/Co-op Expansion Pack
description:
This card pack allows you to play Dungeon Royale as solo or co-op with your friends!

How it plays: You (and/or your partner heroes) are on a quest to steal the stone of life from the dragon to save the king's life. You'll also be encharged with other quests to gather artifacts and up your "high score" (don't be surprised if this sounds familiar in a future stretch goal announcement...!). The dragon and his minions will perpetually get stronger in their quest to score their own "Game Over!"

-description from Kickstarter
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Tajemnicze Domostwo: Pozostawione Wskazówki
description:
When the investigation stops, the investigators decide to find additional clues that may have remained at home even years after the crime. Seeing their efforts, the Spirit decides to send dreams about the place where the answers to their questions are found. This mini add-on introduces cards of left clues that gently modify the gameplay.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: The Mystified Murderess
description:
In this cooperative game, you investigate criminal cases along with the most notorious detective of all time. Follow the leads and gather clues. Go with your team and explore London in the Victorian era. To beat Sherlock Holmes at this game, carefully read the newspapers, follow your intuition, and use your deduction capacities.

This is case 3 from Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: The Thames Murders & Other Cases, which has been made available on its own as a Print & Play.
categories: Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based, Post-Napoleonic, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Riot at the Round Table
description:
Camelot is in chaos, since King Arthur's throne is now up for the taking. Use your wits and arsenal to defeat your foes.

To begin the riot, you attack the defender with a card(s) from your hand. Other players can always join the attack by playing any matching valued cards. The defender can flee, pass, or attempt to be victorious by defeating all the cards. If your friend is about to triumph, you can play another card at the last minute. Will it be enough to push him over the edge?

Using an arsenal card or a jester card can greatly effect the course of each round. Successfully defeat cards to earn more arsenal cards. Throughout the game, you can also earn crowns and scepters to help you in your quest to become the new ruler of Camelot. Three crowns wins you the game! Do you have the strength to be victorious? Join the riot and we shall see!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Events, Hand Management, Score-and-Reset Game, Take That, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Goto Hell!
description:
In the pre-dawn darkness, Japan's Col. Goto launches a massive (by Japanese standards) armored attack against the US Marines on Saipan. All but one of his 44 tanks were wrecks by morning. Marines joked that Japan's T-97 tanks were nothing more than "kitchen sinks."

Part of Against the Odds Magazine's Pocket Battle Games series, this postcard-sized game covers the armored attack led by Col. Goto against US Marines on Saipan, June 17, 1944.

ATO Pocket Battle #26.

name: Phantom Seas
description:
In Phantom Seas, you want to claim as much treasure as possible without having it stripped away from you by the phantom ship that patrols the waters.

To set up, place the 22 treasure tiles face down at random on the designated spaces on the game board. These tiles are worth 1-3 points as indicated by the number of locks on them. Place the included compass on the game board, and orient the board so that the compass points north. Place your ship on one of the starting locations and the phantom ship in the center of the 13x13 game board.

At the start of each round, reveal seven direction cards from the top of the deck. Players then take turns choosing a card and moving their ship in the indicated direction and distance, with most cards giving you choices for one or both of these values. If you finish your movement on a treasure tile, flip it over to see whether the phantom ship moves; if it does, the phantom ship moves directly toward you, and if it reaches you before ending its movement, then you throw that treasure away instead of keeping it.

Some tiles have you rotate the game board (and the compass), which means that the direction cards will now have you moving in different ways.

After all the cards have been played, reveal seven new cards from the deck. After seven rounds or after all treasures have been claimed, players count their scores to see who wins.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Catch The Letch
description:
Players will face each other in an epic battle for becoming the queen of the beach, and charm more letches than each other. You will imperson one of the 8 different girls, each with 3 main characteristics (boobs/butt, one-piece swimsuit/two-piece swimsuit and hair colours(red, blonde, brown, black) + suntan(extra one)). The main objective is to "catch" the letches on the board using this characteristics (letch has his own preferences).

But be wise, you can only play/discard one "action" card and charm only one letch using your "charm" ability during your turn. Action cards make the difference, because they can make you charm more letches in a turn, interrupt other player's actions, make the letches charmed by others run away from them and come back to the beach (the neutral war zone) or simply steal them, enhance yourself, earn new characteristics and more. As time passes more letches will come to the beach, so basically... The longer you play the greater your odds of winnning... Or losing. But don't worry, Catch The Letch has been built with the idea of having fun and playing many many games in a short amount of time, with each game lenght of 20 minutes max (8 players), down to 10 minutes (2 players)! We decided to make a game for as many people as possible, because we have a lot of fun when we play toghether with friends, but sometimes we do even like to relax and have a fast game with one or two of them.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Scene It?: Game Pack – Movie Edition
description:
Add to your Scene It? board game with this Game Pack DVD and trivia cards! Hundreds more scenes and images from Hollywood's biggest movies test your knowledge and observation skills. Enjoy all your favourite visual puzzler challengers from the first game plus the extra Zoom Out and Credit Roll categories.

So dim the lights, sit back and get ready for more movies, more stars and more fun!

—description from the publisher
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Lost Worlds: "Umslopagaas" Scorpion Wizard
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.


Umsplopagaas The Scorpion Wizard booklet - Tunnels and Trolls series. Comes with magic item/spell cards.

Character created by Ken St.Andre.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Space Marines
description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


User summary:
Codex: Space Marines is an expansion codex book for Warhammer 40,000 3rd Edition. This codex covers the most common Space Marine Chapters detailing history, equipment, organization, special rules and characters, painting schemes, and army lists.

From the back cover:
Space Marines are Humanity's ultimate warriors, dedicated to the defence of the Emperor and the Imperium of Man. Inside you will find:

Army Lists: The complete Space Marine army list, which allows you to choose your forces for a battle. Also included is information detailing all the weapons, vehicles and wargear used by Space Marines.

Hobby Section: Sixteen full colour pages packed with invaluable tips and advice on collecting, painting and playing with a Space Marine army.

Special Characters: Complete rules and background information for Space Marines characters such as Marneus Calgar, the Emperor's Champion, Captain Cortez and others.

New Scenario: Planetfall Mission - a new Space Marine mission scenario and rules for playing it.

ISBN: 1-869893-28-X

Re-print in 1999, 2001 and 2002.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Rivals Of The Void
description:
Rivals Of The Void is a strategy card/board game focused on empire building, resource management and area control.

Rivals Of The Void is set an original Science Fiction universe with a sprawling space opera narrative.

Play as of one of four unique species as you attempt to control and colonize the known quadrant by means of Expansion, Diplomacy, Wealth, Reserves, Culture, Industry, Military, Technology, and Tradition.

Rivals Of The Void has many unique features such as a player created play board, with literally trillions of possible configurations no two games will ever be alike.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Economic, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Constrained Bidding, Delayed Purchase, Map Addition, Modular Board, Take That, Turn Order: Claim Action, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Set-up

name: Kotakote
description:
A GAME OF OBSERVATION AND SPEED
OBJECT: use your powers of observation and dexterity to replicate pictures as fast as possible.
All players receive the same 4 Kotakote cards, showing different-coloured geometric shapes on one side and half-finished pictures on the other. A “challenge” card is turned over in the middle of the table. The players must all try and replicate the picture shown on the challenge card by lining up 2 of their Kotakote cards correctly. Remember that only the cards required to complete the challenge can be placed on the table; players must keep hold of the others! The quickest player wins the “challenge” card, which they will need to keep hold of until the end of the game. The first player to win 5 “challenge” cards wins the game.

+++ Two difficulty levels available!

—description from the publisher

name: Monopoly: Hallmark Channel
description:
Gather your family & friends to play this special Hallmark Channel edition of MONOPOLY®. You’ll be transported right into the picturesque world of Hallmark Channel as you travel around the board and buy, sell and trade properties inspired by everything you love about the network. Whether you’re buying a Christmas Tree Farm or a Bed & Breakfast, building cottages and inns, or getting out of jail free because you started a prison knitting club, you’ll experience all the thrills of this classic game in an entirely new way!

Includes:
Gameboard
6 collectible tokens
28 title deed cards
16 Home cards
16 Family cards
2 dice
32 cottages
32 inns
1 pack of custom Hallmark Channel money
Rules

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: It's Contagious!
description:
It's Contagious! is a pocket card game for fast, fun and strategic game-play. Your goal is to discard all your cards first and have the lowest viral load.

A climbing game (like Rummy and inspired by Escalation), cards are placed in a center pile increasing in count until a player can no longer best the previous amount (or use a Power Card).

Gameplay gets a boost of fun and strategy from a variety of Power Cards and additional rules keeps the game much more exciting.

GAMEPLAY

Players shuffle the deck. Each player is dealt 6 cards. The remaining cards are placed, face down, to create the center pile. The last person sick starts (or last round/game's loser) by playing a card face up to start that round's "Viral Load." Players always draw back up to 6 cards in their hand and play passes clockwise.

The next player then has to beat the current Viral Load's value (or match it using Matched Play). If they can't beat it with a higher card, or are able to utilize a Power Card, then they must take that Viral Load and add it to their own Viral Load. The next round starts with the player who played the last card (except when Contagion™ is played).

Play continues in this manner until all cards in the center pile are exhausted and the game ends when the first person plays their last card. All players then count the total number of cards in their Viral Loads and in their hand (if any are remaining).

-description from designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Educational, Humor, Math, Number, Party Game

name: Quiz Master: Terrific Totally Trivia
description:
Totally Terrific Trivia is a family trivia game consisting of 900 questions spanning six categories and one six-sided die.

The game can be played with by individuals or teams. The die is used to determine starting player, and afterwards the corresponding question on the trivia card for the category the player or team chooses. The player or team on the left reads out the question. If the player/team gives the correct answer, they keep the card; if not, it is returned to the box and play passes to the left.

The goal of the game is for each team or player to obtain one card from each category. When this happens, the succeeding team or player wins.

Includes: 900 Questions, 1 die, and rules

name: Vampire Hunter: The Card Game
description:
Vampire Hunter is a single deck card game where players try to become the best Vampire Hunter by killing undead blood suckers and collecting their fangs. The first player to collect fifteen fangs is the winner. That said a player can also win by being the last player left. This is a game for two to four players.

On their turn, a player must take one of three actions. Either visiting the city to equip themselves with weapons and other items, attacking one of the colorful yet horrifying enemies lurking within the city, or using and equipped item. If you are unable to take any action, you must discard one of your precious items card and take a damage.

Variable deck set-up and character selection (each with a unique ability) means no two games will play exactly the same.

name: ガムトーク (Gumtalk)
description:
ガムトーク (Gumtalk) is a game where you tell story about a theme you're given.

There's a deck of cards. There are 6 themes on the front side of the card. There's a number on the back side of the card. You draw 2 cards to choose the theme for the game. Once the theme is given you tell a story that is related to the theme.

The story doesn't need to be something entertaining or interesting. You can talk about anything as long as it is somewhat related to the theme you're given.

Other players who listened to the story says "That's a good story" once the story is ended.
publisher's summary

name: Rome & Roll: Pantheon Promo Card
description:
A promo card available from the BGG Store, 2021.

Pantheon is a Religious Building card.

Build: Build entirely on a hill. Max 1 per Hill. Gain a God's Favour.

Production: Pay 1 Jewellery or 1 Anvil to gain either 2 Coins, 2 Legacy or 1 Senator.

name: 珊瑚秘境 (Coral Secret)
description:
Each player controls a certain amount of sea area(6 coral cards maximum) Players need to use these coral cards to protect more marine fish as much as possible.
When the sea area controlled by a player is used up (that is, the coral cards are all turned over and can not be longer used), the game end condition is triggered, and all players start scoring after playing the same number of rounds.

name: Assault on the Colossus
description:
“The Colossus is fast approaching to the Village! Someone must do something or there will be nothing left behind."

In the role of the Hero you must knock down the Colossus. To perform this feat you must climb through the levels of his body until you reach the sensitive point, his head, and deliver the coup de grace. To achieve this you must wisely manage your stamina, fatigue and vitality. Hurry! The Colossus is moving and the fate of everyone who loves you rests in your hands.

Overview
The Hero starts at ground level (level 0). Each turn you either attempt to climb to the next body spot or hold on to rest and recover. Then the Colossus will act, either attempting to shake off the Hero or advance towards the Village.

—description from the designer

The game continues until the Hero’s vitality reaches zero, the Colossus is killed, or the Colossus reaches the Village.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Arcadia Quest: Prince Aaron
description:
For a crown prince that always leads from the front, it's amazing that Prince Aaron is still alive, let alone as relatively unscathed as he is. Unusually Blessed, it's perhaps because of his invincible reputation that those that follow him are so inspired, and his opponents so cowed (or perhaps it's because of his incredibly loud shouty voice). Nothing will stand in his way to reclaiming the throne for the glory of the royal family! Just keep that shady Newt fella away from him.

Promotional character for Arcadia Quest.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Get the Picture: The Head-to-Head Dot-to-Dot Race
description: Each team inserts the same copy of a picture into their pad, and reveal the first numbers to connect to, then write their guess of what the picture is. They reveal another set of numbers and keep going until the picture is done. Then they compare their gueses and whoever guest the soonest correctly wins.

name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Ally: Scabbers
description:
This Game 1 card was made available during Gen Con 2021.

This Ally carries the following ability:

Choose one:
Gain 1 [LIFE]; or discard an Ally to gain 3 [ATTACK]
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Neutral Factions 2021 Card Update Pack
description: Find all the cards from the 2021 update in this pack of cards for Neutral and Mercenary House players.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Balkan Railways
description:
Balkan Railways - the first expansion for Iberian Railways - stretches from Istanbul to Trieste, from Albania to Romania on two 11x17 inch color maps.

19 new Business Interest cards are supplied, as are the Special Rules for Balkan Railways. Among other elements, the player opening the Orient Express (rail connection from Trieste to Istanbul) receives a bonus, as do the railroads used in the route. The terrain in the Balkans is tough, and hexes are Mountains, Hills or Clear.
 
The game is for 3-5 players, takes about an hour, with one page of expansion rules. The expansion can be used with either the Winsome original Iberian Railways game or the Rio Grande licensed Iberian Railways game.

—description from the publisher

name: Futmes
description:
FUTMES is The Most Ruthless Fútbol Board Game Ever. In this game you can live the experience of a soccer match full of unexpected events.

Your team will consist of one Coach, one Captain, three Football Players and one Stadium where you will play your home matches.
Use your cards and your strategic skills to defeat other teams and win the FUTMES LEAGUE.
Always pay attention to the skills of your team members, they could be the difference between a win and a defeat

In FUTMES the resources are called EVENT CARDS and are useful for controlling the unexpected events of the game.

Anything can happen during a FUTMES match flipping the CHANCE CARDS and find out if your goal was successful.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Finale Ending, Interrupts, Race

name: Gyojin Fighter Sushido
description:
The mist of a spring morning… a gentle wind carries cherry blossom petals, a stream whispers in the undergrowth, and suddenly, the birds fall silent. Two silhouettes face each other and exchange a long look. Then, they leap forward, ready to have their blades sing at the pace of the war drums. A brutal fight starts in the Arena: it can only end in a knockout.

Gyojin Fighter Sushido is a 2-player game that was inspired by the best 1v1 fighting video games, where characters fight each other in a merciless duel. Create Katas and Combos to deliver powerful hits using your Action Cards, preserve your Health Points, and knock out your opponent to become the Winner of the Arena!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Memory, Real-time
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Smart10: Tiede
description: 50 new cards with 100 new science related questions. Requires the base game for play.

name: The Forgotten Kingdom
description:
This is an adventure game, where the heroes are wandering around the Kingdom and facing challenges. They receive victory points for solving problems and dealing with monsters. Every completed challenge releases a memory piece from the Mine of Memories and helps the heroes to restore the forgotten Kingdom. The revealed memories reduce the difficulty of further challenges and earn extra victory points for the heroes.

The heroes’ task to get all the memories back from the mine and assemble the forgotten cities on the board to break the evil spell. Players do this by moving up to 3 spaces on the hexagon grid during their turn and either resolving tile events by playing their cards or placing their Memory Tiles to gain points. The player who has the most points at the end of the game is the ruler of the Kingdom and wins the crown.

name: Area 52
description:
As the commander of the Frontline Alien Resistance Team, you must manage a squad of elite soldiers to fight off a wave of invading aliens. After the first wave, the aliens will attack again with deadlier force - you win if you are able to repel both waves without running out of resources. Having a good variety and spread of defenders is critical to efficiently counter the invaders.

The game is heavily reliant on luck. Despite this, there’s still an undercurrent of subtle strategy, related to concepts of probability and mathematical parity.

Area 52 is a solo tower-defense game played with a deck of regular playing cards, inspired by games such as Button Men and Onslaught. The rules were created by Wil Su and made available free online as part of his "Isaludo" series.
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Siege of Mantua
description:
Two armies march to the relief of the fortress and its exhausted garrison. One from the East, and one from the North, converging on the outnumbered enemy. That enemy was the Army of Italy, the first field command of Napoleon Bonaparte. The fifteen days that followed would make him a legend.

Taking as its subject Bonaparte's famous Arcole campaign, Siege of Mantua is a game of operational maneuver and tactical daring. Players move blocks on the mapsheet to threaten and deceive their opponent, with the object of bringing them to a decisive battle. These are fought on a battle display with counters drawn randomly from your unit pool. The quality of your pool improves with every victory; suffering losses will damage morale, degrading unit quality.

You must master both of these spheres if you wish to be victorious. Though outnumbered, the French player has the benefit of moving along interior lines, allowing greater coordination of forces. But those men are stretched thin to deal with two distinct lines of enemy advance. The Austrian player can use this to their advantage, bringing superior forces to bear at weak points in the enemy line. What results is a desperate battle of wits and nerve, and a novel take on the "block game" genre.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Escape Game: Die Pyramide des Pharao
description: A game with cards and many puzzles waiting to be solved so that the pyramid can be left - just like in a real Escape Room! A journey through history; full of puzzles that help develop logical skills, mathematical thinking, observation skills and language. The cards hide useful clues to continue the adventure and exit the pyramid. The game includes a set of puzzle cards, a game board and useful items to find the clues.

name: I Need You So Much Closer
description:
Designed for a game design jam, I Need You So Much Closer (INYSMC) is a roll & write game to be printed at US letter size.

You will drive aimlessly for as long as you can, using dice to determine the shapes of your path that you draw on the map, while listening to Transatlanticism by Death Cab For Cutie, a list of songs and corresponding numbers that you’ll use dice to trigger and use their special abilities.

This game can be played with any number of players, each of whom would need their own sheet. Each player will also need 3 six-sided dice and something to write with.

name: Sanrio Characters Speedwolf
description: Speedwolf is a fast-paced party card game that gets everyone excited quickly. Hello Kitty, My Melody, Cinnamoroll, and Pochacco are all appearing and disappearing in this game. Look for the cards that have increased, or decreased, in number, and call out the characters’ names before anyone else!

name: Card Maze
description:
In Card Maze, you use a standard card deck to set up a randomly generated maze.

Moving around the maze you gradually strengthen your personal deck by attacking point cards.

Once your deck is powerful enough you can battle the formidable facecards in the maze.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Magic Forest
description:
The Magic Forest needs you!

The naughty trolls have mixed up the crystals that protect the magic forest. You and the other players must take them where they belong. Be careful – the trolls will try to get in your way, so pick your route carefully. The player, who rescues all three of their crystals first, wins the game!

–description from publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Race

name: Heist: Masterminds
description:
Your rivals issued a challenge: who among you is the biggest name in international thievery? You have to gather a crew, get moving, and make a name for yourself. Keep in mind: “Honor among thieves” is really more of a suggestion.

In this fast-paced card game from Nerdhaus Games, players live out their heist movie fantasies. Colorful characters meet improbable complications on the way to glory and riches (or serious jail time). On your turn, you'll decide to gather resources, do some legwork on a potential job, or brave the risks and claim one of these rare treasures for yourself!
