Sometimes the calculator serves as a dice-alternative for producing random numbers (selected digits are read from the display), other times it just handles manipulating large numbers

The bulk of the book consists of perforated pages to tear out and use to record gameplay progress.

Part of a series of five paper-and-pencil game books by Sid Sackson, including Beyond Competition, Beyond Solitaire, Games of Art, Beyond Words, and Calculate!.

name: Assaut sur Malème
description:
(translated from Vae Victis "Hors-série" #10:)

Assaut sur Maleme (Assault on Maleme) simulates combats for Maleme airfield in Creta from May 20th to May 23rd 1941. [...]
The map represents the zone on which took place first four days combat between German Sturm regiment and 5th New-Zealand brigade.


Small game (60 counters, 4 pages rules), easy for beginner.

name: First Wave at Omaha
description:
ASLComp First Wave at Omaha brings the fury of Bloody Omaha to the ASLComp players in the most massive historical module yet published. This game is a historical module for the Advanced Squad Leader system. It has three linking maps recreate Omaha West and portions of Omaha East with six feet of running map length. Every detail is there, and all of the Vierville and Les Moulins draws, scenes of the hardest fighting in Normandy and the setting for the opening scene of Saving Private Ryan, are included.

The 'three story house', Norman 'Dutch' Cota, wave after wave of landing craft, laden with American soldiers headed for their doom...or the first step in freeing Hitler's Fortress Europa.

The packet will contain mostly enough counters to play the module with player providing fortification counters, US & German concealment counters and possibly some information counters.

ASLComp First Wave at Omaha contains:

* 15 action-packed scenarios
* 1 monster campaign style scenario that depicts the entire landing and battle inland
* 3 linking color maps
* 8 page variant Special Rules booklet
* 10 116th Regimental Combat Team Landing Play Aids
* 4 German Resistance Nest Play Aids
* 2 Destroyer Cards
* 6 sheets of color die cut counter
* Color Cover sheet
* Backsheet
* Ziploc® style baggie to hold it all in
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: CMYK!
description:
You are a mosaic tile craftsman. Many triangular tiles should be painted pure white, but they has been painted apart colors by mistakes! You can not make it in time for the delivery date if you order again. Arrange the tiles to satisfy the client!

CMYK! is a real-time action game in which all players connect colorful triangular tiles at the same time. You can attach the same mark of the same color written on each side of the triangular tile. Then you earn points by making a hexagon or achieving the objective stated on the objective cards.

—description from designer

name: One Piece: Pour une poignée de berrys
description:
The most famous characters of the manga clash in this One Piece game!

Luffy and his friends have set themselves a challenge: collect as many Berrys as possible. For this they are ready to do anything in this beautiful board game One Piece!

The goal of the game? To collect as many Berrys as possible in order to reach first the objective received at the beginning of the game. To do this, each player will have to use their ACTION cards and foil their opponents' attacks. He will also be able to recover the treasures collected by his opponents. Beware, the powers of the characters will make the game full of twists and turns!

And to prolong the adventure, Obyz has created the One Piece For a Fistful of Berrys expansion!

name: Reign of Nations
description: A new epic board game of planetary dominiation awaits. The time has come Traveler.  Command vast legions led by mighty warlords and ultimately summon your guardian to reign over all other nations.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: JunKing: Mini Expansion
description:
This expansion introduces the 'Collection' variant and includes 12 new cards and artwork.

COLLECTION VARIANT:

Each Collections set is in pairs. At the beginning of a game, you shuffle the Collections deck and then deal out all of the cards evenly to each player. You keep your collection secret from all other players. At the end of a turn that you did NOT add cards to your Hoard you may 'Trade' with another player like so:

- Choose one of your own collection cards and set it aside.
- Choose a player and draw one of their collection cards at random, adding it to your collection.
- Give that player the collection card you set aside.

When The Crown is drawn to end the game everyone turns over all of their collection cards. For each pair that a player has they are awarded 3 additional points.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Sentinel Tactics: Freedom Tower
description: This is a poster map and scenario for Sentinel Tactics based on the Freedom Tower environment from Sentinels of the Multiverse.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Greater Than Games, LLC, Living Worlds Games

name: BattleTech Combat Book Expansion: Urban Terrain Cards
description: This is an Urban Terrain Card set used with the Battletech Combat Books by Nova. Each time a player makes a maneuver that changes range, that player draws a new, random, terrain card. The terrain cards are used to change the amount of damage a Mech may take, the amount of heat generated, or the maneuvers that the Mech may choose. There are 64 cards in this set and the terrains included are:Open Terrain, Parking Lot, City Park, Power Substation, Fuel Tanks, Rivers & Canals, Wood Buildings, Light Rubble, Heavy Rubble, Narrow Streets, Brick Buildings, and Concrete & Steel.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Tracks to Titicaca
description:
From the box: Tenacious rail barons contend with civil disorder, internecine wars and each other in their drive to reach the rich mines of the high Andes of South America.

Tracks to Titicaca is a cousin of Tracks to Telluride, in which players strive to develop the best railroad networks in order to access the most profitable mines in the region. Each turn, players acquire mines and build tracks to connect those mines. After a set number of turns or when someone reaches remote Sucre, Bolivia with a rail line, the winner is the player with the highest total mine revenue.

Crayon rail game with lower production values than most 'German games.' Note that for the year (1996) and the publisher (Winsome Games) who is known primarily for desktop published games, comparing this game to later games of a different genre isn't very helpful. This game is clearly a "gamer's game" with game play emphasized over production values. It is relatively difficult to find a copy, and the publisher is also known for small-batch releases with minimal reprinting.

name: The Peiper Dream
description:
From the Introduction:

Players can link all four of the Peiper Pocket Battle Games to form The Peiper Dream and play a "Grand" (using the term very loosely here!) Campaign that simulates the entire series of battles with KG Peiper during the Ardennes Offensive. The Campaign Game will also require the use of one six-sided die (not included) to adjudicate certain game outcomes. There can be up to 20 turns (run through the card deck up to 20 times) in the Campaign Game.

Contents:


Campaign Game and Optional Rules
Game Turn Record Track
Sheet of 40 die-cut counters
Paying the Peiper
A Dash of Peiper
The Bagged Peiper
Just a Peiper Dream?


See the Web Links below for a download of the rules and Turn Record Track.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Rivet Wars: Atomic Robo
description:
Description from the back of the box:
Atomic Robo is a being from another place. He was inadvertently pulled into the world of Rivet when a Blight experiment using unknown energies grew out of control. Now Atomic Robo fights with the allies to defeat the oppressive Blight, but he is always searching for a way back to his own world, where he is also needed to fight tyranny.

This was a KS Exclusive figure for Rivet Wars.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Redcap Ruckus
description:
Command a gang of Redcaps to control the mushroom top and capture the Great Crystal! Strategically slide your Redcaps onto the mushroom top. Push your enemies over the edge to capture them! Be careful: Don’t push off your own Redcaps! When the Great Crystal falls, the fight’s over! Score points for your captured redcaps. Score bonus points if you knocked off the Great Crystal! If you can live on the edge, you’ll be the Mushroom Monarch!

In Redcap Ruckus, you command a horde of Gnomes (known as Redcaps in English folklore) fighting to control the Mushroom Top Battlefield & capture the Great Crystal. Yet the Mushroom is a deadly and dangerous zone. Smoothly slide your Gnomes on to push enemy Gnomes off. When the Great Crystal falls, tally the dead & proclaim the Mushroom Monarch.

—description from the publisher

name: Für die Katz
description:
Für die Katz is the cooperative children’s game, in which animal voices make a path audible that cannot be seen.
Together the players bring cats from the forest back into their baskets. But in the forest it is dark. Blindfolded, one player always guides his walking stick through the impassable terrain. The other players guide it to where the cats have lost their way. Good listening is required: From which direction is the dog barking? Is a goat bleating? And where does the eagle owl point the way? All cats can be rescued and falling branches can be avoided by attentive cooperation.

—description from the publisher

name: Sleepwalkers: Imperial Rivalries and the Great War
description:
„All nations want peace, but they want a peace that suits them.“ (Admiral „Jackie“ Fisher)

The outbreak of the First World War, often called „the seminal catastrophe of the 20th century”, is one of the most controversial topics in human history. Many Europeans had condoned war, but hardly anyone could have wanted the unprecedented slaughter that began in 1914. Why did it happen? How could it happen?

Sleepwalkers is a simulation game about diplomacy at the brink of war, covering approximately the period between 1900 and 1918. Players represent the governments of the major powers Austria-Hungary, Britain, France, Germany and Russia. Vying for prestige, they impose tariffs, arm, expand and forge alliances. Random events such as the Dreyfus Affair, the Boer War, the Berlin-Baghdad Railway, the Russo-Japanese War and the Black Hand add to the tensions. Crises are sure to erupt, forcing each player to decide whether to mediate or to mobilize. Can you avoid war, while striving for a peace that suits you?

Players: 1-5 (best with 3-5)
Complexity: low
Components: 8-page rules booklet, 12"x16" map, 55 die-cut counters. You also need 1 six-sided die and an opaque container like a mug which are not provided with the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Negotiation, Political, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action/Event, Alliances, Betting and Bluffing, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Negotiation, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simulation, Sudden Death Ending, Turn Order: Random

name: Salty Dogs
description:
From the mighty Simon Bisley and Berserker Arts, Salty Dogs is a devious 2-4 player "take that" style card game for ages 8+, consisting of 90+ superbly drawn cards and 4 play mats.
A great, easy to pick up, gateway game that is guaranteed to spice up any tabletop night.
Man your animal pirate crew with such greats as Elon Tusk, Hugh Jackelman , Arnold Barbirdian, Abraham Inkoln and Duck Norris. Keep a watchful eye out for illnesses, like the Black Spot and Scurvy. Force your enemies to Walk the Plank, take part in a Mutiny or sneak a pesky Stowaway onto your enemies poop deck. Defend your crew with some mouse Earplugs or a Rubber Dinghy and whatever you do, always be in fear of the mighty unstoppable Kraken!!

—description from the publisher

name: Knights of the Dinner Table: Orcs – The Reckoning
description:
This expansion adds new cards for ORCS AT THE GATES covering issues 24-34 of the Knights of the Dinner Table comic book. In addition, somewhere (we think it was Timmy Jackson) somehow, Hard Eight Enterprises got the great idea that orcs should be armed with guns.

Expands

Knights of the Dinner Table: Orcs at the Gates
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Sipario!
description:
Sipario! is a card and strategy game set in the glittering world of opera.

Get ready to stage the most dazzling and prestigious opera season
ever! To achieve this, you will have to engage the most
renowned singers, put up with Prime donne, tantrums, invest
in the best advertising, hire paparazzi, pay the claque, and most
importantly throw spanners in the works of competing theater
managers. After you receive the titles of the three operas you
are going to stage, start opposing anyone who tries to stop you
from conquering the Hall of Fame!
Sipario! is a card and strategy game for 2-5 players, where each
player thinks of ways to outsmart their opponents and at the
same time advance their own plans. The only thing you should
NOT have, to be the best in the business, is scruples…
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Music
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Ninja All-Stars: Clan Ika
description:
Description from the publisher:

In a land where paranoia and insularism are a way of life, the Ika are famous for being even more secretive, cryptic, and distrustful of outsiders than usual. Ika stick to their own families and clan, only taking part in the larger politics and power struggles of Kagejima based on mysterious criteria known only to themselves.

For all these dour stereotypes the Ika are warm and fearsomely protective once their trust has been gained. The ire of the Ika is like the sea, ponderous, but not to be trifled with. They are also renowned throughout the Kingdom of the Moon for brewing the most potent and delicious Sake. Many shinobi claim this powerful drink makes them better fighters.

name: Entropy: Worlds Collide – Echo of Time
description: A thematic expansion for Entropy: Worlds Collide providing a lore-expanding story, game-expanding cards, a 1 vs many game mode, new Wanderer character, support up to 5 players, and more.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Spirot
description:
Players in Spirot play pixellated cards from their hands in order to create sequences of three cards that have the same color (or all different colors) as well as the same pixel pattern (or all different pixel patterns).

To set up, place the nine board cards in a 3x3 grid, shuffle the spirot cards, and deal six cards to each player. Reveal spirot cards from the top of the deck until you find a matching image card that can cover each of the four corners of the board card. Each spirot card has one of the nine images on the board cards, with this image in one of three colors and one of three pixel patterns.

On a turn, place a spirot card from your hand onto a board card. If you create a sequence, you score one point, then take another turn. If you don't create a sequence, your turn ends. At the end of your turn, refill your hand to six cards.

Once someone has five points, complete the round so that everyone has had the same number of turns. Whoever has the most points wins!

name: You Think You Know Me
description:
You know your friends through the photos, videos, and messages they post online, liking and favoriting them every day. But how well do you know them, really?

You Think You Know Me playfully tests how well you know your friends, giving you a chance to learn more about what they love and who they are. Each player starts with seven cards in hand, cards that say things like "I know that your secret talent is ________" or "I know that you would/wouldn't want to live forever." On a turn, you pick another player, play a card from hand, and say how you think they would answer the question. If you're right, you discard the card; if not, you have to draw a new card and add it to your hand. Whoever first discards all their cards wins.

name: Pingi Pongo
description:
Each player plays with a 3-headed penguin-family.
The penguins are on their way to the south pole. They jump from one clod to another and need to take care that they preferably land on one that isn`t crumbly.
Sometimes they can also take the faster way through the waterr, but only, when the orca is not around. As the orca lurks on the way of the penguins and always appears at a different place.
Whose penguin family reaches the South Pole first, wins the game.
Dice-racing game with nice tactical flips for the little ones and very cute material and art-work.

name: Pleasant Prospect Farm
description:
Pleasant Prospect Farm is yours! Will you keep animals, which are valuable but require a fenced paddock? Will you grow crops? Or diversify and offer camping facilities? Finally, a tractor will be a great help with ploughing and harvesting, but if you have campers they may not like the noisy machinery!

A card draft takes places where, each turn, players draw a card, play one card face up and one face down, then pass on the remainder. When seven cards have been played, they are scored. Animal cards give a higher score then crops, but only if they are combined with a paddock card. The score for tents is dependent on the size of the set. The tractor card increases the score for cereal and vegetable cards but reduces the score for tents.

Designed for the 2014 Microgame Print and Play Contest.

name: Munchkin Edycja Rozszerzona
description:
Munchkin Edycja Rozszerzona which means Munchkin Extended Edition is a Polish version that contains Munchkin and Fairy Dust expansion. Other than that nothing was changed.

Go down in the dungeon. Kill everything you meet. Backstab your friends and steal their stuff. Grab the treasure and run.

Admit it. You love it.

This award-winning card game, designed by Steve Jackson, captures the essence of the dungeon experience... with none of that stupid roleplaying stuff. You and your friends compete to kill monsters and grab magic items. And what magic items! Don the Horny Helmet and the Boots of Butt-Kicking. Wield the Staff of Napalm... or maybe the Chainsaw of Bloody Dismemberment. Start by slaughtering the Potted Plant and the Drooling Slime, and work your way up to the Plutonium Dragon...

And it's illustrated by John Kovalic! Fast-playing and silly, Munchkin can reduce any roleplaying group to hysteria. And, while they're laughing, you can steal their stuff.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Candy Islands
description: Candy Islands is a simultaneous bidding game in which you're competing against your right- and left-hand neighbors in candy-based bids to claim point cards and win special treasures with unique powers.
mechanics: Auction: Multiple Lot, Auction: Sealed Bid
publishers: Hachette Boardgames UK, Studio H, 拾刻桌游（O'Clock Games）

name: Panzer PaK 6: France 1940
description:
This is the sixth supplement to the excellent Panzer miniatures rules. The set contains the French orders of battle and 24 data cards for the campaign in France in 1940. There are six new scenarios, 4 for two players and 2 large historical scenarios for multiple players in the Pak.

Also included is a set of new optional rules, some of which are used to represent the hull mounted guns on some of the French tanks and new hull down options. Most of the new optional rules can be used for the entire Panzer series.

Valuable to all miniatures gamers for the TO&E's alone, this new product is a great addition for the Panzer rule set.

Panzer PaK 6 is an expansion to Panzer Miniatures Rules: A Tactical Game of Armored Combat.

Included Components:


40-page, full-color illustrated booklet



Scenarios: Six historical scenarios focusing on the French and German clashes in the opening stages of the war in the West including one scenario that may be split into two smaller battles.



Detailed French Army TO&E: General organizations in 1940 — Mechanized Light Division, Armored Division, Cavalry Light Division, Motorized Infantry Division and Infantry Division to the individual vehicle, gun and squad level



Optional Rules: Limited Hull Down, Hidden movement rules, Cavalry, Tank Fright, Infantry Smoke, Vehicle Collateral Damage, Weapon Malfunction, Crawling plus a handy reference table for AP/GP Overwatch Modifiers



Unit Data Cards: 24 new unit data cards



Hidden Movement Cards: Two hidden movement play cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Space Freaks: Prophecy – The 19th Head Promo Card
description:
The 19th Head: Prophecy has a once per round ability. It allows the player to look at the next two Arena Master cards and lets them put the cards back in any order.

The promo card was available at Spiel '17 in Essen.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Clinic Expansion: Medical Dossier 4
description:
This Medical Dossier 4 has been designed for the fans who love the 1st Edition of Clinic and still want to complete the collection of extensions.

It is packed in the same beige Dossier than the other Medical Dossier #1, #2, and #3.

It contains:

- All Stretch goals unlocked during the Clinic Deluxe Edition campaign (4 Workaholic purple Doctors, 8 Blood rectangles, and 8 Red Cylinders for the extinguishers, and 8 lime green Zombies).

- All the components of the Clinic Deluxe Extension 4, released for the Essen fair 20:
4 Basement player boards printed both side with the old illustrations from Sampo Sikïo
9 Double tiles with the old illustrations from Sampo Sikïo
A set of English rules.
This set is only compatible with the 1st edition of Clinic released in 2014 (tiles size, components illustrations, commun boards and player boards). You need to have Clinic 1st Edition.

You need to have Clinic 1st Edition.

Limited to 100 copies.
categories: City Building, Educational, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Pattern Building, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Mimic Octopus: Flirt Edition
description:
Lead the most crazy talk of your life – and enchant each other with desperate urge for making a move, soppy romance and erotic moments you would actually rather like to do without.

ABSURD SMALLTALK - Make extremely fun conversations with multiple conversation topics per round - at the same time! Score points through thoughtful listening and creative communication

HIDDEN IDENTITY - Play with hidden roles and secret missions that you don't know at the beginning of the round. Even about your own role you first have to find out due to detective sense.

COOPERATION OR BLUFF - If you have pulled the same conversation card, you play in the team and need to find each other. As Mimic Octopus you lie and manipulate in order to secretly sneak into a team and steal points.

Card game without plastic - all films are biodegradable. Board game with 110 cards for 4-8 people, from 12 years, playing time approx. 30 minutes. Can be combined with all Mimic Octopus editions.

name: Roll and Rails
description:
Roll and Rails is a roll&write game.
In Roll and Rails players take the roles of railway entrepreneurs. Each player develops their own network of railway connections to transport as many goods possible, to earn the most money and glory. Investing in your rolling stock and carefully choosing the path for your iron trail will bring you funds for further expansions, and precious victory points.
The game is played in rounds. Each round players draft dice values to perform actions. Players build their railway network, invest in their rolling stock using resources gained. Next, they try to ship the goods to gain victory points and funds for further development.
The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: The West Point Story
description:
OBJECT OF THE GAME
Enter the United States Military Academy at West Point as a plebe and be promoted, when a 1st classman, to the rank of Brigade Commander. To advance to Brigade Commander player must be promoted in grade from plebe to 1st classman by the achievement of scholastic points, and be promoted in rank from Corporal to Brigade Commander by accumulation of points and use of the Promotion Spinner. First player to accumulate 150 points in Scholastics, 50 points in Tactics, 50 points in Sports, 50 points in Popularity - and achieve promotion to Brigade Commander -- WINS THE GAME!

GAME COMPONENTS
4 Plastic Markers in 4 different colors
1 Plastic Dice Cup
2 Wooden Dice
1 Promotion Spinner
35 West Point Activity Cards
21 Cadet Insignia
4 West Point Score Cards
20 Fasteners

GAME PLAY
Players move around the board following the arrows the full number thrown on the dice. Each time a player lands on a "square" by direct count, they score the plus (+) or minus (-) number of points in the category indicated on the "square".

Points allow for promotion. There are "Activity Cards", demerits and more.

Concentrate at first on accumulating both Scholastic points and Tactic points as these points are initially valuable in achieving promotion in grade and rank. Afterwards points in Sports and Popularity become necessary for further promotion in rank.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Dillinger: The Mid-West Crime Wave, 1931-1934
description:
The Midwest Crime Wave; 1931 - 1934

DILLINGER is for 3 to 6 players and, although it uses the actual participants and history of the era in some detail, the game is not a historical recreation. It has been designed, and play tested to a virtual fare-thee-well, to bring about 2 to 3 hours of continual fun for the players. All players are involved in every player's turn, so there is no "down time." In essence, while one player is robbing a bank, the others become the Law Enforcement aspect of the game, trying to stop him with roadblocks, tear gas, gun molls, tommy guns, and whatever else they can throw in his path.

If the Bad Guy (there are 20 historical "Bad Guys" from Dillinger, to Jelly Nash, Pretty Boy Floyd, Baby Face Nelson, the incredible Barkers, the inept Kelly's, and the truly creepy Alvin Karpis, all rated for a variety of capabilities) succeeds he not only pockets the take, but he gains Notoriety. And accumulating Notoriety is what the players are doing to win. Obviously a successful kidnapping (a rare event) will bring loads of Points, but convicting another Bad Guy with your in-house mouthpiece (again, real-life lawyers, from the great trial attorney, Sam Leibowitz to the down-and-dirty Louis Piquett) can also get you some Notoriety. Opportunities to amass points are ubiquitous, and winning games usually comes right down to the end.

Each game of DILLINGER includes 1 Rules Folder, 1 Background information Folder, 110 Player Cards, 5 Location Mats, lots of Funny Money, and one small sheet of Mike Lemick colorful cut-and-paste counters.

name: Chercles
description:
The game of Circular checkers (hence the name).

The board is laid out as a series of intersecting circular paths. The playing pieces are silly-looking ogres called "Cherks". Players alternate moving a Cherk one space forward along the one-way arrows printed on the paths. Pieces are captured in direct chess-fashion rather than by checker-style jumping. If a capture is possible, it must be performed, sometimes resulting in two or more captures in one turn if capturing one piece places the Cherk next to another piece. There is no last-rank promotion.

The player who succeeds in capturing all of his opponents Cherks wins.

Note: Parker Brothers published a companion game called All The King's Men. The Cherk Pieces of this game were also used in Smess as Pawn-variants called Ninnies.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Static Capture

name: À qui le tour ?
description:
A cycle racing game inspired by the Tour de France. Each player runs a team of 4, 5 or 6 racers, teamwork between the racers helps to improve the position of the team's racers through slip-streaming.
There are four short stages and 2 long (mountain) stages to the full race, but a lesser number could be raced over. There are 34 (green) random movement (& event) cards: nine '1's, 13 '2's , nine '3's and one '4', a hunger/fall card and a weakness/blackout card. Each player also holds a pack of 9 yellow cards. one '+5', one '+3' one '+2' three '+1's, a spare wheel, a food musette (musette = In cycling, a bag containing food handed out in a feed zone of a multi-stage race such as the Tour de France) , and a 'Baraka'. (which means good luck in French slang.) On their turn the active player draws a random card for each of their racers, and if desired adds one of their yellow cards. Yellow cards are discarded for the stage after play.
If a racer ends his move with one space between him and the player of his team ahead of him, then he can slip-stream into the space provided it is not filled by racers of other teams. A racer can also slipstream another team's racer if there is a completely empty road space between them. Roads are 4, 3 or two riders wide, depending upon the terrain.
The winner can be decided by shortest number of turns taken to complete the course, or by placing in the finishing order of each stage - (better to agree this in advance). The short stages can take between 30 and 60 minutes, and the long stages 60 to 90. A lot depends upon the number of players, and of racers per team. If the whole race is to be run is would be best to spell it over a weekend with some other games filling between stages.

name: Bases Loaded Baseball
description:
Bases Loaded Baseball is a game from the APBA genre of table top, dice rolling, statistically accurate sports games. The benefit of playing this game was that it was less costly than it's bigger named brothers and sisters in the genre. Problems with this game include rules that were lengthly and sometimes convoluted, game actions that seem to require two players (base stealing) and in some cases many, many die rolls to resolve a particular play. I have the 1961 season. It features every player that had 30 at bats or 10 innings pitched, so as far as having completeness of each team, the game excelled.

But having to roll the dice to check if the batter was HBP, or walked then roll the dice again to see is there was a hit, then again to see if it was a single , double, triple or home run, then roll the dice to see what field the ball went to, which fielder caught it, whether or not the fielder committed an error, roll the die to see if the pitcher holds the runner, roll the die to see if the 2nd baseman was able to turn the double play, roll the dice.......well you get the idea. The designer states "....There are some plays which require a lot of die rolls, but as you play the game you will realize an increase of play time and these extra rolls make the game realistic."

name: Die-Check
description:
Cubulus / Die-Check is similar to chess on a 9x9 board except that for pieces each player has eight strategic cubes (dice), two shields (unmarked pieces the size of two cubes) and a master (king). The game ends with a checkmate.

The strategic cubes move the number of squares shown on their top face, and each step of the move rolls the die to its adjacent face (thus the new top side is determined be the sequence of horizontal and vertical steps). Shields move so that one of their two covered squares stays the same. The master moves one spot orthogonally. (Additional moves for shields and strategic cubes exist in the advanced version.)

Captures are made by moving onto other pieces, except that shields require one half to be put in check and the other half to be moved onto. If the master moves to the far end of the board it can be returned to its original position and replaced with a captured piece.

name: Netzwerk
description: This is played on a 6 x 6 square grid with circles on the corners. Each player has six pieces that play in the squares. There are also several "energy" pieces that are on the circles (like pieces in Go). Each players pieces cannot move unless they have access to an energy stone. The object of the game is to get half of your remaining pieces across the board.

name: La Route des Indes
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #15

Players travel from Istanbul to Delhi with 300$ in their pockets, trying to accumulate as many souvenirs as possible.

name: Caesar
description:
[From the manual]

A module for Ancient Empires.

"Veni, Vidi, Vici." - I came, I saw, I conquered.

With those three words Caesar declared himself ruler of the ancient world. Now you can replay his great battles with "Caesar - The Wars of Julius Caesar". Inside this module for 'Ancient Empires' are such diverse elements as Caesar's campaigns in Gaul, Germany, and Britain, the Second Roman Civil War, the African and Spanish War, the Roman and Parthian campaigns, and much more.

'Ancient Empires' has quickly become the standard by which all other rule systems for miniatures has been measured. Combining ease of play with careful attention to historical detail, the discerning gamer is able to accurately recreate the wars of antiquity.

CONTENTS

- Over forty pages of rules and scenarios, spanning from the earliest part of Caesar's rule to the end.

- Easy to use charts and tables listing over twenty different troop types, including historical leader ratings.

- Background and history of the wars and times.

Expands:

Ancient Empires: A Simulation of the Wars of Antiquity
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Flitzpuck
description:
A wooden dexterity game that is a German variation on Sjoelen. Each player has six wooden pucks in their color. The object of the game is to use the elastic band on your side of the game to fire pucks through the hole and onto your opponent's side of the game. The first player to clear their side of the board of pucks wins, or alternatively, the first player to get their six pucks over to the other side wins.

This game is very similar to Le Passe-Trappe.

name: Piquet:  Theater of War
description:
Theater of War generates linked, tactical tabletop games in a larger strategic setting. Theater of War is designed to be used with miniature collections of existing, fixed sizes (no more collecting and painting forces for the next game just in order to meet the order of battle requirements!) while providing an entertaining background for a campaign with a definitive conclusion. Theater of War provides a system for determining tactical scenarios, based on decisions made by the campaign players. Theater of War includes rules for organizing campaigns in all of the periods covered by the Piquet rule system.

Theater of War vividly represents the fog and friction of war, modeled by sequence decks and initiative rolls. Battle Hands made up of Sequence cards are used to move from the campaign map to the tabletop. Battle hands determine what type of tabletop battle will be fought, as well as any particular advantages (relative army sizes, terrain, set-up) that will exist. This combination and interplay of Battle Hands is the heart and soul of Theatre of War. It allows a campaign to be fought without an umpire making rulings about force strengths and scenario definition, as well as providing for pre-battle maneuvering as both sides attempt to gain an advantage. Theatre of War places the gamer in the predicament of not knowing for sure what the tabletop game will hold - that is, not knowing until they've committed and played their cards!

Theatre of War is designed to provide a campaign framework for Piquet tabletop miniature games. In order to play Theatre of War, both the Piquet master rules and the period supplement in which the campaign is set are required.

Expands:

Piquet: Master Rules for Wargaming

name: Glücksferkel
description:
Each player's piglet goes about collecting clovers. After each roll, the player must decide whether to keep seeking clovers, or run back to stow the clovers in her wheelbarrow, so the other players can't filch them. The player who secures the most points in clovers wins.

Ages 5 and up.

HABA 4176

name: Tactics
description:
From the box cover: "The new, realistic land army war game! Designed and perfected by an infantry officer... A war game with the professional touch... Actual principles of war apply... A real mental exercise... An excellent gift for the 'Chess and Checkers' type"

Tactics is a landmark game in that it was the first cardboard-counter commercial board wargame that was intended (albeit with limited success) to accurately simulate warfare and command.

The game was self-published by Maryland National Guard infantryman Charles S. Roberts, who would go on to found of Avalon Hill Games. The original edition of Tactics was published by the Avalon Game company, with a print run of approximately 2000. Roberts sold Tactics by mail order out of a garage in Avalon, Maryland.

The game portrayed a modern day strategic conflict between the forces of two hypothetical countries. The opposing units included infantry, armor, and airborne forces. The game was played on a mapboard which used a square grid rather than the hex-based style map which would later became preferred in the board wargaming industry. However, many of the conventions and mechanics established in Tactics still live on, in one form or another, in many of the wargames published today.

Based on his success with Tactics, Roberts decided to expand his operation and in 1958 he formed Avalon Hill Games. The initial line-up of games from Avalon Hill included Tactics II, a revised version of Roberts' original wargame. Avalon Hill would go on to publish a 25th Anniversary edition of Tactics in 1983, which represented a modified version of the original game in that it used a prototype mapboard which had not previously been released.

Other than a few graphical changes there are some functional changes from the Tactics map to the Tactics II map:

Going over the 1954 Tactics and 1958 Tactics II boards square by square the only functional changes are:
- The squares around the edge of the map for 1958 now have numbers 1 to 43 from North to South and 1 to 55 West to East.
- Cities for 1958 had unique numbers added.
No numbers are present on the 1954 board in the cities or the grid.
- There is no map compass on the mapboard label like there is in Tactics II
- The mountain pass in the large mountain range on the board label edge is not present on the 1954 map. Also there is only one single clear square, same place as in Tactics II, 7 squares in from the Blue coastal city near the map label in that mountain range. There are none of those longer dead end corridors in the big mountain range like on the Tactics II map.

Re-implemented by:

Tactics II
Tactics (25th Anniversary Edition) (25th Anniversary Edition)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Run For President
description:
The basic rules for playing Run For President are simple:

1. Starting with four random state cards each, the players take turns asking another player for a state touching (geographically) one they are holding. If they get the card they get to keep asking. If not, they draw the top state from the deck.

2. When a player gets four states that are connected geographically, he or she puts the cards down and those electoral votes are theirs. The player claims the votes by taking the states from the puzzle board.

The game continues until all the states are won. The player with the most electoral votes is the winner.

name: Pacific Origins
description:
Pacfic Origins is a variant/expansion for The Origins of World War II. The game is set in Asia and can be played independently or at the same time as Origins of World War II.

The game was published in The General Vol.13,No.5 magazine (Jan-Feb 1977).

The magazine included a map and counters for the Japanese and Chinese players. You would still need a copy of Origins of World War II so as to be able to use their counters for the US, British, French and Soviet players.

Expands:

Origins of World War II
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Political, Wargame, World War II

name: Noir
description:
"Tell your own stories of crime in the big city." A card game inspired by the film Noir genre.

The players share a common custom deck of cards that contains six suits: Atmosphere, Locations, Help, Hindrances, Witnesses, and Clues. Each card is named after something reminiscent of the elements of film Noir movies from the forties and fifties. There are twenty cards in each suit for a total of 120 cards in the deck.

The rules call for "the meanest player" to start the game. The players seek to play six card combos (a "storyline") containing one card from each suit in the deck. The game ends when the deck has been exhausted. The player who played the most combos wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery

name: My Band
description:
Battle your friends to see who can put together the most compatible band members, managers, promoters, agents and more. It's always been a dream to organize that band... so let's do it!

Use your band's influence to build your popularity or use it to effect your opponents.

Spend a night building your perfect band!

Game contents; 1 Game Board, 40 Band member cards, 40 Event cards, 20 Business cards, 4 Band Contracts, 1 Popularity Bid Card, 1 Starting player token, 16 page Rules book, 100+ influence chips and 4 game pawns.

name: Manimals: Stuttgarter Wilhelma 1
description:
Zoo-Edition

Manimals - Stuttgarter Wilhelma 1 is a beautiful animal game that is also well-suited for learning in the classroom or for use in homes. Through the game, players learn the attributes of animals.

In the zoo, Sarah and Dinah are standing in awe in front of the sea lions: There is one with feathers on his back! "Does a sea lion have feathers like a bird or fur like a dog?" Suddenly someone claps their hands and the ducks which were hidden behind the sea lion fly off in a flutter. Who knows their animals the best?

Includes rules forAges 4 and up, as well.

This edition feature animals which you can find in the Stuttgart Zoo, called Wilhelma. Additionally there are icons for the international breeding program the zoo is participating.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Real-time

name: Epic Adventure Dungeon Crawl
description:
Introduction
If it’s adventure and excitement you are looking for, you have come to the right place brave adventurer. The time has come to prove your worth. Are you willing to show us your prowess with the blade, your stealth and cunning or your mastery of the magic arts? Whatever path you choose, adventure awaits.
Dungeon Crawl™ is primarily designed as a single player game set in a dungeon environment within a generic fantasy setting. The player chooses a character class to play (thief, fighter or sorcerer), rolls up the character’s attributes and places its starting equipment on the adventure sheet. The player then moves the character through the dungeon overcoming monsters, obstacles and traps in an attempt to find the dungeon’s random finale card and win the game. This game uses the game system that we created for the EA game books. Each game should take 20 – 30 minutes to play and because of the random manor of the game, each game should be very different to the previous one.


Variations
Several card variations, each with their own unique set of monsters, traps and treasure cards will be available for download soon. These include The Forest adventure add-on pack, Evil swamp add-on pack and The City of Evil add-on pack.
You, the player, create a character and lower yourself into the random dungeon. This game has been designed so that it plays different every time: different maps, monster encounters, traps and finale card.
What is included in this game
The following list of items is included in this basic game set:

Adventure Sheet
Spell cards
Monster Cards
Trap Cards
Treasure Cards
Corridor Tiles
Door tiles (locked and unlocked doors)
Room Tiles
Finale Cards

The adventure sheet is where you keep track of your characters possessions and has a quick reference to his/her attributes, skills and character trait.
Spell Cards
Spell cards are used by sorcerers and thieves and can be included with some magical items.

Monster Cards
Monster is the general term used in the game for enemies. The cards may have such things as: orcs, goblins, trolls and Dragons on them or evil humans, elves and dwarves.

Trap cards
Traps can be encountered in corridors and rooms

Treasure Cards
The deck consists of 100 treasure cards. Treasure is a general term for items and equipment that are found within the game.

Corridor Tiles
Corridor tiles can be empty, populated with monsters, traps and treasure or be special encounter cards.

Room Tiles
Room tiles can only be entered by a corridor tile with a door.

Finale Tiles
The deck consists of 6 Finale tiles.

What do I need to play?
All you need to play this game are 2 six-sided dice, some scrap paper, a pencil and some scissors.

Where can I play?
This game can be played anywhere:

At home in any room (a nice amount of table space is recommended)
In the garden (on a nice day)
At a friends house
At school during lunch or break
On an office desk

Can I play this game alone or with friends?
Epic Adventure Dungeon Crawl is primarily designed as a single player game. However, advanced rules are included so that Dungeon Crawl can also be played with two or three players in deathmatch mode!


BLACKTHORN FOREST ADD-ON EXPANSION

This is the first of the expansions to Dungeon Crawl - BlackThorn Forest. Like all good, classic adventures you start in a tavern (The Laughing Cow) on the edge of the forest.

New features include special event cards, dungeon entrance and new equipment, monsters and spell cards as well as new finale cards.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play

name: Untamed: A Rummy Revolution
description:
Land, air, and sea animals are all locked in a vicious struggle to dethrone the lion and be declared King of Beasts. In Untamed: A Rummy Revolution , you will compete to try to get the most animals into your own field--and it never hurts to have the winning animals on your side!

Based on the familiar card game, Rummy, Untamed: A Rummy Revolution adds more player interaction and strategy through action cards and the concept of ranking melds. Each card has three characteristics. The more characteristics the cards in a meld share, the higher the meld is ranked. By playing higher-ranked melds, you are better able to attack your opponent's animals, herd animals into your own melds, and defend against your opponent's attacks. Watch out for the King of Beasts cards, though! If you can meld a set of three of them, you can prevent your opponent from scoring, but if they're left in your hand at the end of the round, they'll cost you.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Print & Play

name: Euro-Pack VI: Partisans and Irregulars
description:
Eight scenarios for ASL with partisans and irregulars (what else?), from ASL News designers.

Contains the following scenarios:

EP12: Go Your Way
EP57: Red Dragon
EP64: Stubborn Insurrection
EP85: Cemetery at Drvar
EP92: The Walking Dead
EP97: Mussolini's Soldiers
EP100: Determination, Resolve and Grenades
EP101: Titioland
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Warhammer: Chronicles 2003
description: The Warhammer Fantasy Battle equivalent of Warhammer 40,000's Chapter Approved - a short-lived annual (the "Chronicles" name gets on the cover starting with the second annual - the first simply says "Annual"), collecting new and experimental rules from White Dwarf for Warhammer 6th edition. These include rules for combat as well as new or revised army lists or special rules for various armies that didn't make it into the army books of the 6th edition. Like Chapter Approved, each new edition was published in the year prior to the year mentioned in its title.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Wizard Dice
description:
Wizard Dice is an ancient duel between wizards, who, by casting arcane runes, attempt to send their opponent(s) to the fiery abyss.

Each players takes on the role of a wizard who has 20 Hit Points (or 10 Hit Points for a shorter game!). Each round, players roll six 6-sided dice simultaneously, re-rolling some or all of them up to twice more. The players then choose spells to use from the spellbook, allocating appropriate dice for each spell. These spells are then resolved before a new round begins. The game continues until one or more wizards are dead.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Mars Is Ours!
description:
A madcap robot-brawl for resources on Mars!

In the not-so-distant future, Mars has been terraformed, reborn into a planet overflowing with resources.
The players are CEOs reaching for success on the Red Planet. Send out your robot forces to wrest resources from the hands of your competitors!

Who will triumph in the struggles for materials and the race for greater output, attaining the Martian Dream?

Components
・1 Scoreboard
・1 Lab board
・13 terrain blocks (12 normal blocks and 1 thick "the Mars Rock" block)
・1 starting player marker (big black pawn)
・1 round marker (white pawn)
・4 spaceport discs (black)
・1x4 CEO pawns (small plastic pawns)
・12x4 Bots
・6x4 player counters (octagonal wood pieces)
・5 Battle dice (white 16mm)
・12 Martian Ingot dice (yellow 12mm)
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: The Agency
description:
Players are agents working for a counter terrorist organization. They work with the other players to prevent disasters in the city. They know where the terrorist targets are and must get themselves and other agents to those sites to diffuse the threat. One player is a double agent working with the terrorists. The other players must find a way to make the city safe in order to win.
Cards are played on buildings in the city where threats are taking place. On their turns the players choose one action from 9 available to diffuse the threats. If all threats in the city are eliminated, the players win, but if there are three disasters, the double agent and the terrorists win. A threat becomes a disaster if threat card is drawn that is identical to a threat already in place. Players can deploy other players to danger zones, they can move themselves, follow a tip, gather intelligence, or interrogate suspects. They can confront and kill other agents if they suspect them to be the double agent.

name: Mercadores de Dur Durany
description:
Game of construction of routes. The objective is to have the highest score at the end of the game.
Players have at their disposal merchants, mercantile cities and ships.
The first occupy the connections formed when locating a tray as well as areas on the planet (only when connection with the same color).
With their ships, the players occupy commerce routes, that will award them VPs if connected to a planet or intersection from mercantile city.

The game uses an action points mechanic (seven points). The actions can be:
- get a piece from the board 1AP;
- add a piece to the board 2AP;
- add a merchant 1AP;
- remove a merchant 1AP;
- add a ship to a route 1AP;
- add a mercantile city 2AP;
- change a piece in the board for another one 2AP;

The game finishes when the last piece is added to the board by a player. Score is then tallied and the winner is the player with most VP. The game is of easy learning, fast and very competitive, demands good capacity of observation to find the best oportunities for scoring.


Jogo de construção de rotas, cujo objetivo é somar a maior pontuação ao final da partida.
Para tal tem a disposição mercadores, cidades mercantis e naves. Os mercadores são usados nas conexões formadas ao posicionar a peça de tabuleiro. Sobre o planeta somente se a cor da conexão corresponder a uma das cores do planeta. Já as naves os jogadores ocupam uma rota de comércio, que só poderá ser pontuada ao fechar a rota com uma peça de planeta ou interseção para cidade mercantil. As cidades mercantis são posicionadas sobre tabuleiros com interseções de rotas, onde houver a presença de um circulo tracejado identificando a condição.
O jogo funciona utilizando a mecânica de pontos de ação (sete pontos).

As ações podem ser:
-pegar uma peça de tabuleiro - 1PA;
-posicionar uma peça de tabuleiro - 2PA;
-posicionar um mercador - 1PA;
-posicionar uma nave sobre a rota - 1PA;
-posicionar uma cidade mercantil - 1PA;
-retirar mercador já posicionado - 1PA;
-trocar peça de tabuleiro por outra - 2PA;

A partida termina quando a última peça de tabuleiro for posicionada por um dos jogadores. É feita então a pontuação final, vence quem somar a maior pontuação na escala de pontos de vitória (PV).

O jogo é de fácil aprendizado, rápido e muito competitivo, exige boa dose de observação por parte dos jogadores, para explorar as melhores oportunidades de pontuação.
.
mechanics: Action Points, Network and Route Building

name: Ausgerechnet Köln
description:
Ausgerechnet Köln uses the same game play as the other Ausgerechnet! titles: Players deal three piles of 15 location cards from a deck of roughly 200 cards (naming locations related to Cologne for this edition), then place an interlude card between each set of piles to make a deck of 45 cards. One location card is placed on the direction board, which has arrows pointing north, south, east and west.

On a turn, a player draws a location card – keeping the latitude and longitude on the back of the card secret from all players – then places the card next to the direction board, indicating how she thinks this location relates to the starting one. Is 'Nippes' west or east of Bonn? Why sure, so place it by the west arrow. Location cards can be placed between cards already on the board.

After each location card is placed, any player can challenge the positioning of that card. That player reveals the back of the most recently placed card as well as one adjacent card. If the challenge was correct – and the card placed wrongly – the challenger wins a point chip from the placer and the card is removed; otherwise the challenger hands over a chip to that person.

After 15 cards are placed, the interlude card signals an interim scoring in which all players secretly guess how many cards have been placed correctly. Guess correctly, and you score two chips; if no one is spot on, the closest guesser wins a chip.

After three rounds and the final interlude scoring, the player with the most chips wins.

name: Venetiae
description:
The game
The aim of the game is to become rich. To do that, as merchant, the player should pay attention in selling, to do intelligent loans of money and wise investments.
The player represents a young merchant which should demonstrate all his ability to become the richest merchant of Venice.

How to play
The game is dividet into four turns. Each turn is divided into four round.
The first round concerns the travel organization in Venice, after the auction sale of the rights to be in command of each "muda". The players then must play to load the ships.
The second round concerns the selling of the goods that they are loaded. The goods must be sell in the same order as they were loaded.
In the third round the player can buy products in Oltremare and in the final step return to Venice. Here the players can sell their products or store them in their warehouses. The aim to store goods is to load them next turn, to sell them in another destination more profitable.

I'm looking for interested publishers for printing
categories: City Building, Medieval, Nautical, Renaissance, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Cthulhu in 2012 Campaign Bus
description: The promo-card features an additional vehicle, the Cthulhu in 2012 Campaign Bus. The base game can be played with one more player.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Racing

name: Skrípó
description:
From the back of the box:

Who writes the funniest caption?

Iceland's funniest comic artist supply the drawings - and you make the joke. That's how Skrípó is, a disgustingly funny Icelandic boardgame which makes the family roll on the floor laughing. In Skrípó even the most absurd captions are hilarious...

Description:

Pick a drawing and put it in the supplied clip and place it in the middle of the board. Every player except the judge makes a caption for the drawing. The captions are read aloud and the judge picks the funniest caption and tries to guess which player wrote which caption. The funniest caption earns the author 4 spaces forward on the board, each correct guess earns the judge 1 space forward. The winner is the player who gets to the finish line (25 spaces).
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Party Game

name: Pixel Tactics: Reporter / Marion
description: Promo card for Pixel Tactics that is a crossover from the game Noir
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Pixel Tactics: Collector / Arcus
description: Pixel Tactics Promo card that is a crossover from the Blades Of Legend Game
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Chuggington Traintastic Cargo Game
description:
A molded plastic base in the bottom half of the box holds wells for cardboard pieces that represent cargos of different shapes (circles, triangles, squares, etc.), different colors, and different numbers. These wells are covered by a cardboard piece with a spinner and also a train of boxcars of different colors with doors that can each be opened to reveal one well. The cargos are distributed around the wells at the start of the game.

Players choose a cardboard playing board printed with a train of empty cars pulled by a Chuggington character to collect cargos on. Then they are then dealt a card showing the pattern of cargos they are to collect on their board. Patterns call for matching by combinations of shape, color, and number of items.

Players take turns spinning the spinner. Spins allow players to open boxcars to look for a cargo piece that they need for their pattern or rotate the train disk by one or two spaces. The goal is to be the first player to collect his or her complete pattern.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trains
publishers: I Can Do That Games, Wonder Forge

name: Block Mania: Happy Hour
description:
Additional counters with rules for the Block Mania board game, published in White Dwarf magazine issue 94.

The counters are not pre-printed on card, but made up by cutting them out of the magazine and sticking them on to counters from the original game as instructed in the article.

Reprinted in the 2020 edition of Mega Mania.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy – Andrea the dance instructor
description:
A promotional card given out during the 2014 Watch It Played Indiegogo campaign.

The promo card reads:

This gen.: Discard a friend from your hand anytime during your turn to gain +2 Honor for each.
categories: Age of Reason, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Evolution: Variation Mini-Expansion
description: 18 additional cards for Evolution. Origin of Species (compatible with all other expansions) and 6 cards for Evolution: Random Mutations.

name: Adventure Land: Herbs
description:
This expansion was on the back of the catalogue of the Haba Family Games.

General rules:

The 4 tiles are set out face down and shuffled in a stack. If a player picks up an herb tile with the value of "2" they can immediately trade it for one of these bonus herb tiles. To do so, the player picks up the top tile from the stack of bonus herb tiles. The traded-in herb tile is removed from the game.

1. "Gold sword" bonus herb tile
2 dice (instead of just one) can be used for the gold sword. The tile is removed from the game after it has been used.

2. "Platinum sword" bonus herb tile
3 dice (instead of just one) can be used for the platinum sword. The tile is removed from the game after it has been used.

3. "Magic gold herbs" bonus herb tile
Combat strength is increased by 5 points when the magic gold herb tile is used. The tile is removed from the game after it has been used.

4. "Loyal wolf" bonus herb tile
Combat strength is increased by 2 points when the wolf tile is used. The wolf remains at the side of the player as a loyal companion and can be used in every battle.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Improved Hull Resource
description:
The Improved Hull Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 3, "The Voyage Home," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, The Classic Movies.

When using this resource, you may put a mission token on any number of ships in your fleet. Each of those ships is treated as if it has +1 hull value for the duration of the game.

The resource costs an amount equal to the total starting hull value of all ships in your fleet (before using the resource) divided by 2 (rounded up). E.g., if your fleet's total combined hull value was 15, the resource would cost 8.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Kettou
description:
Kettou (which means duel in Japanese) is a samurai-themed reflex tabletop game inspired by the ancient Japanese game Karuta. Take on the role of a samurai warrior and go head-to-head against other players in an epic tabletop samurai duel. Use your quickness and bushido to defeat all adversaries.

Kettou uses real reflex mechanisms to simulate the quickness and sharpness a samurai needs. Hit location cards are placed between dueling players and randomly called out. Be the first to touch the correct card and deal damage to your opponent. Players also call upon seven "Virtues of Bushido" to aid them in combat. Defeat your opponents using quick reflexes and a sharp mind!

name: Sedis
description:
Description from the publisher:

Sedis is a “generic gaming device”. Much like dominoes or playing cards, Sedis can be used to play and create many different games.

Each Sedis set consists of 60 hexagonal tiles, which can be evenly divided among one to six players. The arrangement of pips and blanks are conducive to patterns and interpretations that can be used to guide each game. These two attributes – the congruent shape of the tiles and the dot patterns unique to each tile – open up a world of board configurations, mechanisms, and ways to play.

Sedis has many different game mechanics which form the backbone of games, including:

Aligning tiles and matching pips/blanks
Rotating tiles
Stacking tiles
“Battle’ mechanics
Trading
Betting/Gambling
Bluffing
Partnering/Communicating
Collaborating
Interpreting pips as numbers
Interpreting pips as Morse code
And more mechanics continued to be discovered
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Laundry Day
description:
Description from the publisher:

Laundry Day is a colourful game where you need to pair up socks after laundry. We will be choosing the socks for the friends from foreign countries!

Paired up socks: Myth or reality?

You are probably asking yourself this question! And yes! It is a reality! Every single patterned sock has a pair and this pair belongs to a one of the characters in the game!

How to do it?

Each player receives one character card. These characters come from six different foreign countries and dressed in national outfits. The object is to find four pairs of socks matching the pattern on your character’s dress. To win you will need to find all four pairs in three rounds of the game using one hand only!

Pick a sock!

If you need a challenge in this game ask for all four pairs of socks to have different toe and heel color. And the socks still have to match the pattern on the national dress!

There are six different cultures from different parts of the world and six different patterns from those cultures: Indian, Japanese, Mexican, Arabian, African and Russian! There is plenty of choice and topics for conversation!

Need another game variation?

You can spend a lot of time sorting out socks! Play classic memory game by placing the cards face down on the table.

Who is this game for?

For a family with preschool kids
For those who works with kids
For you can take this game with to a party

name: Võlujooks
description: Võlujooks is an easy and fast-flowing family game where players compete in a relay race. What separates this from a simple roll and move game is that all characters on teams have special powers, some of which are active during other player's turns!
mechanics: Interrupts, Open Drafting, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Forgotten Lands
description:
Description from the designer:

Can you re-discover the Forgotten Lands? Evidence has surfaced of a civilization lost to time. Historical clues have led your archaeological team to the general area where they existed, but now you must find the exact location of their sacred sites and buildings. You're not the only one looking however so you'll need to hurry if you want to claim the discovery for yourself.

In this solo roll and write game, you'll enter numbers into the search areas for four lost sacred sites/buildings. You're goal is to match the total for each row and column to a target number. The better that you're able to do this, the quicker your team can locate the site and the higher you'll score. Take too long and a rival archaeological team will find it first and you'll get no points.

As you search for the first three sacred sites: the Altar of Offerings, the Observatory, and the Grand Temple, you'll find clues leading you to the general location of a fourth huge site known as the Tomb of Kings. You'll use those clues to unlock that location and then search for it as well. The Tomb of Kings has the potential to earn you the most points, but is also the most difficult.

name: Rats of Tobruk
description:
The Rats of Tobruk uses a derivative of the Famous Divisions Series that appeared in World at War #20 (Grossdeutschland Panzer <sic>) and #34 (Guards Armored). Rats of Tobruk is a two-player operational/tactical game that simulates Rommel’s Easter Day attack on Tobruk in April 1941. This battle primarily involved the Australian 9th Infantry Division, as well as British artillery batteries that were tasked to prevent the capture of Tobruk harbor by the German 5th Light Division. Each game turn represents approximately six hours. Game turns are not divided into separate friendly and enemy turns, but rather they are comprised of numerous individual headquarters activations. The map represents the western half of the Tobruk fortifications in 1941. Each hexagon encompasses about 500 meters.

Published in World at War #64 magazine, the FEB – MAR 2019 issue.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Dreamwars: Adventurer's Kit Expansion Set
description:
The rise of Heroes. From the lush forests to the crowded cities, Ylen can be an unforgiving, brutal place. But for those who are willing to take a chance, each danger hides an opportunity...

The Adventurer's Kit is an expansion for the Dreamwars board game by Royal Art Games. Featuring eight brand new playable Heroes, each with unique abilities, plus dozens of new Equipment and Events cards, this set will make your games even more unpredictable and fun.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Kampf um den Olymp: Andromeda
description:
A promo card released at Spiel 2017. A new heroine with strong defense, that takes damage when units are discarded.

Text says:
Immer wenn eine ausliegende Einheit auf den Ablagestapel gelegt wird, erhält Andromeda 1 Schäden.

English translation: Whenever an outlying unit is placed on the discard pile, Andromeda receives 1 damage.

This card is included in the base game, only attack and defense values are different (1 attack, 4 defense).
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology

name: Kampf um den Olymp: Iolaos
description:
A promo card released at Spiel 2017. A new hero that lets your opponent draw a card when he attacks.

Text:
Immer wenn Iolaos angreift, zieht dein Gegner 1 Karte.

Translation:
Whenever Iolaos attacks, your opponent draws 1 card

This card is included in the base game, only attack and defense values are different (1 attack, 3 defense).
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology

name: Cube Hog
description:
Cube Hog is a 2-4 player family/party style card game all about using strategy, luck, and even slight of hand to "hog" more cubes than your opponents!

Gameplay: Learning to play Cube Hog takes only a couple minutes. Each player is assigned a color (Red, Blue, Green, Yellow) and given their color player cubes, 5 to each player. Cubes are all pink except the underside which has a hidden player color. Each color is given a value card facedown to dictate what each color cube is worth.

For example: If the blue player has a 1 on their value card, then the cubes that have blue on their hidden underside are each only worth 1.

Players take turns playing action cards to best their opposition. Action cards are used to steal, swap, and flip cubes over to reveal the underside. Action cards also can be used to look at other players value cards, flip over value cards for everyone to see, or even to change a value card. The player with the highest value of cubes at the end of the round wins the game!

Cube Hog can be played in two ways. Quickplay is the fastest way to pick up and play. Quickplay games last about 10 minutes and a great for some quick fun. Competitive play consists of multiple games of Cube Hog with each game won rewards the player with a Gold Cube. Playing this takes about 45 minutes. This also adds the 'Gold Cube' card into the deck to add a new mechanic specifically designed for competitive play. First player to win 3 gold cubes wins the competitive play game!

Cube Hog rewards players who can remember which cube is which while the cubes slowly get shuffled around the table. However, players are also rewarded when they use sleight of hand to shuffle their own cubes to fool other players.

name: Glyph: Destruction Dice
description:
Tucked away in the corner of the tribe’s archives, a dusty tome has been discovered. In it, scholars have come across what had only been legend: a new method of harnessing the power of the glyphs. Why had this tome been hidden away? Unfortunately, the scholars learned the answer to their question much too late, and cursed they ever found the tome…

The Glyph of Destruction is a new glyph in the land of Tundrus. This glyph, as the name suggests, is not to be trifled with. The new method of harnessing the glyphs has remarkable power: Players are able to generate doubles of any glyph they desire with ease. But such power comes at a cost. In rare instances, the method doesn’t generate the desired glyph, but instead forms an entirely new glyph. A glyph that eradicates the power the player once had.

During a champion’s REPLENISH phase, players may elect to temporarily substitute active dice for one or more of five black dice. Each of these dice specialize in one of the five other glyphs. Four of the sides have a double-glyph of the die’s specialization. Be warned, however, for the other two sides have the Destruction Glyph. Any time the Destruction Glyph is rolled, the die is immediately locked in (can’t be rerolled), and the original die that was substituted for the black die is trashed. Once the black die has performed its function that activation, it is returned to the general stock and players regain the die that was substituted (assuming it wasn’t destroyed).
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Little Arrow
description:
The forest is full of danger and treasure: close your eyes, jump, turn around and throw the arrow... Become the best archer and hit the best target, with your eyes closed!
Place the board in the middle of the table and randomly place on it the 8 target shapes. The player stands in front of the board and rolls the special dice. The results will determine the way to shoot the arrow: turn around 360 degrees, take a step backwards and one step forward, jump 3 times on the spot, take a step to the right and a step to the left, stand on a foot, etc. Then, he takes the arrow, closes his eyes, raises it up and performs the action indicated by the dice while placing it on the board (eyes closed!).
What did you hit?
The castle: you conquer the castle card, even if another player already conquered it.
A target: you conquer the target you hit.
A score area of the board: you conquer a treasure tile of the corresponding value (if some are still available).
The river: you don't conquer anything.
The swamp: you have to discard one of the tiles you previously won.
The game ends after the sixth turn terminates. Each player places the tiles and targets conquered during the match in a straight sequence: the player who forms the longest sequence wins.

name: Gods of Metal: The Chosen
description:
Your home, a land of steel, blood, and death is being threatened. Creatures from Outside have been trying to gain entry for centuries and the Gods of Metal have held them off. Until now, these creatures were a loose band of demons and other things attacking weakly and easily repelled. Lately they’ve been getting bolder. Tales of the great demon lords rallying together to make a final run are spreading. If they make it through, the universe is lost. The creatures of darkness stand at the edge of your realm, their malicious intent is plain in their stance. The creatures charge. The Gods of Metal reach out to gather together the greatest band in history and use the power of Metal to stop their advancing darkness, that’s where you come in.
Your van is bouncing down yet another lonely highway when the flash of lightning chars your engine. Each of you step out, cursing the bolt that took your van. Just then, another bolt strikes a short distance away, the thunder driving you back. A figure made of pure electricity walks towards you. You’ve been chosen. You are all that will stand between the Universe and Darkness.

Gods of Metal: The Chosen is a game of destruction and greatness for 1-4 Players! Each player will take the role of one of a Band Member chosen by the God of Metal seeking to defend the Universe against the demonic forces seeking to gain entry. The Overlords wants to destroy these lands by sending minions to attack the land’s defenses. To win and save everything, the players must work together to defeat the Overlords!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Fantastiq
description:
Unleash your inner artist with Fantastiq!

Each round you receive a commission, a title describing the thing you must sculpt. All players make their creations at the same time using the included modeling clay. When everyone is done, it's time for the exhibition! You have to associate the correct title to each sculpture, and you earn points for each correct guess. You also gain points depending on how much your own sculpture has been guessed by the other players!

name: Wühlmäuse
description:
Story and goal

All children are rooting in the leaves. Because under the colorful foliage many animals have hidden - also fruits and cones are below it.

Each turn adds an extra sheet with a new theme mixed on the bottom among the others.

Who finds it the first to root?

Preparation:

a) Sort out the leaves with pictures and put them in the bag.

The other leaves are distributed on the "forest floor" in the box bottom. Then you put the coins next to the Box ready.

The youngest player starts, then it goes clockwise continue.

If you are the youngest child, take the fabric bag and take out a sheet without looking into it. Look at the motive on the underside secret, without the others can see.

Remember this motif and hide it under the leaves in the box while the other players turn around.

If you have hidden the sheet, your teammates - with one hand - dig in the pile of foliage, just for this new one

To search motive. The leaves may be opened and closed

Be careful, but be careful when digging: Leaves must remain in the box.

Anyone who thinks they have found the new motive they are looking for calls the name of the animal or the fruit.

Was it correct, the player may take a gold coin. The sheet comes back in the box, in such a way that the picture is hidden.
If it is wrong, the other players may (only) continue to dig,


until one finds the right motive and gets a gold coin.

At the end of the game:

As soon as the last motive has been found in the heap of leaves and given the correct name, the game is over. Who has collected the most gold coins, wins the game! If two or more players have the same number of coins, they win together.

Have fun digging, grumbling, rustling and finding!

name: Oops Scoops
description:
Scoop...Stack...Balance...Don’t let them fall! Take turns stacking the scoops on ‘Oops’ the ice cream cone. But beware, ‘Oops’ can shiver to make the stacking even more challenging and causing the tower of scoops to topple.

—description from the publisher

name: Supertall: Spires
description:
Add height and value to your towers with spires of all types.

This expansion adds 6 Spire cards to add height and value to your skyscraper design.

At the start of the game, randomly choose 1 more than the number of players.

Spires can be claimed by any skyscraper that meets the requirement. They are treated like other floor cards and can be moved around after claimed.
