The "Improve" step is adding newly acquired cards to their face down saved cards pile, if they wish. The improve cards may alternatively be discarded. Finally, players "Reveal" their face down cards to see who came closest to the dice value goal.

Betting chips are not included in the game, but a round of betting after the deal, "Shift" and "Improve" phases is assumed. This is also how game play works in the electronic Sabacc table version you can play in the Sublight Lounge on the Galactic Starcruiser. Once all players have had a chance to deal, the game ends and the player with the most betting chips wins.

"Coruscant Shift" has also removed the hand ranking complexity of "Corellian Spike". If two or more players have equal hands, even after the suits tie breaker, players split the pot.

There is also a Sabacc: Bounty Hunt variant included in the rules, which is similar to Go Fish for younger children.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Math, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number, Science Fiction

name: Ticker Tape
description:
Thirty-two companies are represented. Each is assigned to one or more of nineteen industries. Changes in prices of the stocks of each company are noted on the gameboard using a china marker.

Each player begins with $15,000 and a sheet of blank stock certificates on which to record purchases and sales. The pawn, there is only one for all players to move, is placed on 'start'. The space on which the pawn rests tells the player to obey a chance card, or more likely, which industries stock prices will rise and fall on the next turn.

A player's turn begins with the roll of the dice to determine how much each affected stock has changed. (There is a chance table for each stock.) The pawn is advanced the number rolled and the player who rolled the dice may purchase as much stock of one company and sell as much of another company desired.

The players play until the end of the time limit agreed upon. The players cash in their stocks and the one with the most money wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Dead or Alive
description:
Take aim on this fast-paced card game of gunslingers and gamblers, bullets and bad blood, posses and Pinkertons . . . Loaded with 4 card decks, each of them offering you would-be gunfighters a chance for fame and fortune...or a very short career.

A beer and pretzels game of outlaw gangs in the Old West. The players control gangs of outlaws formed with cards drawn from the gunslinger deck. The object is to be the first gang to amass a specified dollar amount by pulling off successful bank robberies. Gunfights are resolved quickly by comparing the leather slapping ratings of the combatants.

name: Allerley Spielerey
description:
Allerley Spielerey is another of Reiner Knizia's game packs (cf. Neue Spiele im alten Rom). This one being set in medieval times and including the games:


Am Hofe des Königs
Contra
Das Hufeisenspiel
Schanzen
Der Stein der Zünfte
Um Speis' und Trank


Probably the most interesting of them is Um Speis' und Trank which shows a simple stock market situation in which items fluctuate in value with players employing a swapping mechanism to either trade up or cash out.

The set is completely constructed of wood and only 100 numbered copies were produced. Also includes a bottle of wine.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Steam and Steel
description:
Quoting from the review at http://flyhi.de/games/dampfundstahl1.html:

Steam and Steel is a game of naval power and economy; the objective is to gain the commercial and military superiority on the oceans. The crucial areas, or rather points, of the map are the ports, and the units at the player's disposal are his warships. The winner is the player that controls the largest port capacity at the end of the game, i.e. after a certain number of game turns or a predetermined time.

"Players gain income from their ports. They spend their income for increasing port capacity, fortifying ports, building shipyards, and building ships. Ships have no inherent value towards the objective of the game, but they are necessary to protect the bases. New technology makes older ships obsolete, forcing players to constantly upgrade their fleets.

"When opposing ships or fleets meet, or ships enter a fortified port, game play switches to short interludes of tactical battle."

Expanded by:

Steam and Steel: Expansion Set 1

name: Money
description:
Kind of Monopoly. You move round a board, you can land on event spaces, where you get money or have to pay money. On other spaces you can buy shares of buildings. Other players have to pay if they land on squares around companies that players hold shares in.
Nice and easy game, a bit more fun than Monopoly.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fortran
description:
According to Sid Sackson's A Gamut of Games:

The elements of how a computer program works are learned as players move through the program, entering values on three different "counters," and transferring results to their own "printers".

More details from a Twitter thread by Christian Hammond:

You are an instruction pointer. You and your competing instruction pointer share global registers: A, B, and C.

Each turn, you roll dice and move that many instructions down.

Instructions may alter a global register, accumulate the result to your printer, or branch. There are conditionals, loops, gotos, variable assignments, math, and output. You have to track and follow loops and conditionals.

The game ends when an instruction pointer reaches the end of the program. The person with the largest score wins.

The instructions state that the game is meant to teach young players (12 and up) the basics of programming.
publishers: Educational Design, Inc., Orda Industries Ltd.

name: Santa's Special Delivery Game
description:
Santa's Special Delivery game is essentially a Candyland variant designed around Christmas.
Cover Game for Gameplay No. 10, December, 1983.

Players take turns moving around the board delivering Christmas gifts. A spinner is used to determine movement. The first player to deliver 4 gifts and return home wins. Santa needs your help delivering gifts this year! So pack up your sleigh and away you go! Be the first to deliver all of your gifts and return home to win!

It appears the game is a kind of race game. The article announcing the game describes it as "an educational fantasy game (featuring) four elven characters by the names of Alfy, Beezy, Chappy and Doozy, who assist players in collecting the toys they will eventually help Santa deliver. The game's objective is to stress the importance of the philosophy that it is better to give than receive."

name: The Original Superstar Wrestling
description:
'The Original Superstar Wrestling Game was conceived and copyrighted by John Harwood back in the mid 1970s. The game uses wrestlers' repertoires of moves to flow from offense to defense and finally to pin and submission attempts. A pair of dice, the unique wrestler and result cards are all you need to recreate all the action of Pro Wrestling right on your table top!

The game comes with complete rules, cards, game box and dice. It is easy to learn and you can play an 8 match card in less then an hour.

name: Wheels of Steel
description:
In this game, players build tracks and transport commodities with up to four different trains.
At some stations the products will be manufactured and as a result will be worth more points if delivered.
At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins.
This is a free print and play game and it will only be available here at the Geek.

name: Tactica "S"
description:
The game Tactica "S" is a deep abstract game for two players. It has 8 white pieces and 8 black pieces that move along an 8x8 board.

The mechanics are similar to Chess (the movement of pieces), Tablut (the way pieces capture other pieces) and Othello (pieces change sides - colours).

Pieces are never removed from board, but only change sides. The winner is the one who captures or blocks all the opponents pieces.
mechanics: Enclosure, Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture
publishers: Geyper, Industrias Geyper S.A., Tomy, Vullierme / Vulli

name: Finger Soccer
description:
From the publisher's website:

In the tradition of paper football played by millions of kids, both young and old, Zelosport has taken this same concept to the most popular sport around the world! Finger Soccer allows fans to take this great game indoors to the kitchen table where families can enjoy many more hours of entertainment, day or night, rain or shine!

name: Caralis: The Battle for Sardinia, 215 B.C
description:
A new battle module for SPQR found here, published in RBM/GMT's C3i Magazine Nr9.

After the Carthaginian mercenaries rose up slew their Carthaginian commanders they offered to surrender the island to Rome. In a violation of the treaty signed at the end of the First Punic War the Senate annexed the island, and when Carthage complained Rome threatened war and increased Carthage's indemnity.

During the Second Punic war both Rome and Carthage sent armies to the island, and these forces met outside of Caralis.

name: Open Rails Origins
description:
Open Rails Origins - 18AL is a hybrid of several game systems, most notable 18XX, Age of Steam and Chicago Express as well as some other unique twists to create a compact yet challenging train game experience.

Play begins with players participating in an auction to buy shares in one of five railroads represented in 19th century historic Alabama. Cubes are used to lay track, represent engines you have acquired and to track your income and stock price. The price you set on your initial stock purchase determines how many cubes you have to work with. Railroads may build stations to block a rival's advances, upgrade cities. Each turn your railroad may decide to save money to buy further locomotive upgrades to force your competitors to buy more expensive trains that they can't afford - or they can pay out to their investors to ultimately drive up stock price. Play moves fast and fortunes can change in the blink of an eye.

The object is to make more money than your fellow robber barons by holding the most valuable stocks and acquiring the most cash through deliveries through the game.

The game is playable for one to three players. The one player version takes about 20 minutes to play after the initial pass through the rules. Experienced players should be able to get through the two and three player versions of the game in 60-90 minutes.

This game is a print and play release of the Open Rails train game system. Poker chips, 1 cm cubes or smaller, a pair of scissors and the means to print out four sheets of 8 x 10 paper are all that are needed to play.

Latest files - including Sampo's redraw available offsite here:

https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B7AWw2_0pF5DM3pNSHRr...;usp=sharing
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Monopoly: The Office Collector's Edition
description:
From USAopoly.com:

Buy, sell and trade your way to victory. Visit Schrute Farms and spend a night in the cozy "closet room". Get into the scent aroma market by acquiring Serenity by Jan. If you like "cable readiness" and paper thin walls, then be sure to invest in Michael’s condo.

Make deals and trades while building your corporate empire. Stay sharp because there is only room for one at the top. . . that’s what she said.

Game comes complete with six unique collectible tokens chosen by fans featuring - Dwight bobblehead, Pam’s candy dish, Beet, Unicorn princess, World’s Best Boss coffee mug and Bacon grill.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Coca-Cola 125th Anniversary Collector's Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Refresh yourself with this special COCA-COLA 125th Anniversary Collector's Edition of the MONOPOLY game. COCA-COLA’s most treasured collectibles over the past 125 years are all up for grabs as players buy, sell and trade posters, calendars, serving trays and more. Six collectible tokens including the Bell Glass, Diamond Can, Vintage Cooler, Delivery Truck, Polar Bear and Contour Bottle make this game a treasured keepsake for COCA-COLA fans of all ages.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Battle Beast
description:
Battle Beast is the game player gather Beast warrior and fight other players

Game Play : Every one draw 5 cards from the same deck. When in their turn, They must form a team of beast warriors to attack another player and may play only one tactic card from their hand per turn. The defender may play one tactic cards and form a team of beast warrior from his hand to defend. If the Attacker win He claim VP equal to 1 + (different in number of beast warriors) and kill all defending warrior. If the defender win nothing happen and pass to next player turn

Goal : When 2 players are out of VP the game end and Who got the most VP win the game

name: Santiago de Cuba: La siesta
description:
8 tiles expansion for Santiago de Cuba.
Promo item at the Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2013.
publishers: Festival Internacional de Juegos de Córdoba, Jugamos Tod@s

name: Chaosmos: Dimension Rip Promo Card
description:
This promotional card was given at multiple conventions including Origin and GenCon 2015.

For an action point, an alien can move to its toxic planet or for two action points to their home planet.
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Deduction, Exploration, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Grant's Gamble: McClellan Moves
description: McClellan Moves expands Grant's Gamble, allowing players to recreate the Peninsula Campaign. Included in this game is units for Johnston, McClellan, siege guns, and the CSS Virginia. Rules for Antietam might come out with a future expansion.
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Artisans
description:
Description from the designer:

Artisans is a free print and play game for 1 player.
You are a young artisan who recently completed an apprenticeship and must now make a name for yourself. Your ultimate ambition is to receive a Royal commission to create something for the looming wedding of the young Prince and his fiancé – however, this cannot happen unless you first build up a good reputation! Unfortunately, Shearspike (your fellow pupil and fiercest rival) has also just completed his apprenticeship and has similar ideas. You cannot deny that Shearspike has more natural talent and skill than you do, but you are determined and hard-working, whereas Shearspike is lazy and arrogant. Your time is short and reputation is everything in this game!

There are just 4 sheets to print (grayscale) - two sheets are your player boards, two sheets contain 18 cards that require cutting.
You will also need to supply 7 dice and approx 30 cubes or tokens of any colour.

This was an entry into the 2016 Solitaire PNP Design Contest:-
3rd Place - 'Best Overall Design'
Winner - 'Best Worker Placement Game'
Winner - 'Best Greyscale Printed Game'
3rd Place - 'Best Easy to Build Game'
3rd Place - 'Best Original Artwork'
4th Place - 'Best Graphic Design'
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading, Variable Phase Order

name: Spirits of the Rice Paddy: Dino Rush Promo Cards
description:
Two rain cards for Spirits of the Rice Paddy that were included in The Great Dinosaur Rush

Rules: Simply add them to the Rain Deck

name: Munchkin Lite
description:
Description from the publisher:

Go down in the dungeon. Kill everything you meet. Backstab your friends and steal their stuff. Grab the treasure and run.

Munchkin Lite has all the same dungeon-crawling, pun-making, backstabbing madness of original Munchkin, but with 115 cards, it's the perfect size for three to four players. Take it anywhere, and play it in an hour!

name: FUSION: Asteroid Mining
description: FUSION: Asteroid Mining is a free, solo, Print N Play Science Fiction game set at a time in the future when asteroids are being mined for their resources. The player chooses and lays tiles representing an area of space, then moves their starship from tile to tile so they can mine the asteroids and trade the material for credits. Opposing the players are a police force that will tax the player, that move according to direction arrows on the tiles
categories: Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: The Great Micro Game
description:
The 19th century empires of Russia and Britian engaged in a series of strategic conflicts in Central Asia known as The Great Game. Relive that history in only 18 cards.

Based loosely on the COIN system, the Great Micro Game features a solitaire variant known as K1M (Kiplings 1-Player Mode). Despite the name, this allows you to play as either the British or Russian Empires.

Originally an Entry for the 2015 18-Card Microgame Contest and the Mint Tin Contest, it won 1st place for Top 3 Designs by Guest Judge Chris Hansen.

There are two editions of the game in the files section:
Core Edition - This is the original entry that won the Mint Tin Contest Guest Judge Award. This is the more play-tested game and will likely be a better solo play experience
Alternate Edition - This edition has a video explanation, some thematic tweaks, and a different rule set. I recommend this edition if you want to learn by video.
categories: Card Game, Post-Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: Starship Babel
description:
Starship Babel is a different kind of game than I expected, and that's what makes it stand out so well for me. Set in our Pocket Universe, you are all prisoners aboard the Babel trying to escape, but you don't speak the same language. You will use a single word (not in English!) to describe your actions or intentions on steering this ship to survival.

—description from the publisher


Starship Babel is a microgame in which players which speak different languages desperately try to steer a spaceship to safety.

The game consists of a spaceship card and 8 sector cards, numbered 5-12. One of these is flipped open, showing a dictionary of an alien language. The other cards are placed in a row, with the spaceship card between two other cards.

The players now discuss their plan, using only the words on the dictionary card. Afterwards, they simultaneously lift 1-5 fingers. If the overall number of fingers matches the number of the sector card before the ship, they advance by one position. If not, the last card of the row is removed. The ship escapes to safety when it reaches the front of the row and is destroyed when there are no cards behind it.
categories: Card Game, Negotiation, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Someone Has Died: Dirty Deck
description:
Expansion to the base game with additional very NSFW cards

7 Identity
5 Objection
6 Relationship
17 Back Story

name: 8Bit Box: Cheat Pack
description:
Promo pack given out at Essen Spiel 2018 with purchase of the 8Bit Box system.

Pack also found in December 2018 issue of Tabletop Gaming.

Comprised of 3 "Cheat Code" cards, 1 each for Pixoid, Outspeed, and Stadium, these cheat codes allow you a special surprise ability if your recent plays have matched the required sequence on the card in order to gain a bonus.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Sports, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Auction/Bidding, Grid Movement, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Battle Ravens: Norman Army
description:
Battle Ravens army packs offer players three new armies to command in battle: choose from the Normans, the Welsh, or the Scots.

Battle Ravens is a game of Viking Age warfare: a brutal clash of strength, cunning and luck, where subtlety and nuance are neither welcome or commonplace. Army packs offer new artwork and strategies for play.

Each army pack includes 18 Hirdmen, 18 Bondi, 4 Thralls, 20 Ravens, an information sheet including optional rules for Battle Ravens, and 10 Tactics Cards themed to the army.

—description from the publisher

name: Thief's Fortune: Prevent Robbery promo card
description:
Part of Artipia's A Fair, a Robbery and a Promo Pack Kickstarter Campaign.

Card type: Event - Risky
"Get 1 Fortune Point for each Friend and each Neutral Character in your Present"
categories: Arabian, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Ardennes 1940
description: Game covers first days of the German 1940 offensive through Ardennes. Along with historical scenario, there are two hypothetical scenarios, with biggest allied forces.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Architects of Giza
description:
We invite you to become an architect of legendary pyramids. To conquer fame and wealth, this will be the gift from Pharaoh. The board game Architects of Giza is a «roll-and-write» game, made for 2-4 players and the duration of play no longer than 20 minutes. One turn of the game consist a few rounds, each of them is separated into 2 stages. During the 1st stage players one by one are throwing the dice and writing the summary of numbers of selected dice into the cell of a pyramid. Depending on the quantity of selected dice player can write the summary only into the specific rows. Written numbers have value for the final score, but not only the quantity directly, but also the rows which are completed and pairs of the same numbers will bring additional points. During the 2 stage players have to decide their order for the next turn, because this is an important detail which can bring not only better choice, but also bonuses during the game and in the end as well.
To play Architects of Giza, you need: notepad with the game fields, 6 playing dice D6 and pencils for writing.

—description from the designer

name: Linjaa
description:
Creating the longest line, flip your opponent's plan or just enjoy the puzzle: it's up to you to choose a winning strategy.
Each card in the game is unique, so it's not easy to form the longest line.
Win or lose, you always create a compelling pattern with Linjaa.

Linjaa is a multi-player edge-matching game. When adding a new card to the playing field, you gather points when finishing a line or a "circle" (closing a shape). Cards can only be combined when the lines on your card match the lines on the cards already in the field.
Concentrate on your own plan or sabotage the plans of your fellow players: it's up to you to choose which line to take.
Whoever succeeds in finishing the most and the longest lines or closing the largest shapes, wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: DJ Jazzy Jeff and the Fresh Prince: Summertime
description:
It's summertime, and DJ Jazzy Jeff and the Fresh Prince have invited you to hang with them at the hottest spots in Philly. You will cruise, groove, and unwind across town, trying to vibe with them to prove you're the coolest in the crew. Do you have the energy to keep up with everyone else who has their eyes on the crown?

In the quick and clever card game DJ Jazzy Jeff and the Fresh Prince: Summertime, which is inspired by the classic hit song, players have to outwit each other with a series of tricky decisions. First, reveal a "spot" card — something like a block party, car show, or family reunion — each with one of five different vibes. Players then pick an action card, an energy card, and potentially a boost card to play all at once. Actions can give you boosts and cancel your opponents'. Energy cards have a variety of values and give you boosts if they match the spot's vibe, but you can use each energy card only once!

Once players have taken their actions, and energy has been counted, whoever has the most wins the spot! Spots are worth points on their own, but are worth extra points if they are collected as a set, or match a player's personal vibe.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Waterloo 2025
description:
Waterloo 2025 is a second game of the Third World War series, released by Taktyka i Strategia. It's straight continuation of the Ardennes 2024, a game set up in the hypothetical timeline, where modern Germany and Russia form an alliance to take a rule in Europe, where number of resources is decreasing drastically.

Waterloo 2025 starts with a massive riots in Belgium, goes on with a war between former allies and end with a last, massive offensive attempt of the Russian-German coalition. Game contains four scenarios that can be played one after another or stand alone.

Rules are mostly the same as Ardennes 2024, although some clarifications are made and some new rules introduced as well. All the units used in the game are actually existing units of the modern European armies. Game uses battalion scale for the western units and brigade scale for Russian units.

As a wargame, Waterloo 2025 uses typical hex and counter mechanics with I go-you go system and light rules (13 pages or rules and 3 pages of tables.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Turn Order: Role Order

name: Monster Olympics
description:
Build your monster’s strength, speed, and scare to compete for the gold medal in the Monster Olympics!

The game is played over 15 rounds, with players playing simultaneously, trying to earn the most points by earning medals and advancing your monster as far as possible. All players will use the same dice pool for each roll, however each player determines how to use the dice.

In each round, you will roll 2 dice and then use those dice to determine which monster upgrade to use. Each monster upgrade advances certain tracks. At the end of the game, you will compare your Strength, Speed, and Scare to see who had the most in each category. You will also score your track with the lowest number.

Scoring - Medal Ceremony

You will compete in three contests consisting of Strength, Speed, and Scare. First, compare your number on the tracks with every other player. The player with the highest number on each track earns the Gold Medal, 7 points, and writes a 7 in the Scoring area under the Strength icon. The player with the next highest score earns the Silver Medal, 3 points. The next highest earns the Bronze Medal, 1 point. It is friendly scoring, so ties are shared. Then check your individual four tracks, and write the lowest number in the last scoring area. Add your score and the player with the highest score is the Monster Olympics Champion!
mechanics: Bingo, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fluxx: Sham-Bo
description: Ever wanted to play Fluxx and Ro-Sham-Bo at the same time? Well now you can, insert the Sham-Bo pack into any Fluxx deck and the 3 Keepers, 3 Goals, and 1 Action card will let you be on your way to new interactions in the Fluxx game of your choice.

name: Ist da wer?!
description:
Ist da wer?! is a hide-and-seek game in which attentive children need to recognize what cannot be seen.

The centerpiece of the game is a "thicket", that is, a large vertical container that represents a bunch of bushes. Inside this container are twenty wooden discs, two each of ten colors, and you can see these discs inside the thicket through 29 cut-out slots. However, the thicket is designed so that five of the discs will fall into grooves at the bottom of the vertical container, and the discs in these grooves will be hidden by a piece of cardboard underbrush so that they are not visible until you remove the underbrush during play. Ten animals in the colors of the discs are set up in the center of the playing area within reach of all players. Each player also has a stack of nine tiles that when placed together form a picture.

Each round, one player shakes the thicket face down so that no one can see which discs are going where, then they stand the thicket upright on the table. Everyone then grabs for the animals that they think are hiding in the underbrush, that is, the animals that can be seen only once through the cut-out slots — or possibly not seen at all.

Once everyone has grabbed all the animals that they wish to, remove the underbrush to see which animals are actually there. If you grabbed an animal that is in the underbrush, reveal one of your picture tiles, and if that animal is in the underbrush twice, reveal two picture tiles instead. If by mistake you grabbed an animal that is not in the underbrush, you must return a picture tile to the bottom of your stack. Keep playing rounds until one or more players have revealed all of their tiles, completed their picture, and won.

name: Draftosaurus: Marina e Show Aéreo
description:
2-in-1 Expansions:

Draftosaurus: Aerial Show expands the boundaries of your park and adds a new species to draft: pterodactyls!

This expansion for Draftosaurus adds a double-sided board that each player can combine with their existing park to add a new mountain zone. Pterodactyls are the only dino-meeples that can be placed on this part of the board, and each of their nests offers you a specific bonus in return, ranging from extra points to immunity to the placement die!

Draftosaurus: Marina expands the boundaries of your park and adds a new species to draft: plesiosauruses!

This expansion for Draftosaurus adds a new double-sided board that each player can combine with their existing park to add a new river zone. Plesiosauruses are the only dino-meeples that can be placed in this part of the river, granting points at the end of the game. To move your plesiosaurus further down the river and earn more points, you must place specific other species in your park to unlock the dams one by one!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Hora de expandir seu parque
Draftosaurus – Expansão 2 em 1 é a combinação de duas expansões lançadas originalmente em 2020: Marina e Show Aéreo. A expansão convida os jogadores a retornarem para a divertida tarefa de construir um zoológico de dinossauros. E dessa vez temos duas novas espécies a disposição: os plesiossauros, que vivem nos rios do parque, e os pterodáctilos, que adoram morar nas altitudes montanhosas.

Já que temos novos animais, também surgem novos espaços para eles habitarem: o aviário, perfeito para os seus pterodáctilos, e a marina, o habitat ideal do plesiossauro. Essas áreas permitem ao jogador acessar maneiras de pontuar diferentes e únicas. Assim como no jogo base, ambas as áreas são frente e verso, entregando um nível de desafio diferente em cada um dos lados do tabuleiro.

Draftosaurus – Expansão 2 em 1 adota a filosofia de que em time que está ganhando não se mexe: você não vai encontrar nessa caixa mudanças que alterem profundamente sua experiência de jogo, mas sim um tempero extra capaz de abrilhantar ainda mais as partidas de um título que é amado por fãs no mundo todo.

Edição brasileira e reimpressão
Em outros mercados as expansões Marina e Show Aéreo foram vendidas separadamente. Para a edição brasileira a MeepleBR resolveu colocar o conteúdo das duas expansões em uma caixa só, o que facilita a vida de quem gosta de ter seus jogos completos.

E os fãs de dinossauros podem comemorar: além da Expansão 2 em 1, também veremos uma nova tiragem do jogo base Draftosaurus, o que é perfeito para quem quer garantir esse pequeno grande jogo na coleção.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric, Science Fiction
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Sherlock Piratas: Chamanes y mocasines
description:
In each Q case, you try to solve a mystery case with 32 clues, with players revealing one clue at a time until all cards have been revealed or discarded.

Choose a card from your hand and place it on the table, so all players can read or see the entire information.
We recomend you read out loud all shared info when you place it on the table. If you play a clue that happens to be irrelevant
to the case, you lose points at the end of the game, but be careful! Some clues are vital to resolve the case.

You can share and expose your theories at any moment and talk about the cards you have in your hand but you cannot show them to the other players and you may only read out loud the words written in bold or the text framed inside an image:

At the end of the game, when all clue cards have been revealed or discarded, you must check carefully all the available information and prepare a theory of what happened, working all together. Then, open the questionnaire and answer all questions. During this phase of the game, you can speak freely about your discarded cards, or the information you remember of them. Each right answer will add two points.

—user summary

The company of the Pufferfish has arrived at the island of the Tongue of Fire in the Faraway, following the trail of Azsir's treasure. Orencio Barrilete's screams have woken everyone up. Something has stung him and it could be poisonous. You must find out all the details of what happened.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

La compañía del Pez Globo ha llegado a la isla de La Lengua de Fuego en La Lejanía, siguiendo la pista del tesoro de Azsir. Los gritos de Orencio Barrilete han despertado a todos. Algo le ha picado y podría ser venenoso. Deberéis averigur todos los detalles de lo sucedido.

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory

name: HAM-FARM
description:
【Me" and "Board Game Production."】
Nice to meet you, I'm MARU. Game Design.
I am a Tokyo-based private creator of board game design and artwork.I have been participating in the Tokyo Game Market since the spring of 2022, and the next Game Market in December 2023 will be my fourth.
We have decided to conduct a crowdfunding campaign to raise funds for the production of our new game "HAM-FARM," which will be presented at the December Game Market!
This game will be my ninth game, and it is by far the biggest game I have ever played. The components are gorgeous, and I am very particular about the game system and artwork. And, of course, it's fun!

【Play × Healing. The Story of "HAM-FARM"】
As an owner hamster, you are in charge of "running a company by hamsters for hamsters".
You scout for new hamsters from the "ham farm," a recreation area on the outskirts of the company, and sometimes build useful facilities in order to create the "best company for hamsters!
Hamsters have "effect icons" and "scores," and the player with the highest total score wins. However, hamsters with lower "score" are easier to scout and have stronger "effect icons". Players should also actively target "facility cards" that have a lasting effect!
Players can strengthen their decks with cards that have strong "effect icons," or they can aim for cards with high "score," or they can aim for bonuses by building lots of "facilities.
The interesting point is that each player's strategy is unique!

【Anyone can immediately enjoy the fun of deck building!】
While condensing the fun of a card game in which players can make "combos" and make full use of "permanent effects," the rules have been adjusted so that children can enjoy playing with other children and with their parents. The game is language-independent and can be enjoyed as soon as the five basic icons are understood!
Each player's turn is short and fast-paced, and the 154 all-unique cards change the situation each time, making the game highly replayable.
The game can be played by 2 to 5 players and supports solo play, making it a game that can be enjoyed with anyone at any time!

name: Zooloretto: Rainbow Chameleon
description:
An expansion for Zooloretto, available for free from the designers homepage at Christmas 2020.

This expansion consists of 1 tile with a Rainbow Chameleon.

Use the normal rules for Zooloretto, except for one rule: the first player, who fill his 6-space enclosure takes the Rainbow Chameleon as a bonus.

At the end of the game, the owner of the Rainbow Chameleon can change the color/type of vending stalls, at the cost of 1 coin per vending stall changed. Only the four standard colors/types are available.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Labyrinth: Disney Villains
description:
Unleash the Villains and their Henchmen! The Villains and their Henchmen find themselves trapped in a magical maze! Journey around the maze and gather a team to help you escape! Together you are stronger!

In Labyrinth, Ravensburger’s hugely popular family board game, you have to find the shortest route through the Labyrinth to win! The game is for 2-4 players aged 7 and up, and the aim is to reach all your treasures and targets as you move through the Labyrinth.

—description from the publisher

name: Assault on Fortress Moon
description:
Fortress Moon is a 2-4 player strategic war game in a 1950's alternate history.

One player take control of a faction known as the LUNAR COLONISTS, rebel miners who have taken control of the Mining Facilities on the Moon and are holding hostage the precious energy source known as ELEMENT X!

The remaining three players command the EARTH FORCES, three countries (Republic of China, USA, & USSR who have joined forces to launch wave after wave of invasions in order to reclaim their Mine-bases.

Each faction has 6 turns to complete their goals. Can the Lunar Colonists hold onto to 15 Mine-bases or with the Earth Forces take control of 16 and reclaim the Moon's resource of Element X, before the resources of Earth deplete!

FORTRESS MOON FEATURES:

5 games in 1! Endure the Ear on the Moon by playing the Full (approx. 3-4hr) or chose from 1 of 4 Scenarios for quicker game play when there just isn't enough time for a full on war!

10 Unique Miniatures designed with the golden age of science fiction pulp in mind!

Artwork from leading comic book artists, Buzz Setzer, Darryl Banks & Charles Barnett III, that truly capture that feeling of 1950's sci-fi!

STORY:

FORTRESS MOON is set in a alternate universe where WWII lasted well into the 50's. Earth's resources we're devastated, but technology brought about through the war enable humanity to reach the Moon where they discovered Element X, which when refined provides ample energy.

Mining on the Moon was rough work for the men and women there. Fatalities were high and the Miners wanted better living standards, but were refused. They soon formed a faction calling themselves the Lunar Colonists and drove off anyone that stood against them.

With Earth's new energy source under an embargo, the greatest nations of the time formed an alliance in a last ditch effort to take back their mine-bases against the rebel miners now calling themselves the Lunar Colonists.

This is where the game begins. The Lunar Colonists, owning all 30 of the Mine-bases, have converted mining equipment and even robots to help in their fight.

The Earth Forces, comprising of the United States, USSR, and Republic of China, have landed troops on the Moon to reclaim the bases, but with resources low they have only 6 Turns in which to complete their mission.

If they can reclaim at least 16 of the 30 Mine-bases the Lunar Colonists must forfeit their hold on the Moon, but if they don't succeed then Earth must recognize the Moon and the Colonists as a free State.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: The Great City of Rome: The Shrine
description:
Promo given for free when purchasing the base game at Spiel '18, consisting of four building cards and the rules.

Setup: Each player receives the shrine card with the back in his player colour as an additional hand card.

Course of the game: The shrine is dealt with like any other temple card and may be built in the action phase as usual. Unlike other temple cards, the player does not need any building points to build the shrine.

End of the game: During the final scoring, the player scores 2 victory points for each building card that is horizontally or vertically adjacent to the shrine.

name: Die Händler vom Taubertal: Das Kartenspiel
description:
This card game for 2 to 4 players adapts the classic board game with new rules and an exciting game mechanic for the whole family!

The players pick cards from the stack. These cards in four different colours have numbers from 1 to 4. In every turn, you either can draw two cards from the stack or you can play out specific cards to perform an action. But watch out for the Black Knight!

The players get goods like wine and flour and try to sell these goods for a good price. They then invest these coins in cannonballs. As soon as a player manages to own three or four cannonballs (according to the number of players) he wins the game.

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Air Cult Warrior Expansion Pack
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Air Cult Warrior Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature, upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Val Jean Expansion Pack
description:
The Val Jean was a small raider-type craft operated by the Maquis during the early 2370s. The impulse engines of Val Jean were originally built in 2332.

In 2371, while under the command of Chakotay, the Val Jean was pursued by the Cardassian warship Vetar, Gul Evek's flagship. Chakotay ordered the ship into the Badlands to try to escape the Cardassians.

After eluding pursuit, the Val Jean was scanned by a coherent tetryon beam and transported into the Delta Quadrant by the Caretaker. Once there, the crew was abducted and subjected to medical tests to determine their biological compatibility with the Caretaker. One of the crew, chief engineer B'Elanna Torres, was removed from the others and sent to the surface of the Ocampa homeworld.

In order to recover his missing crew member, Chakotay reluctantly joined forces with Starfleet captain Kathryn Janeway of the USS Voyager, who had been sent to capture him but had instead been pulled into the Delta Quadrant as well. The cooperation proved successful, and both Torres and Voyager crew member Harry Kim were rescued.

This expansion adds a new ship and a new set of cards to Star Trek: Attack Wing.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
